original: tvaṃ hyagne prathamo manotāsyā dhiyo abhavo dasma hotā🔽tvaṃ sīṃ vṛṣannakṛṇorduṣṭarītu saho viśvasmai sahase sahadhyai
analyzed: tvam hi agne prathamaḥ manotā asyāḥ dhiyaḥ abhavaḥ dasma hotā  tvam sīm vṛṣan akṛṇoḥ duṣṭarītu sahaḥ viśvasmai sahase sahadhyai
translated: For thou, O Agni, wast the first to be the mind-born of this our thought, the wondrous priest.🔽Thou, O bull, hast made her, the foe-destroyer, strong for all conquest and for victory.

original: adhā hotā nyasīdo yajīyāniḷas pada iṣayannīḍyaḥ san
analyzed: adhā hotā nyasīdaḥ yajīyān iḍaḥ pade iṣayan īḍyaḥ san
translated: Then hast thou sat down as the most adorable priest in the place of the adorable one, seeking food.

original: taṃ tvā naraḥ prathamaṃ devayanto maho rāye citayanto anu gman🔽vṛteva yantaṃ bahubhirvasavyaistve rayiṃ jāgṛvāṃso anu gman
analyzed: tam tvā naraḥ prathamam devayantaḥ mahaḥ rāye citayantaḥ anu gman  vṛtā iva yantam bahubhiḥ vasavyaiḥ tve rayim jāgṛvāṃsaḥ anu gman
translated: Thee, the first, the men who delight in the gods, seeking great wealth, have followed, thinking (of thee).🔽Thee, as if moving in a chariot, with many possessions, the thoughtful have followed for wealth.

original: ruśantamagniṃ darśataṃ bṛhantaṃ vapāvantaṃ viśvahā dīdivāṃsam🔽padaṃ devasya namasā vyantaḥ śravasyavaḥ śrava āpannamṛktam
analyzed: ruśantam agnim darśatam bṛhantam vapāvantam viśvahā dīdivāṃsam  padam devasya namasā vyantaḥ śravasyavaḥ śravaḥ āpannam ṛktam
translated: The radiant, the wondrous, the great Agni, the all-supporting, the shining,🔽The worshippers, with reverence, have approached the place of the god, seeking fame, have gained the praiseworthy.

original: nāmāni cid dadhire yajñiyāni bhadrāyāṃ te raṇayantasandṛṣṭau
analyzed: nāmāni cit dadhire yajñiyāni bhadrāyām te
translated: They have even taken names worthy of sacrifice, in thy most auspicious and delightful appearance.

original: tvāṃ vardhanti kṣitayaḥ pṛthivyāṃ tvāṃ rāya ubhayāso janānām
analyzed: tvām vardhanti kṣitayaḥ pṛthivyām tvām rāyaḥ ubhayāsaḥ janānām
translated: The people on earth exalt thee, the two classes of men (the nobles and the priests) for wealth.

original: tvaṃ trātā taraṇe cetyo bhūḥ pitā mātā sadamin mānuṣāṇām
analyzed: tvam trātā taraṇe cetyaḥ bhūḥ pitā mātā sadamidh mānuṣāṇām
translated: Thou art the protector, to be invoked in crossing, the father, the mother, ever present to men.

original: saparyeṇyaḥ sa priyo vikṣvagnirhotā mandro ni ṣasādā yajīyān
analyzed: saparyeṇyaḥ sa priyaḥ vikṣu agniḥ hotā mandraḥ ni ṣasāda ā yajīyān
translated: He who is to be sought, he who is dear in many places, Agni, the delightful priest, has sat down as the most adorable.

original: taṃ tvā vayaṃ dama ā dīdivāṃsamupa jñubādho namasā sadema🔽taṃ tvā vayaṃ sudhyo navyamagnesumnāyava īmahe devayantaḥ
analyzed: tam tvā vayam dame ā dīdivāṃsam upa jñubādhaḥ namasā sadema  tam tvā vayam sudhyaḥ navyam agne sumnāyavaḥ īmahe devayantaḥ
translated: We would sit down near thee, O shining one, at the sacrifice, with bent knees and adoration🔽We, O Agni, desirous of the gods, implore thee, the pure one, the new one, for our welfare

original: tvaṃ viśo anayo dīdyāno divo agne bṛhatā rocanena
analyzed: tvam viśaḥ anayaḥ dīdyānaḥ divaḥ agne bṛhatā rocanena
translated: Thou, O Agni, shining, hast been led forth by the people, O god, with the great light of heaven

original: viśāṃ kaviṃ viśpatiṃ śaśvatīnāṃ nitośanaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ carṣaṇīnām🔽pretīṣaṇimiṣayantaṃ pāvakaṃ rājantamagniṃ yajataṃ rayīṇām
analyzed: viśām kavim viśpatim śaśvatīnām nitośanam vṛṣabham carṣaṇīnām  pretīṣaṇim iṣayantam pāvakam rājantam agnim yajatam rayīṇām
translated: The sage of all the ancient people, the lord of the people, the ever-kindling bull of men🔽The active, purifying Agni, the shining one, the king, the one to be worshipped of all riches

original: so agna īje śaśame ca marto yasta ānaṭ samidhā havyadātim
analyzed: saḥ agne īje śaśame ca martaḥ yaḥ te ānaṭ samidhā havya dātim
translated: That mortal, O Agni, who has brought thee, the guest, with fuel and oblation, has worshipped and served thee

original: ya āhutiṃ pari vedā namobhirviśvet sa vāmā dadhatetvotaḥ🔽asmā u te mahi mahe vidhema namobhiragne samidhota havyaiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ āhutim pari veda namobhiḥ viśvā id sa vāmā dadhat itvā ūtaḥ  asmai u te mahi mahe vidhema namobhiḥ agne samidhā uta havyaiḥ
translated: He who knows the offering and reverences it with homage, all his desires are fulfilled, O thou who art to be invoked🔽To him, O Agni, we will offer great praise with homage and oblations, O thou who art kindled with fuel

original: vedī sūno sahaso gīrbhirukthairā te bhadrāyāṃ sumatauyatema
analyzed: vedī sūno sahasaḥ gīrbhiḥ ukthaiḥ ā te bhadrāyām sumatau
translated: O son of strength, we would serve thee with songs and praises in thy auspicious and good favour

original: ā yastatantha rodasī vi bhāsā śravobhiśca śravasyastarutraḥ
analyzed: ā yaḥ tatantha rodasī vi bhāsā śravobhiḥ ca śravasyaḥ tarutraḥ
translated: He who hath spread out the two worlds with his radiance, the famous one, the victorious one, with his glories

original: bṛhadbhirvājai sthavirebhirasme revadbhiragne vitaraṃ vi bhāhi
analyzed: bṛhadbhiḥ vājaiḥ sthavirebhiḥ asme revadbhiḥ agne vitaram vi bhāhi
translated: With great strength, O Agni, with old age, with prosperity, shine thou forth for us with thy light

original: nṛvad vaso sadamid dhehyasme bhūri tokāya tanayāya paśvaḥ
analyzed: nṛvat vaso sadam id dhehi asme bhūri tokāya tanayāya paśvaḥ
translated: O Vasu, come to us as to men, always, for abundant offspring and cattle

original: pūrvīriṣo bṛhatīrāreaghā asme bhadrā sauśravasāni santu🔽purūṇyagne purudhā tvāyā vasūni rājan vasutā te aśyām
analyzed: pūrvīḥ iṣaḥ bṛhatīḥ āreaghāḥ asme bhadrā sauśravasāni santu  purūṇi agne purudhā tvāyā vasūni rājan vasu tā te aśyām
translated: Many are the early abundant and mighty blessings, may they be good for us, O Agni, may they be good for us🔽Many are the treasures, O Agni, in many ways through your greatness, O king, may I obtain them from you

original: purūṇi hi tve puruvāra santyagne vasu vidhate rājani tve
analyzed: purūṇi hi tve puru vāra santi agne vasu vidhate rājani tve
translated: For you, O Agni, have many treasures, O you who distribute, O king, you have treasures

original: tvaṃ hi kṣaitavad yaśo 'gne mitro na patyase
analyzed: tvam hi kṣaitavat yaśaḥ gne mitraḥ na patyase
translated: For you, O Agni, are the fame of the Kshatriyas, you shine as a lord like Mitra

original: tvaṃ vicarṣaṇe śravo vaso puṣṭiṃ na puṣyasi
analyzed: tvam vicarṣaṇe śravaḥ vaso puṣṭim na puṣyasi
translated: You, O active one, O Vasu, promote glory like prosperity

original: tvāṃ hi ṣmā carṣaṇayo yajñebhirgīrbhirīḷate
analyzed: tvām hi sma carṣaṇayaḥ yajñebhiḥ gīrbhiḥ īḍate
translated: For you, O Agni, the people with sacrifices and songs delight themselves

original: tvāṃ vājī yātyavṛko rajastūrviśvacarṣaṇiḥ🔽sajoṣastvā divo naro yajñasya ketumindhate
analyzed: tvām vājī yāti avṛkaḥ rajastūrviśvacarṣaṇiḥ  sajoṣaḥ tvā divaḥ naraḥ yajñasya ketum indhate
translated: The strong one, the wolf-slayer, the swift one, the all-people's friend, goes to you🔽The men of heaven, of one accord, kindle you, the banner of the sacrifice

original: yad dha sya mānuṣo janaḥ sumnāyurjuhve adhvare
analyzed: yat ha sya mānuṣaḥ janaḥ sumnāyuḥ juhve adhvare
translated: When the human people, seeking bliss, offer sacrifice in the rite

original: ṛdhad yaste sudānave dhiyā martaḥ śaśamate
analyzed: ṛdhat yaḥ te sudānave dhiyā martaḥ śaśamate
translated: The mortal who, O you of good gifts, strives with his thought to win you

original: ūtī ṣa bṛhato divo dviṣo aṃho na tarati
analyzed: ūtī sa bṛhataḥ divaḥ dviṣaḥ aṃhaḥ na tarati
translated: The foe does not cross over your help, O you of the great heaven, the distress

original: samidhā yasta āhutiṃ niśitiṃ martyo naśat
analyzed: samidhā yaḥ te āhutim niśitim martyaḥ naśat
translated: The mortal who offers fuel and oblation, who seeks your protection

original: vayāvantaṃsa puṣyati kṣayamagne śatāyuṣam
analyzed: vayāvantam sa puṣyati kṣayam agne śata āyuṣam
translated: You promote the dwelling of the aged, O Agni, to a hundred years of life

original: tveṣaste dhūma ṛṇvati divi ṣañchukra ātataḥ
analyzed: tveṣaḥ te dhūmaḥ ṛṇvati divi ṣan śukraḥ ātataḥ
translated: Thy smoke asketh for the light, thy bright flame is stretched out in heaven

original: sūro na hi dyutā tvaṃ kṛpā pāvaka rocase
analyzed: sūraḥ na hi dyutā tvam kṛpā pāvaka rocase
translated: For thou art like the sun in splendour, O purifying Agni, thou shinest

original: adhā hi vikṣvīḍyo 'si priyo no atithiḥ
analyzed: adhā hi vikṣvīḍyaḥ si priyaḥ naḥ atithiḥ
translated: Now, indeed, thou art to be overcome in all places, a dear guest to us

original: raṇvaḥ purīva jūryaḥ sūnurna trayayāyyaḥ
analyzed: raṇvaḥ puri iva jūryaḥ sūnuḥ na trayayāyyaḥ
translated: Cheerful, like an old man in the city, a son to be honoured with the three (sacrificial fires)

original: kratvā hi droṇe ajyase 'gne vājī na kṛtvyaḥ🔽parijmevasvadhā gayo 'tyo na hvāryaḥ śiśuḥ🔽tvaṃ tyā cidacyutāgne paśurna yavase
analyzed: kratvā hi droṇe ajyase gne vājī na kṛtvyaḥ  parijmā iva svadhā gayaḥ tyaḥ na hvāryaḥ śiśuḥ  tvam tyā cit acyutā agne paśuḥ na yavase
translated: For by wisdom thou art kindled in the trough, O Agni, like a strong horse🔽Like a swift steed, a child, a bull, a bird, a falcon🔽Thou, O Agni, art even of those that are unmoved, like a beast in the pasture

original: dhāmā ha yat te ajara vanā vṛścanti śikvasaḥ🔽veṣi hyadhvarīyatāmagne hotā dame viśām
analyzed: dhāmā ha yat te ajara vanā vṛścanti śikvasaḥ  veṣi hi adhvarīyatām agne hotā dame viśām
translated: When, O thou that art undecaying, the woods are cleft by thy flames🔽For thou art to be approached as one who is to be worshipped, O Agni, as a priest in the house of the people

original: samṛdho viśpate kṛṇu juṣasva havyamaṅgiraḥ
analyzed: samṛdhaḥ viśpate kṛṇu juṣasva havyam aṅgiraḥ
translated: O lord of the people, make our prosperity increase, accept the oblation, O Angiras

original: achā no mitramaho deva devānagne vocaḥ sumatiṃ rodasyoḥ
analyzed: achā naḥ mitra mahas deva devān agne vocaḥ sumatim rodasyoḥ
translated: Come to us, O Agni, the great friend, speak to the gods, the favour of the two world-halves

original: vīhi svastiṃ sukṣitiṃ divo nṝn dviṣo aṃhāṃsi duritātarema tā tarema tavāvasā tarema
analyzed: vīhi svastim su kṣitim divaḥ nṝn dviṣaḥ aṃhāṃsi duritā atarema tā tarema tava avasā tarema
translated: Go to the prosperity, to the good abode of the men of heaven, may we pass over the hateful, the evil, may we pass over by thy help, may we pass over

original: agne sa kṣeṣad ṛtapā ṛtejā uru jyotirnaśate devayuṣ ṭe
analyzed: agne sa kṣeṣat ṛta pāḥ ṛta ejāḥ uru jyotiḥ naśate devayuḥ te
translated: O Agni, he who, O finder of the place, is righteous by law, by law powerful, shines with wide light, is godly among you

original: yaṃ tvaṃ mitreṇa varuṇaḥ sajoṣā deva pāsi tyajasā martamaṃhaḥ
analyzed: yam tvam mitreṇa varuṇaḥ sajoṣāḥ deva pāsi tyajasā martam aṃhaḥ
translated: Whom, O god, thou, O Varuna, of one mind with Mitra, guardest with thy Tvashtar-nature from the sin of a mortal

original: īje yajñebhih śaśame śamībhirṛdhadvārāyāgnaye dadāśa
analyzed: īje yajñebhiḥ śaśame śamībhiḥ ṛdha dvārāya agnaye dadāśa
translated: He has worshipped with sacrifices, served with offerings, given to Agni who opens wide the doors

original: evā cana taṃ yaśasāmajuṣṭirnāṃho martaṃ naśate na pradṛptiḥ
analyzed: evā cana tam yaśasām ajuṣṭiḥ na aṃhaḥ martam naśate na pradṛptiḥ
translated: Even so his glory is not to be surpassed, neither grief nor pride overtakes the mortal man

original: sūro na yasya dṛśatirarepā bhīmā yadeti śucatasta ā dhīḥ
analyzed: sūraḥ na yasya dṛśatiḥ arepāḥ bhīmā yadā iti śucataḥ te ā dhīḥ
translated: Whose eye is not dimmed, whose thought is bright when he comes forth, like the sun, terrible

original: heṣasvataḥ śurudho nāyamaktoḥ kutrā cid raṇvo vasatirvanejāḥ
analyzed: heṣasvataḥ śurudhaḥ na ayam aktoḥ kutrā cit raṇvaḥ vasatiḥ vanejāḥ
translated: Of him the swift, the wealthy, the one who is to be invoked, the forest-dweller, the kind one, is somewhere a dwelling-place

original: tigmaṃ cidema mahi varpo asya bhasadaśvo na yamasāna āsā
analyzed: tigmam cidema mahi varpaḥ asya bhasadaśvaḥ na yamasānaḥ āsā
translated: Even his fierce form is great, like a swift horse, when he comes to his appointed place

original: vijehamānaḥ paraśurna jihvāṃ dravirna drāvayati dāru dhakṣat
analyzed: vijehamānaḥ paraśuḥ na jihvām draviḥ na drāvayati dāru dhakṣat
translated: Like an axe he cuts off the tongue, like a melting substance he melts the wood he burns

original: sa idasteva prati dhādasiṣyañchiśīta tejo 'yaso na dhārām🔽citradhrajatiraratiryo aktorverna druṣadvā raghupatmajaṃhāḥ
analyzed: saḥ idastā iva prati dhāt asiṣyan śiśīta tejaḥ yasaḥ na dhārām  citra dhrajatiḥ aratiḥ yaḥ aktu ūrveḥ na druṣadvā raghu patma jaṃhāḥ
translated: He has laid down his weapon as if he were tired, he has sharpened his edge like a blade of iron🔽He who is borne on variegated paths, who is to be invoked, who is more impetuous than the wind, whose food is the son of Raghupat

original: sa īṃ rebho na prati vasta usrāḥ śociṣā rārapīti mitramahāḥ
analyzed: saḥ īm rebhaḥ na prati vaste usrāḥ śociṣā rārapīti mitra mahāḥ
translated: He, like a singer, shines forth at night, he shines with his flame, great in his friendship

original: naktaṃ ya īmaruṣo yo divā nṝnamartyo aruṣo yo divā nṝn
analyzed: naktam yaḥ īm aruṣaḥ yaḥ divā nṝn amartyaḥ aruṣaḥ yaḥ divā nṝn
translated: He who is red at night, who is red among men by day, the immortal red one among men by day

original: divo na yasya vidhato navīnod vṛṣā rukṣa oṣadhīṣu nūnot
analyzed: divaḥ na yasya vidhataḥ navīnot vṛṣā rukṣaḥ oṣadhīṣu nūnot
translated: Whose new and fresh form is like that of the sky, the strong one is generated among the plants

original: ghṛṇā na yo dhrajasā patmanā yannā rodasī vasunādaṃ supatnī
analyzed: ghṛṇā na yaḥ dhrajasā patmanā yat nā rodasī vasu nādam su patnī
translated: He who moves swiftly with heat, who is to be worshipped, who fills the two worlds with wealth, with a good wife

original: dhāyobhirvā yo yujyebhirarkairvidyun na davidyot svebhiḥśuṣmaih
analyzed: dhāyobhiḥ vā yaḥ yujyebhiḥ arkaiḥ vidyut na davidyot svebhiḥ śuṣmaiḥ
translated: He who is yoked with the rays and the hymns, who shines with his own flames like lightning

original: śardho vā yo marutāṃ tatakṣa ṛbhurna tveṣorabhasāno adyaut
analyzed: śardhaḥ vā yaḥ marutām tatakṣa ṛbhuḥ na tveṣoḥ rabhasānaḥ adyaut
translated: Or he who fashioned the host of the Maruts, the ruddy one, the swift one, the shining one

original: yathā hotarmanuṣo devatātā yajñebhiḥ sūno sahaso yajāsi🔽evā no adya samanā samānānuśannagna uśato yakṣi devān
analyzed: yathā hotar manuṣaḥ devatātā yajñebhiḥ sūno sahasaḥ yajāsi  eva naḥ adya samanā samānān uśan agne uśataḥ yakṣi devān
translated: As you, O Hotar, worship the gods among men, O son of strength, with sacrifices🔽So, O Agni, today, O you who are to be worshipped, bring the eager gods to us who are equal

original: sa no vibhāvā cakṣaṇirna vastoragnirvandāru vedyaścano dhāt
analyzed: sa naḥ vibhāvā cakṣaṇiḥ na vastoḥ agniḥ vandāru vedyaḥ canaḥ dhāt
translated: May Agni, the illuminator, the protector, the guest, the knower of beings, grant us joy

original: viśvāyuryo amṛto martyeṣūṣarbhud bhūdatithirjātavedāḥ
analyzed: viśvāyuḥ yaḥ amṛtaḥ martyeṣu uṣarbudh bhūt atithiḥ jātavedāḥ
translated: The all-living, immortal one among mortals, the ever-present, the all-knowing one

original: dyāvo na yasya panayantyabhvaṃ bhāsāṃsi vaste sūryo na śukraḥ
analyzed: dyāvaḥ na yasya panayanti abhvam bhāsāṃsi vaste sūryaḥ na śukraḥ
translated: Whose glory the heavens proclaim, who wears the lights like the bright sun

original: vi ya inotyajaraḥ pāvako 'śnasya cicchiśnathat pūrvyāṇi
analyzed: vi yaḥ inoti ajaraḥ pāvakaḥ śnasya cit śiśnathat pūrvyāṇi
translated: He who moves, the undecaying purifier, who conquers the ancient evils

original: vadmā hi sūno asyadmasadvā cakre agnirjanuṣājmānnam
analyzed: vadmā hi sūno asi adma sad vā cakre agniḥ januṣā ajma annam
translated: For he, O son, is the singer, the enjoyer of food; Agni, at birth, made food by his power

original: sa tvaṃ na ūrjasana ūrjaṃ dhā rājeva jeravṛke kṣeṣyantaḥ🔽nitikti yo vāraṇamannamatti vāyurna rāṣṭryatyetyaktūn
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ ūrja sane ūrjam dhāḥ rājā iva jeravṛke kṣeṣyantaḥ  nitikti yaḥ vāraṇam annam atti vāyuḥ na rāṣṭrī atyeti aktūn
translated: You, O son of strength, bestow strength upon us, like a king in his own house, O you who are to be worshipped🔽He who eats the food of the one to be restrained, like the wind, the king, passes over the oblations

original: turyāma yasta ādiśāmarātīratyo na hrutaḥ patataḥ parihrut
analyzed: turyāma yaḥ te ādiśām arātīratyaḥ na hrutaḥ patataḥ parihrut
translated: He who conquers the four quarters, the evil spirits, like a swift bird flies away from the snare

original: ā sūryo na bhānumadbhirarkairagne tatantha rodasī vi bhāsā
analyzed: ā sūryaḥ na bhānumadbhiḥ arkaiḥ agne tatantha rodasī vi bhāsā
translated: As Sûrya with his bright beams, O Agni, thou hast spread out the two world-halves with thy light

original: citro nayat pari tamāṃsyaktaḥ śociṣā patmannauśijo na dīyan
analyzed: citraḥ nayat pari tamāṃsi aktaḥ śociṣā patman auśijaḥ na dīyan
translated: The wondrous One, the bright, hath led away the darkness, as Âushija, the swift, hath led away the water

original: tvāṃ hi mandratamamarkaśokairvavṛmahe mahi naḥ śroṣyagne
analyzed: tvām hi mandratamam arka śokaiḥ vavṛmahe mahi naḥ śroṣi agne
translated: Thee, O most delightful, we have chosen with our hymns, O Agni: hear thou great things from us

original: indraṃ na tvā śavasā devatā vāyuṃ pṛṇanti rādhasānṛtamāḥ
analyzed: indram na tvā śavasā devatāḥ vāyum pṛṇanti rādhasā anṛtamāḥ
translated: The deities, O Agni, with their strength, with their gifts, honour thee as a second Indra, as Vâyu

original: nū no agne 'vṛkebhiḥ svasti veṣi rāyaḥ pathibhiḥ parṣyaṃhaḥ
analyzed: nu naḥ agne vṛkebhiḥ svasti veṣi rāyaḥ pathibhiḥ parṣi aṃhaḥ
translated: Now, O Agni, with thy propitious paths lead us to wealth: do thou deliver us from woe

original: tā sūribhyo gṛṇate rāsi sumnaṃ madema śatahimāḥsuvīrāḥ
analyzed: tā sūribhyaḥ gṛṇate rāsi sumnam madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: Bestow that favour on the princes who sing thy praise: may we have brave sons and pass a hundred winters

original: huve vaḥ sūnuṃ sahaso yuvānamadroghavācaṃ matibhiryaviṣṭham
analyzed: huve vaḥ sūnum sahasaḥ yuvānam adrogha vācam matibhiḥ yaviṣṭham
translated: I call on you, the youthful Son of Strength, whose speech is guileless, most exalted with my thoughts

original: ya invati draviṇāni pracetā viśvavārāṇi puruvāroadhruk
analyzed: yaḥ invati draviṇāni pracetāḥ viśva vārāṇi puru vāraḥ adhruk
translated: Who, wise, impels to bounty riches manifold, the chooser of all boons, the ever-youthful One

original: tve vasūni purvaṇīka hotardoṣā vastorerire yajñiyāsaḥ
analyzed: tve vasūni purvaṇīka hotar doṣā vastoḥ erire yajñiyāsaḥ
translated: In thee, O Priest, O thou of ancient sway, are treasures which the holy ones have brought

original: kṣāmeva viśvā bhuvanāni yasmin saṃ saubhagāni dadhirepāvake🔽tvaṃ vikṣu pradivaḥ sīda āsu kratvā rathīrabhavo vāryāṇām
analyzed: kṣāma iva viśvā bhuvanāni yasmin sam saubhagāni  tvam vikṣu pradivaḥ sīdaḥ āsu kratvā rathīra bhavaḥ vāryāṇām
translated: In whom, in the all-bounteous one, as in the heaven, all blessings have their home🔽Thou, O God, hast sat down in these families: by wisdom thou hast become the charioteer of boons

original: ata inoṣi vidhate cikitvo vyānuṣag jātavedo vasūni
analyzed: atas inoṣi vidhate cikitvaḥ vyānuṣak jātavedaḥ vasūni
translated: From him, O all-knower, thou, the wise, bestowest on him who offereth gifts, as is thy wont, all treasures, O thou Jâtavedas

original: yo naḥ sanutyo abhidāsadagne yo antaro mitramaho vanuṣyāt
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ sanutyaḥ abhidāsat agne yaḥ antaraḥ mitra mahas vanuṣyāt
translated: O Agni, whoever from his native place, O thou whose friends are mighty, would injure us,

original: tamajarebhirvṛṣabhistava svaistapā tapiṣṭha tapasā tapasvān
analyzed: tam ajarebhiḥ vṛṣabhiḥ tava svaiḥ tapa tapiṣṭha tapasā tapasvān
translated: Scorch him with thine own most burning heat, O thou most hot, with thine own undecaying flames.

original: yaste yajñena samidhā ya ukthairarkebhiḥ sūno sahaso dadāśat
analyzed: yaḥ te yajñena samidhā yaḥ ukthaiḥ arkebhiḥ sūno sahasaḥ dadāśat
translated: He who with sacrifice, with fuel, with lauds, with hymns, O Son of Strength, hath worshipped thee,

original: sa martyeṣvamṛta pracetā rāyā dyumnena śravasā vi bhāti🔽sa tat kṛdhīṣitastūyamagne spṛdho bādhasva sahasā sahasvān🔽yacchasyase dyubhirakto vacobhistajjuṣasva jariturghoṣi manma
analyzed: sa martyeṣu amṛta pracetāḥ rāyā dyumnena śravasā vi bhāti  sa tat kṛdhi iṣita stūyam agne spṛdhaḥ bādhasva sahasā sahasvān  yat śasyase dyubhiḥ aktaḥ vacobhiḥ tat juṣasva jarituḥ ghoṣi manma
translated: He, immortal, wise among mankind, shineth with wealth, with glory, with renown.🔽Do this, O Agni, thou who art to be invoked and praised: with might, O mighty one, crush down our foes.🔽When thou art worshipped with bright flames and hymns, accept the singer's song and this my hymn.

original: aśyāma taṃ kāmamagne tavotī aśyāma rayiṃ rayivaḥ suvīram
analyzed: aśyāma tam kāmam agne tava ūtī aśyāma rayim rayivas su vīram
translated: Through thee, O Agni, may we gain the wish we crave, gain wealth, O wealthy one, with noble heroes.

original: aśyāma vājamabhi vājayanto 'śyāma dyumnamajarājaraṃ te
analyzed: aśyāma vājam abhi vājayantaḥ śyāma dyumnam ajara ajaram te
translated: May we gain strength, O thou who givest strength, may we gain glory that shall never fade.

original: pra navyasā sahasaḥ sūnumachā yajñena gātumava ichamānaḥ
analyzed: pra navyasā sahasaḥ sūnumachāḥ yajñena gātumavaḥ ichamānaḥ
translated: With newest song I seek the Son of Strength, desirous of obtaining by sacrifice a way.

original: vṛścadvanaṃ kṛṣṇayāmaṃ ruśantaṃ vītī hotārandivyaṃ jigāti
analyzed: vṛścat vanam kṛṣṇa yāmam ruśantam vītī hotāran divyam jigāti
translated: He cleaveth the black-backed wood that shineth: the priest goeth to the heavenly place.

original: sa śvitānastanyatū rocanasthā ajarebhirnānadadbhiryaviṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: sa śvitāna stanyatuḥ rocana sthāḥ ajarebhiḥ nānadadbhiḥ yaviṣṭhaḥ
translated: He, white-backed, with his back of light, most youthful, with his never-failing voices.

original: yaḥ pāvakaḥ purutamaḥ purūṇi pṛthūnyagniranuyāti bharvan
analyzed: yaḥ pāvakaḥ purutamaḥ purūṇi pṛthūni agniḥ anuyāti bharvan
translated: He who is pure, most manifold, O Agni, goeth through many wide-spread regions bearing (the oblations).

original: vi te viṣvag vātajūtāso agne bhāmāsaḥ śuce śucayaścaranti
analyzed: vi te viṣvak vāta jūtāsaḥ agne bhāmāsaḥ śuce śucayaḥ caranti
translated: Thy flames, O pure Agni, pure and wind-impelled, spread out in all directions, O thou of wondrous deeds

original: tuvimrakṣāso divyā navagvā vanā vananti dhṛṣatā rujantaḥ
analyzed: tuvi mrakṣāsaḥ divyāḥ navagvāḥ vanā vananti dhṛṣatā rujantaḥ
translated: The heavenly Navagvas, of great might, with daring, rend the woods, the woods, O thou of wondrous deeds

original: ye te śukrāsaḥ śucayaḥ śuciṣmaḥ kṣāṃ vapanti viṣitāso aśvāḥ🔽adha bhramasta urviyā vi bhāti yātayamāno adhi sānu pṛśneḥ🔽adha jihvā pāpatīti pra vṛṣṇo goṣuyudho nāśaniḥ sṛjānā
analyzed: ye te śukrāsaḥ śucayaḥ śuciṣmas kṣām vapanti viṣitāsaḥ aśvāḥ  adha bhramastaḥ urviyā vi bhāti yātayamānaḥ adhi sānu pṛśneḥ  adha jihvā pāpatīti pra vṛṣṇaḥ goṣuyudhaḥ na aśaniḥ sṛjānā
translated: Thy pure bright sparks, O thou of pure bright splendour, O Agni, thy horses, when they are loosed, cleave the earth🔽Then the flame shines far and wide, urged on, above the ridge of Pr̥iṣni's son🔽Then the tongue of the mighty one, falling on the wicked, the arrow of the warrior, is shot forth

original: śūrasyeva prasitiḥ kṣātiragnerdurvarturbhīmo dayate vanāni
analyzed: śūrasya iva prasitiḥ kṣātiḥ agneḥ durvartuḥ bhīmaḥ dayate vanāni
translated: The destruction of Agni is like the destruction of a hero: terrible, he lays low the woods

original: ā bhānunā pārthivāni jrayāṃsi mahastodasya dhṛṣatā tatantha
analyzed: ā bhānunā pārthivāni jrayāṃsi mahas todasya dhṛṣatā tatantha
translated: With thy light thou hast spread abroad with thy might the shining things that are on earth, O mighty one

original: sa bādhasvāpa bhayā sahobhi spṛdho vanuṣyan vanuṣo ni jūrva🔽sa citra citraṃ citayantamasme citrakṣatra citratamaṃ vayodhām
analyzed: sa bādhasva apa bhayā sahobhi spṛdhaḥ vanuṣyan vanuṣaḥ ni jūrva  sa citra citram citayantam asme citra kṣatra citratamam vayaḥ dhām
translated: With thy powers, O Agni, drive away all fear: burn up the foe, O thou who lovest praise, as one who longs for booty burns🔽O thou of wondrous deeds, wondrous, wondrous art thou to us: thou givest life, O thou of wondrous power, O thou of wondrous deeds

original: candraṃ rayiṃ puruvīraṃ bṛhantaṃ candra candrābhirgṛṇate yuvasva
analyzed: candram rayim puru vīram bṛhantam candra candrābhiḥ gṛṇate yuvasva
translated: Grant to the singer, O thou of wondrous deeds, wondrous wealth in many heroes, wondrous, vast, and bright

original: mūrdhānaṃ divo aratiṃ pṛthivyā vaiśvānaram ṛta ā jātamagnim
analyzed: mūrdhānam divaḥ aratim pṛthivyāḥ vaiśvānaram ṛte ā jātam agnim
translated: Vaisvânara, born in the seat of holy order, the head of Dyaus, the envoy of the earth,

original: kaviṃ samrājamatithiṃ janānāmāsannā pātraṃ janayanta devāḥ
analyzed: kavim samrājam atithim janānām āsannā pātram janayanta devāḥ
translated: The wise, the king, the guest of men, the gods have generated the vessel that is near.

original: nābhiṃ yajñānāṃ sadanaṃ rayīṇāṃ mahāmāhāvamabhisaṃ navanta
analyzed: nābhim yajñānām sadanam rayīṇām mahā māhāvam abhisam navanta
translated: They praise him, the navel of sacrifices, the seat of riches, the great invocation.

original: vaiśvānaraṃ rathyamadhvarāṇāṃ yajñasya ketuṃ janayanta devāḥ
analyzed: vaiśvānaram rathyam adhvarāṇām yajñasya ketum janayanta devāḥ
translated: The gods have generated Vaiśvānara, the chariot of sacrifices, the banner of the sacrifice.

original: tvad vipro jāyate vājyagne tvad vīrāso abhimātiṣāhaḥ
analyzed: tvat vipraḥ jāyate vājī agne tvat vīrāsaḥ abhimātiṣāhaḥ
translated: From you, O Agni, the wise one is born, the strong one; from you the heroes who conquer the foe.

original: vaiśvānara tvamasmāsu dhehi vasūni rājan spṛhayāyyāṇi
analyzed: vaiśvānara tvam asmāsu dhehi vasūni rājan spṛhayāyyāṇi
translated: O Vaiśvānara, O king, bestow upon us riches that are desirable.

original: tvāṃ viśve amṛta jāyamānaṃ śiśuṃ na devā abhi saṃ navante
analyzed: tvām viśve amṛta jāyamānam śiśum na devāḥ abhi sam navante
translated: All the immortal gods praise you, O immortal one, as you are born, as if a child.

original: tava kratubhiramṛtatvamāyan vaiśvānara yat pitroradīdeḥ
analyzed: tava kratubhiḥ amṛta tvam āyan vaiśvānara yat pitroḥ adīdeḥ
translated: By your powers, O Vaiśvānara, they attained immortality, when you shone forth from the parents.

original: vaiśvānara tava tāni vratāni mahānyagne nakirā dadharṣa
analyzed: vaiśvānara tava tāni vratāni mahāni agne nakirā dadharṣa
translated: O Vaiśvānara, O Agni, none transgresses those great vows of yours.

original: yajjāyamānaḥ pitrorupasthe 'vindaḥ ketuṃ vayuneṣvahnām
analyzed: yat jāyamānaḥ pitroḥ upasthe vindaḥ ketum vayuneṣu ahnām
translated: When you, being born, found the banner in the lap of the parents, in the separations of the days.

original: vaiśvānarasya vimitāni cakṣasā sānūni divo amṛtasya ketunā
analyzed: vaiśvānarasya vimitāni cakṣasā sānūni divaḥ amṛtasya ketunā
translated: The ridges of the sky of Vaiśvānara are measured by his eye, by the banner of the immortal.

original: tasyedu viśvā bhuvanādhi mūrdhani vayā iva ruruhuḥsapta visruhaḥ
analyzed: tasya idu viśvā bhuvanā adhi mūrdhani vayāḥ iva ruruhuḥ sapta visruhaḥ
translated: On his head are all these beings, as if the seven extended tongues have grown up.

original: vi yo rajāṃsyamimīta sukraturvaiśvānaro vi divo rocanā kaviḥ
analyzed: vi yaḥ rajāṃsi amimīta sukratuḥ vaiśvānaraḥ vi divaḥ rocanā kaviḥ
translated: He who, of great wisdom, has measured out the regions, Vaiśvānara, the wise one, the luminous realms of heaven,

original: pari yo viśvā bhuvanāni paprathe 'dabdho gopā amṛtasya rakṣitā
analyzed: pari yaḥ viśvā bhuvanāni paprathe dabdhaḥ gopāḥ amṛtasya rakṣitā
translated: He who hath spread out over all existing things, the undeceivable guardian, the protector of immortality

original: pṛkṣasya vṛṣṇo aruṣasya nū sahaḥ pra nu vocaṃ vidathājātavedasaḥ
analyzed: pṛkṣasya vṛṣṇaḥ aruṣasya nu sahaḥ pra nu vocam vidathā jātavedasaḥ
translated: The strength of the red bull of the rain, I will now proclaim the ancient ordinances of Jātavedas

original: vaiśvānarāya matirnavyasī śuciḥ soma ivapavate cāruragnaye
analyzed: vaiśvānarāya matiḥ navyasī śuciḥ somaḥ iva pavate cāruḥ agnaye
translated: A pure and new hymn flows forth to Vaiśvānara Agni, lovely like the Soma

original: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyomani vratānyagnirvratapā arakṣata
analyzed: sa jāyamānaḥ parame vyomani vratāni agniḥ vrata pāḥ arakṣata
translated: When he was born in the highest heaven, Agni, the guardian of vows, guarded the vows

original: vyantarikṣamamimīta sukraturvaiśvānaro mahinā nākamaspṛśat
analyzed: vi antarikṣam amimīta sukratuḥ vaiśvānaraḥ mahinā nākam aspṛśat
translated: The wise one measured out the atmosphere, Vaiśvānara, with his greatness, touched the sky

original: vyastabhnād rodasī mitro adbhuto 'ntarvāvadakṛṇojjyotiṣā tamaḥ
analyzed: vyastabhnāt rodasī mitraḥ adbhutaḥ ntar vāva akṛṇot jyotiṣā tamaḥ
translated: He, the wondrous Mitra, spread out the two worlds, and with his light made darkness visible within

original: vi carmaṇīva dhiṣaṇe avartayad vaiśvānaro viśvamadhatta vṛṣṇyam
analyzed: vi carmaṇī iva dhiṣaṇe avartayat vaiśvānaraḥ viśvam adhatta vṛṣṇyam
translated: He turned the two bowls apart as if they were skins, Vaiśvānara bestowed all manly power

original: apāmupasthe mahiṣā agṛbhṇata viśo rājānamupa tasthurṛgmiyam🔽ā dūto agnimabharad vivasvato vaiśvānaraṃ mātariśvā parāvataḥ
analyzed: apām upasthe mahiṣāḥ agṛbhṇata viśaḥ rājānam upa tasthuḥ ṛgmiyam  ā dūtaḥ agnim abharat vivasvataḥ vaiśvānaram mātariśvā parāvataḥ
translated: The great ones seized him in the lap of the waters, the people attended on the king worthy of praise🔽From the far side, Vivasvan's messenger, Mātariśvan, brought Agni Vaiśvānara

original: yugeyuge vidathyaṃ gṛṇadbhyo 'gne rayiṃ yaśasaṃ dhehi navyasīm
analyzed: yuge yuge vidathyam gṛṇadbhyaḥ gne rayim yaśasam dhehi navyasīm
translated: In every age, O Agni, bestow upon the singers wealth that is glorious and new

original: pavyeva rājannaghaśaṃsamajara nīcā ni vṛśca vaninaṃ na tejasā
analyzed: pavyā iva rājan agha śaṃsam ajara nīcā ni vṛśca vaninam na tejasā
translated: O king, like a fletcher with his shaft, O ageless one, cut down the wicked one, as with a flame the wood

original: asmākamagne maghavatsu dhārayānāmi kṣatramajaraṃ suvīryam
analyzed: asmākam agne maghavatsu dhāraya anāmi kṣatram ajaram su vīryam
translated: O Agni, among our wealthy patrons, bestow on us imperishable lordship and heroic strength.

original: vayaṃ jayema śatinaṃ sahasriṇaṃ vaiśvānara vājamagne tavotibhiḥ
analyzed: vayam jayema śatinam sahasriṇam vaiśvānara vājam agne tava ūtibhiḥ
translated: O Vaiśvānara Agni, through your help, may we win a hundredfold, a thousandfold strength.

original: adabdhebhistava gopābhiriṣṭe 'smākaṃ pāhi triṣadhastha sūrīn
analyzed: adabdhebhiḥ tava gopābhiḥ iṣṭe smākam pāhi triṣadhastha sūrīn
translated: Be pleased with us, O Agni, with your unfailing, watchful guardians. Protect our princes who dwell in the three worlds.

original: rakṣā ca no daduṣāṃ śardho agne vaiśvānara pra catārī stavānaḥ
analyzed: rakṣā ca naḥ daduṣām śardhaḥ agne vaiśvānara pra catārī stavānaḥ
translated: Protect us, O Agni Vaiśvānara, the impetuous one who gives, and be praised as you move about.

original: ahaśca kṛṣṇamahararjunaṃ ca vi vartete rajasī vedyābhiḥ
analyzed: ahar ca kṛṣṇam ahar arjunam ca vi vartete rajasī vedyābhiḥ
translated: The black and the ruddy night, with their paths of knowledge, revolve around.

original: vaiśvānaro jāyamāno na rājāvātirajjyotiṣāgnistamāṃsi
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ jāyamānaḥ na rājā avātirat jyotiṣā agniḥ tamāṃsi
translated: Vaiśvānara, the king, being born, surpasses with his light the darkness, Agni.

original: nāhaṃ tantuṃ na vi jānāmyotuṃ na yaṃ vayanti samare'tamānāḥ
analyzed: na aham tantum na vi jānāmi otum na yam vayanti sama retamānāḥ
translated: I do not know the thread nor the way, which they weave in the battle of the two armies.

original: kasya svit putra iha vaktvāni paro vadātyavareṇa pitrā
analyzed: kasya svid putraḥ iha vaktvāni paraḥ vadāti avareṇa pitrā
translated: Whose son is it that should speak here? The higher one speaks with the lower father.

original: sa it tantuṃ sa vi jānātyotuṃ sa vaktvāny ṛtuthā vadāti
analyzed: saḥ id tantum sa vi jānāti otum sa vaktvāni ṛtuthā vadāti
translated: He indeed knows the thread and the way. He speaks in due season what should be spoken.

original: ya īṃ ciketadamṛtasya gopā avaścaran paro anyena paśyan
analyzed: yaḥ īm ciketat amṛtasya gopāḥ avas caran paras anyena paśyan
translated: He who has understood the guardian of immortality, moving about, seeing beyond with another.

original: ayaṃ hotā prathamaḥ paśyatemamidaṃ jyotiramṛtaṃ martyeṣu
analyzed: ayam hotā prathamaḥ paśyata imam idam jyotiḥ amṛtam martyeṣu
translated: This priest sees this light of immortality among mortals, the first.

original: ayaṃ sa jajñe dhruva ā niṣatto 'martyastanvā vardhamānaḥ
analyzed: ayam sa jajñe dhruvaḥ ā niṣattaḥ martyaḥ tanvā vardhamānaḥ
translated: This one was born, firmly seated, immortal, growing in his body.

original: dhruvaṃ jyotirnihitaṃ dṛśaye kaṃ mano javiṣṭhaṃ patayatsvantaḥ
analyzed: dhruvam jyotiḥ nihitam dṛśaye kam manaḥ javiṣṭham patayatsu antar
translated: The light is firmly set for the eye, the mind most swift flies within itself.

original: viśve devāḥ samanasaḥ saketā ekaṃ kratumabhivi yanti sādhu
analyzed: viśve devāḥ samanasaḥ sa ketāḥ ekam kratum abhivi yanti sādhu
translated: The All-Gods, of one mind, with the same intention, go to the one good sacrifice.

original: vi me karṇā patayato vi cakṣurvīdaṃ jyotirhṛdaya āhitaṃ yat
analyzed: vi me karṇā patayataḥ vi cakṣuḥ vi idam jyotiḥ hṛdaye āhitam yat
translated: My ears are scattered, my eye is scattered, this light that is set in my heart.

original: vi me manaścarati dūraādhīḥ kiṃ svid vakṣyāmikimu nū maniṣye
analyzed: vi me manaḥ carati dūra ādhīḥ kim svid vakṣyāmi kimu nu maniṣye
translated: My mind wanders far away. What shall I say? What now will I think?

original: viśve devā anamasyan bhiyānāstvāmagne tamasi tasthivāṃsam
analyzed: viśve devāḥ anamasyan bhiyānāḥ tvām agne tamasi tasthivāṃsam
translated: The All-Gods, fearing, bowed down to you, O Agni, while you stood in the darkness.

original: vaiśvānaro 'vatūtaye no 'martyo 'vatūtaye naḥ
analyzed: vaiśvānaraḥ vatu ūtaye naḥ martyaḥ vatu ūtaye naḥ
translated: Vaiśvānara has come to help us, the immortal has come to help us.

original: puro vo mandraṃ divyaṃ suvṛktiṃ prayati yajñe agnimadhvaredadhidhvam
analyzed: puras vaḥ mandram divyam suvṛktim prayati yajñe agnim adhvaredadhidhvam
translated: Place before you the delightful heavenly hymn, set Agni in the sacrifice at the rite.

original: pura ukthebhiḥ sa hi no vibhāvā svadhvarā karati jātavedāḥ
analyzed: puras ukthebhiḥ sa hi naḥ vibhāvā su adhvarā karati jātavedāḥ
translated: With praises, for he is to be praised, with our own oblations the all-knower makes ready.

original: tamu dyumaḥ purvaṇīka hotaragne agnibhirmanuṣa idhānaḥ
analyzed: tam u dyumas purvaṇīka hotar agne agnibhiḥ manuṣaḥ idhānaḥ
translated: To him, O Agni, O leader of the first host, the mortal man, kindling you with the fires,

original: stomaṃ yamasmai mamateva śūṣaṃ ghṛtaṃ na śuci matayaḥ pavante
analyzed: stomam yam asmai śūṣam ghṛtam na śuci matayaḥ pavante
translated: brings the hymn to you as to a king, as to a lord, as to a father. Pure thoughts flow to him like ghee.

original: pīpāya sa śravasā martyeṣu yo agnaye dadāśa vipra ukthaiḥ
analyzed: pīpāya sa śravasā martyeṣu yaḥ agnaye dadāśa vipraḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: He has come to prosperity among mortals, he who has offered to Agni with hymns, O sage.

original: citrābhistamūtibhiścitraśocirvrajasya sātā gomato dadhāti
analyzed: citrābhiḥ tam ūtibhiḥ citra śociḥ vrajasya sātā gomataḥ dadhāti
translated: With wondrous aids, wondrously bright, he bestows the good thing of the prosperous cow-owning clan

original: ā yaḥ paprau jāyamāna urvī dūredṛśā bhāsā kṛṣṇādhvā
analyzed: ā yaḥ paprau jāyamānaḥ urvī dūredṛśā bhāsā kṛṣṇa adhvā
translated: Who, as he is born, looks forth over the wide expanse, with dark path, with far-seeing light

original: adha bahu cit tama ūrmyāyāstiraḥ śociṣā dadṛśe pāvakaḥ
analyzed: adha bahu cit tamaḥ ūrmyāyāḥ tiras śociṣā dadṛśe pāvakaḥ
translated: And even through much darkness the purifier is seen with his radiance

original: nū naścitraṃ puruvājābhirūtī agne rayiṃ maghavadbhyaśca dhehi
analyzed: nu naḥ citram puru vāja abhirūtī agne rayim maghavadbhyaḥ ca dhehi
translated: Now, O wondrous one, with much-desired help, O Agni, bestow wealth on the wealthy ones

original: ye rādhasā śravasā cātyanyān suvīryebhiścābhi santi janān
analyzed: ye rādhasā śravasā ca ati anyān su vīryebhiḥ ca abhi santi janān
translated: Who by their bounty and glory surpass other men and by their heroic deeds

original: imaṃ yajñaṃ cano dhā agna uśan yaṃ ta āsāno juhute haviṣmān
analyzed: imam yajñam canaḥ dhāḥ agne uśan yam te āsānaḥ juhute haviṣmān
translated: Accept this sacrifice with favour, O Agni, which, seated here, the oblator offers with oblations

original: bharadvājeṣu dadhiṣe suvṛktimavīrvājasya gadhyasya sātau
analyzed: bharadvājeṣu dadhiṣe suvṛktim avīḥ vājasya gadhyasya sātau
translated: You find delight in the good hymn among the Bharadvājas, for the winning of the desired prize

original: vi dveṣāṃsīnuhi vardhayeḷāṃ madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ
analyzed: vi vardhaya iḷām madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: Drive away enmities, increase our joys, may we rejoice through a hundred winters with brave sons

original: yajasva hotariṣito yajīyānagne bādho marutāṃ na prayukti
analyzed: yajasva hotar iṣitaḥ yajīyān agne bādhaḥ marutām na prayukti
translated: Sacrifice, O Hotar, most worthy of sacrifice, O Agni, the leader of the Maruts, be not remiss

original: ā no mitrāvaruṇā nāsatyā dyāvā hotrāya pṛthivī vavṛtyāḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ mitrāvaruṇā nāsatyā dyāvā hotrāya pṛthivī vavṛtyāḥ
translated: Turn hither to our sacrifice, O Mitra-Varuṇa, O Nāsatyas, O Dyaus, O Earth

original: tvaṃ hotā mandratamo no adhrugantardevo vidathā martyeṣu
analyzed: tvam hotā mandratamaḥ naḥ adhruk antar devaḥ vidathā martyeṣu
translated: You are our Hotar, most delightful, most firm, a god among mortals, in the assemblies

original: pāvakayā juhvā vahnirāsāgne yajasva tanvaṃ tava svām
analyzed: pāvakayā juhvā vahni rāsā agne yajasva tanvam tava svām
translated: O Agni, come with your purifying tongue, offer your own body in sacrifice

original: dhanyā cid dhi tve dhiṣaṇā vaṣṭi pra devāñ janma gṛṇate yajadhyai🔽vepiṣṭho aṅgirasāṃ yad dha vipro madhu chando bhanati rebha iṣṭau
analyzed: dhanyā cit hi tve dhiṣaṇā vaṣṭi pra devām janma gṛṇate yajadhyai  vepiṣṭhaḥ aṅgirasām yat ha vipraḥ madhu chandaḥ bhanati rebhaḥ iṣṭau
translated: For even the blessed thought attends on thee, to worship the Gods, to sing their birth to the singer🔽When the most sapient Angiras, the sage, in the sacrifice, the singer, breaks the honey-meath of the hymn

original: adidyutat svapāko vibhāvāgne yajasva rodasī urūcī
analyzed: adidyutat svapākaḥ vibhāvā agne yajasva rodasī urūcī
translated: Shine forth, O Agni, of thyself, the radiant one: worship thou the two wide realms of heaven and earth

original: āyuṃ na yaṃ namasā rātahavyā añjanti suprayasaṃ pañca janāḥ
analyzed: āyum na yam namasā rāta havyāḥ añjanti su prayasam pañca janāḥ
translated: Whom the five people, bringing gifts, anoint, well-praised, as 'Agni', for the sacrifice

original: vṛñje ha yan namasā barhiragnāvayāmi srug ghṛtavatī suvṛktiḥ
analyzed: vṛñje ha yat namasā barhiḥ agnau ayāmi sruc ghṛtavatī suvṛktiḥ
translated: When I with reverence spread the grass for Agni, the ladle filled with oil, the fair hymn

original: amyakṣi sadma sadane pṛthivyā aśrāyi yajñaḥ sūrye na cakṣuḥ
analyzed: amyakṣi sadma sadane pṛthivyāḥ aśrāyi yajñaḥ sūrye na cakṣuḥ
translated: Thou hast looked on the seat in the house of earth: the sacrifice hath rested in the sun as in the eye

original: daśasyā naḥ purvaṇīka hotardevebhiragne agnibhiridhānaḥ
analyzed: daśasya naḥ purvaṇīka hotar devebhiḥ agne agnibhiḥ idhānaḥ
translated: O Agni, O Hotar, O thou who art to be worshipped with gifts, be thou, O God, with the Gods, the kindler,

original: rāyaḥ sūno sahaso vāvasānā ati srasema vṛjanaṃ nāṃhaḥ
analyzed: rāyaḥ sūno sahasaḥ vāvasānāḥ ati srasema vṛjanam nā aṃhaḥ
translated: O Son of Strength, in the dwelling of wealth, may we pass over the foe as over the day the people

original: madhye hotā duroṇe barhiṣo rāḷ agnistodasya rodasī yajadhyai
analyzed: madhye hotā duroṇe barhiṣaḥ rāj agniḥ todasya rodasī yajadhyai
translated: In the midst of the house, on the grass, the Hotar, Agni, is to be worshipped, the lord of the house, for the two world-halves

original: ayaṃ sa sūnuḥ sahasa ṛtāvā dūrāt sūryo na śociṣā tatāna
analyzed: ayam sa sūnuḥ sahasaḥ ṛtāvā dūrāt sūryaḥ na śociṣā tatāna
translated: This is he, the son, the true one, who hath spread himself afar with his radiance, as the sun

original: ā yasmin tve svapāke yajatra yakṣad rājan sarvatāteva nudyauḥ
analyzed: ā yasmin tve sva pāke yajatra yakṣat rājan sarvatātā iva nudyauḥ
translated: In whom, O thou of true ordinances, O thou who art to be worshipped, O thou who art to be invoked, O King, O thou who art the father of all, as the sky

original: triṣadhasthastataruṣo na jaṃho havyā maghāni mānuṣā yajadhyai
analyzed: triṣadhasthaḥ tataruṣaḥ na jaṃhaḥ havyā maghāni mānuṣā yajadhyai
translated: The one who dwells in the three realms, like a swift horse, deserves to be worshipped with the offerings and praises of men.

original: tejiṣṭhā yasyāratirvanerāṭ todo adhvan na vṛdhasāno adyaut
analyzed: tejiṣṭhā yasya aratiḥ vanerāj todaḥ adhvan na vṛdhasānaḥ adyaut
translated: Whose wrath, like a forest fire, is most powerful; whose fury shines like a growing flame on the path.

original: adrogho na dravitā cetati tmannamartyo 'vartra oṣadhīṣu🔽sāsmākebhiretarī na śūṣairagni ṣṭave dama ā jātavedāḥ
analyzed: adroghaḥ na dravitā cetati tman amartyaḥ vartre oṣadhīṣu  sā asmākebhiḥ etarī na śūṣaiḥ agni stave dame ā jātavedāḥ
translated: The guileless one, like a swift one, thinks in his own mind, the immortal one, the one who turns back, among the plants.🔽With our own strong ones, he, the other one, Agni, the all-knower, should be praised in the house.

original: drvanno vanvan kratvā nārvosraḥ piteva jārayāyi yajñaiḥ
analyzed: dru annaḥ vanvan kratvā na arva usraḥ pitā iva jārayāyi yajñaiḥ
translated: Seeking food, seeking with wisdom, like a young horse, like a father with his daughter, with sacrifices.

original: adha smāsya panayanti bhāso vṛthā yat takṣadanuyāti pṛthvīm
analyzed: adha sma asya panayanti bhāsaḥ vṛthā yat takṣat anuyāti pṛthvīm
translated: Then they praise his rays, when he cuts out the void, when he follows the wide earth.

original: sadyo yaḥ syandro viṣito dhavīyān ṛṇo na tāyurati dhanvā rāṭ
analyzed: sadyas yaḥ syandraḥ viṣitaḥ dhavīyān ṛṇaḥ na tāyuḥ ati dhanvā rāj
translated: The one who, when quickly released, is more powerful, like a debtor who has paid off his debt, a king who has passed over the wilderness.

original: sa tvaṃ no arvan nidāyā viśvebhiragne agnibhiridhānaḥ
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ arvan nidāyāḥ viśvebhiḥ agne agnibhiḥ idhānaḥ
translated: You, O horse, O Agni, with all the fires, being kindled,

original: veṣi rāyo vi yāsi duchunā madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ
analyzed: veṣi rāyaḥ vi yāsi duchunāḥ madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: you lead to wealth, you drive away evil. May we rejoice for a hundred winters with good heroes.

original: tvad viśvā subhaga saubhagānyagne vi yanti vanino na vayāḥ
analyzed: tvat viśvā subhaga saubhagāni agne vi yanti vaninaḥ na vayāḥ
translated: O you who are auspicious in all things, O Agni, all good things proceed from you, like birds from their nests.

original: śruṣṭī rayirvājo vṛtratūrye divo vṛṣṭirīḍyo rītirapām
analyzed: śruṣṭiḥ rayiḥ vājaḥ vṛtratūrye divaḥ vṛṣṭiḥ īḍyaḥ rītiḥ apām
translated: The heard wealth, the prize, the strength in the battle against Vritra, the rain from heaven, the desirable flow of the waters.

original: tvaṃ bhago na ā hi ratnamiṣe parijmeva kṣayasi dasmavarcāḥ
analyzed: tvam bhagaḥ naḥ ā hi ratnam iṣe parijmā iva kṣayasi dasma varcāḥ
translated: You, O Bhaga, come to us for the sake of wealth, like a guest, shining with wondrous splendor.

original: agne mitro na bṛhata ṛtasyāsi kṣattā vāmasya deva bhūreḥ
analyzed: agne mitraḥ na bṛhataḥ ṛtasya asi kṣattā vāmasya deva bhūreḥ
translated: O Agni, thou art the great Mitra of holy order, the guardian of good, O god, of abundant wealth

original: sa satpatiḥ śavasā hanti vṛtramagne vipro vi paṇerbhartivājam🔽yaṃ tvaṃ praceta ṛtajāta rāyā sajoṣā naptrāpāṃ hinoṣi
analyzed: sa sat patiḥ śavasā hanti vṛtram agne vipraḥ vi paṇeḥ bharti vājam  yam tvam pracetaḥ ṛta jāta rāyā sajoṣāḥ naptrā apām hinoṣi
translated: He, the lord of the good, with might slays Vrtra, Agni, the sage, carries the prize through the conflict🔽Whom, O thou of great insight, O thou of true birth, thou dost impel with wealth, in accord with the sons of the waters

original: yaste sūno sahaso gīrbhirukthairyajñairmarto niśitiṃ vedyānaṭ🔽viśvaṃ sa deva prati vāramagne dhatte dhānyaṃ patyate vasavyaiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ te sūno sahasaḥ gīrbhiḥ ukthaiḥ yajñaiḥ martaḥ niśitim vedyā anaṭ  viśvam sa deva prati vāram agne dhatte dhānyam patyate vasavyaiḥ
translated: The mortal who with songs, with hymns, with sacrifices, O son of strength, knows thy acceptable favour🔽That god, O Agni, obtains all the people, he prospers with his own wealth

original: tā nṛbhya ā sauśravasā suvīrāgne sūno sahasaḥ puṣyasedhāḥ
analyzed: tā nṛbhyaḥ ā sauśravasā su vīrā agne sūno sahasaḥ puṣya sedhāḥ
translated: Those, O Agni, O son of strength, thou furtherest, bestowing good fame on men, good heroes

original: kṛṇoṣi yacchavasā bhūri paśvo vayo vṛkāyārayejasuraye
analyzed: kṛṇoṣi yat śavasā bhūri paśvaḥ vayaḥ vṛkāya arayejasuraye
translated: What thou dost create with might, abundant cattle, life for the wolf, for the strong one to enjoy

original: vadmā sūno sahaso no vihāyā agne tokaṃ tanayaṃ vāji no dāḥ
analyzed: vadmā sūno sahasaḥ naḥ vihāyāḥ agne tokam tanayam vāji naḥ dāḥ
translated: Be thou, O son of strength, a giver to us, O Agni, of offspring, of progeny, of strength

original: viśvābhirgīrbhirabhi pūrtimaśyāṃ madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ
analyzed: viśvābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ abhi pūrtim aśyām madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: With all songs may I obtain abundance; may we rejoice a hundred winters with good heroes

original: agnā yo martyo duvo dhiyaṃ jujoṣa dhītibhiḥ
analyzed: agnā yaḥ martyaḥ duvaḥ dhiyam jujoṣa dhītibhiḥ
translated: O Agni, the mortal who delights in thy service with his thoughts and devotions

original: bhasan nuṣa pra pūrvya iṣaṃ vurītāvase
analyzed: bhasan pra pūrvyaḥ iṣam vurīta avase
translated: Like a horse, O earliest one, he obtains food for his support

original: agnirid dhi pracetā agnirvedhastama ṛṣiḥ
analyzed: agniḥ id hi pracetāḥ agniḥ vedhastamaḥ ṛṣiḥ
translated: For Agni is indeed the wise one, Agni is the sage, the seer

original: agniṃ hotāramīḷate yajñeṣu manuṣo viśaḥ
analyzed: agnim hotāram īḍate yajñeṣu manuṣaḥ viśaḥ
translated: The people choose Agni as the Hotar at sacrifices

original: nānā hyagne 'vase spardhante rāyo aryaḥ
analyzed: nānā hi agne vase spardhante rāyaḥ aryaḥ
translated: For, O Agni, the rich who strive for help contend with various means,

original: tūrvanto dasyumāyavo vrataiḥ sīkṣanto avratam
analyzed: tūrvantaḥ dasyu māyavaḥ vrataiḥ sīkṣantaḥ avratam
translated: The active ones with vows against the vowless, the deceitful ones.

original: agnirapsām ṛtīṣahaṃ vīraṃ dadāti satpatim
analyzed: agniḥ ap sām ṛtīṣaham vīram dadāti sat patim
translated: Agni bestows the hero who conquers foes, the lord of the house,

original: yasya trasanti śavasaḥ saṃcakṣi śatravo bhiyā
analyzed: yasya trasanti śavasaḥ saṃcakṣi śatravaḥ bhiyā
translated: Whose power the enemies, looking at it, tremble in fear.

original: agnirhi vidmanā nido devo martamuruṣyati
analyzed: agniḥ hi vidmanā nidaḥ devaḥ martam uruṣyati
translated: For Agni, the god who knows, protects the mortal from calamities,

original: sahāvā yasyāvṛto rayirvājeṣvavṛtaḥ🔽achā no mitramaho / / /
analyzed: sahāvā yasya avṛtaḥ rayiḥ vājeṣu avṛtaḥ  achā naḥ mitra mahas
translated: With whom as ally wealth is secured, wealth is secured in battles.

original: imamū ṣu vo atithimuṣarbudhaṃ viśvāsāṃ viśāṃ patimṛñjase girā
analyzed: imam u su vaḥ atithim uṣarbudham viśvāsām viśām patim ṛñjase girā
translated: Come to us, O Agni, the guest who rises at dawn, the lord of all the clans, I honor you with a song.

original: vetīd divo januṣā kaccidā śucirjyok cidatti garbho yadacyutam
analyzed: veti id divaḥ januṣā kaccidā śuciḥ jyok cit atti garbhaḥ yat acyutam
translated: He, the pure one, comes from the womb of heaven, as if from the womb of the earth, to eat the imperishable food, even in the daytime.

original: mitraṃ na yaṃ sudhitaṃ bhṛgavo dadhurvanaspatāvīḍyamūrdhvaśociṣam
analyzed: mitram na yam sudhitam bhṛgavaḥ vanaspatā vīḍyam ūrdhva śociṣam
translated: The Bhṛgus have established him as a well-ordered friend, the unshakable one with upward-blazing flames, in the tree.

original: sa tvaṃ suprīto vītahavye adbhuta praśastibhirmahayase dive dive
analyzed: sa tvam su prītaḥ vītahavye adbhuta praśastibhiḥ mahayase dive dive
translated: You, O wondrous one, well-pleased, are glorified day by day by the praises of Vītahavya.

original: sa tvaṃ dakṣasyāvṛko vṛdho bhūraryaḥ parasyāntarasya taruṣaḥ
analyzed: sa tvam dakṣasya avṛkaḥ vṛdhaḥ bhūḥ aryaḥ parasya antarasya taruṣaḥ
translated: You are the unassailable, the growing, the great friend of Dakṣa, the one who destroys the enemy of the farthest and nearest.

original: rāyaḥ sūno sahaso martyeṣvā chardiryacha vītahavyāya sapratho bharadvājāya saprathaḥ
analyzed: rāyaḥ sūno sahasaḥ martya iṣvā chardiḥ yaccha vītahavyāya saprathaḥ bharadvājāya saprathaḥ
translated: O son of strength, grant to the mortals the wide pasture of wealth, grant the wide pasture to Vītahavya, to Bharadvāja.

original: dyutānaṃ vo atithiṃ svarṇaramagniṃ hotāraṃ manuṣaḥ svadhvaram
analyzed: dyutānam vaḥ atithim svarṇaram agnim hotāram manuṣaḥ su adhvaram
translated: I praise Agni, your guest who shines in the sky, the golden one, the priest of men who offer sacrifices,

original: vipraṃ na dyukṣavacasaṃ suvṛktibhirhavyavāhamaratiṃ devam ṛñjase🔽pāvakayā yaścitayantyā kṛpā kṣāman ruruca uṣaso na bhānunā
analyzed: vipram na dyukṣa vacasam suvṛktibhiḥ havyavāham aratim devam ṛñjase  pāvakayā yaḥ citayantyā kṛpā kṣāman ruruce uṣasaḥ na bhānunā
translated: The divine messenger, the bearer of oblations, the god who is to be served with beautiful hymns, the one who speaks lofty words, the sage.🔽He who with his purifying light moves on the back of the earth, shines like the rays of the dawn,

original: tūrvan na yāmannetaśasya nū raṇa ā yo ghṛṇe na tatṛṣāṇo ajaraḥ
analyzed: tūrvan na yāman etaśasya nu raṇe ā yaḥ ghṛṇe na tatṛṣāṇaḥ ajaraḥ
translated: Like a swift horse in the race of the swift one, he who is insatiable like fire, the imperishable one.

original: agnimagniṃ vaḥ samidhā duvasyata priyampriyaṃ vo atithiṃ gṛṇīṣaṇi
analyzed: agnim agnim vaḥ samidhā duvasyata priyam priyam vaḥ atithim gṛṇīṣaṇi
translated: Serve Agni with fuel, O people, honor the one who is dear to you, praise your own dear guest.

original: upa vo gīrbhiramṛtaṃ vivāsata devo deveṣu vanate hi vāryaṃ devo deveṣu vanate hi no duvaḥ
analyzed: upa vaḥ gīrbhiḥ amṛtam vivāsata devaḥ deveṣu vanate hi vāryam devaḥ deveṣu vanate hi naḥ duvaḥ
translated: With your songs I invite the immortal one to come to you. The god obtains the best offering among the gods, the god obtains our service among the gods.

original: samiddhamagniṃ samidhā girā gṛṇe śuciṃ pāvakaṃ puro adhvare dhruvam🔽vipraṃ hotāraṃ puruvāramadruhaṃ kaviṃ sumnairīmahe jātavedasam
analyzed: samiddham agnim samidhā girā gṛṇe śucim pāvakam puras adhvare dhruvam  vipram hotāram puru vāram adruham kavim sumnaiḥ īmahe jātavedasam
translated: I praise Agni, the kindled one, with fuel and song, the pure purifier, the firm one in front at the sacrifice,🔽The sage, the priest, the one who grants many boons, the one without hatred, the wise one, we invoke with offerings, the all-knowing one.

original: tvāṃ dūtamagne amṛtaṃ yugeyuge havyavāhaṃ dadhire pāyumīḍyam
analyzed: tvām dūtam agne amṛtam yuge yuge havyavāham dadhire pāyum īḍyam
translated: You, O Agni, the immortal messenger, in every age, the bearer of oblations, they have made you the protector to be praised.

original: devāsaśca martāsaśca jāgṛviṃ vibhuṃ viśpatiṃ namasā ni ṣedire
analyzed: devāsaḥ ca martāsaḥ ca jāgṛvim vibhum viśpatim namasā ni sedire
translated: The gods and men have settled down with reverence, the watchful one, the all-pervading one, the lord of the people, the wise one.

original: vibhūṣannagna ubhayānanu vratā dūto devānāṃ rajasī samīyase
analyzed: vibhūṣan agne ubhayān anu vratā dūtaḥ devānām rajasī samīyase
translated: Adorning both, O Agni, with thy observances, thou goest as messenger of the gods through the regions.

original: yat te dhītiṃ sumatimāvṛṇīmahe 'dha smā nastrivarūthaḥ śivo bhava
analyzed: yat te dhītim sumatim āvṛṇīmahe smā naḥ tri varūthaḥ śivaḥ bhava
translated: When we choose thy thought and favour, then be thou a protector to us, and auspicious.

original: taṃ supratīkaṃ sudṛśaṃ svañcamavidvāṃso viduṣṭaraṃ sapema🔽sa yakṣad viśvā vayunāni vidvān pra havyamagniramṛteṣu vocat
analyzed: tam su pratīkam sudṛśam svañcam avidvāṃsaḥ viduṣṭaram sapema  sa yakṣat viśvā vayunāni vidvān pra havyam agniḥ amṛteṣu vocat
translated: We will serve that one of fair form, fair to behold, self-moving, more to be sought by the ignorant.🔽He who knows all the ordinances, he shall proclaim the offering to the immortals, Agni.

original: tamagne pāsyuta taṃ piparṣi yasta ānaṭ kavaye śūra dhītim
analyzed: tam agne pāsi uta tam piparṣi yaḥ te ānaṭ kavaye śūra dhītim
translated: That man, O Agni, whom thou protectest, and whom thou nourishest, who brings his thought to the wise one,

original: yajñasya vā niśitiṃ voditiṃ vā tamit pṛṇakṣi śavasota rāyā
analyzed: yajñasya vā niśitim vā uditim vā tam id pṛṇakṣi śavasā uta rāyā
translated: Him thou fillest with strength and wealth, whether it be the completion of the sacrifice or its rising.

original: tvamagne vanuṣyato ni pāhi tvamu naḥ sahasāvannavadyāt
analyzed: tvam agne vanuṣyataḥ ni pāhi tvam u naḥ sahasāvan annavadyāt
translated: O Agni, protect him who is to be favoured by thee; protect us, O thou who art to be worshipped, from blame.

original: saṃ tvā dhvasmanvadabhyetu pāthaḥ saṃ rayi spṛhayāyyaḥsahasrī
analyzed: sam tvā dhvasmanvat abhyetu pāthaḥ sam rayi spṛhayāyyaḥ sahasrī
translated: Let the path come to thee, O Agni, that is free from trouble; let wealth, to be desired by all, come to thee, a thousandfold.

original: agnirhotā gṛhapatiḥ sa rājā viśvā veda janimā jātavedaḥ
analyzed: agniḥ hotā gṛhapatiḥ sa rājā viśvā veda janimā jātavedaḥ
translated: Agni is the Hotar, the lord of the house, he is the king; he knows all generations, O all-knowing one.

original: devānāmuta yo martyānāṃ yajiṣṭhaḥ sa pra yajatām ṛtāvā
analyzed: devānām uta yaḥ martyānām yajiṣṭhaḥ sa pra yajatām ṛtāvā
translated: He who is the best worshipper of the gods and of men, he, the truthful one, is the best of those who offer sacrifice.

original: agne yadadya viśo adhvarasya hotaḥ pāvakaśoce veṣ ṭvaṃ hi yajvā
analyzed: agne yat adya viśaḥ adhvarasya hotar pāvaka śoce veḥ tvam hi yajvā
translated: O Agni, whatever today is the oblation of the people at the sacrifice, O Hotar, O thou who art purified by the flame, for thou art the worshipper.

original: ṛtā yajāsi mahinā vi yad bhūrhavyā vaha yaviṣṭha yā te adya
analyzed: ṛtā yajāsi mahinā vi yat bhūḥ havyā vaha yaviṣṭha yā te adya
translated: You worship with truth, when you become great, carry the offerings, O most youthful one, which are yours today

original: abhi prayāṃsi sudhitāni hi khyo ni tvā dadhīta rodasī yajadhyai
analyzed: abhi prayāṃsi sudhitāni hi khyaḥ ni tvā dadhīta rodasī yajadhyai
translated: For the well-ordered rites are dear to you. May the two worlds set you down to worship

original: avā no maghavan vājasātāvagne viśvāni duritā tarema tā tarema tavāvasā tarema
analyzed: avāḥ naḥ maghavan vājasātau agne viśvāni duritā tarema tā tarema tava avasā tarema
translated: Carry us across all difficulties, O bountiful one, in the race for booty, O Agni. May we be delivered through your grace

original: agne viśvebhiḥ svanīka devairūrṇāvantaṃ prathamaḥ sīda yonim
analyzed: agne viśvebhiḥ su anīka devaiḥ ūrṇāvantam prathamaḥ sīda yonim
translated: O Agni, with all the gods, fair-faced, first sit in the wool-covered birthplace

original: kulāyinaṃ ghṛtavantaṃ savitre yajñaṃ naya yajamānāya sādhu
analyzed: kulāyinam ghṛtavantam savitre yajñam naya yajamānāya sādhu
translated: Carry the nest-like, ghee-filled sacrifice to Savitar, well-performed, for the sacrificer

original: imamu tyamatharvavadagniṃ manthanti vedhasaḥ
analyzed: imam u tyam atharva vat agnim manthanti vedhasaḥ

original: yamaṅkūyantamānayannamūraṃ śyāvyābhyaḥ
analyzed: yam aṅkūyantam ānayan amūram śyāvyābhyaḥ

original: janiṣvā devavītaye sarvatātā svastaye
analyzed: janiṣva deva vītaye sarvatātā svastaye
translated: Be born for the feast of the gods, for all prosperity, for well-being

original: ā devān vakṣyamṛtān ṛtāvṛdho yajñaṃ deveṣu pispṛśaḥ🔽vayamu tvā gṛhapate janānāmagne akarma samidhā bṛhantam
analyzed: ā devān vakṣi amṛtān ṛtāvṛdhaḥ yajñam deveṣu pispṛśaḥ  vayam u tvā gṛhapate janānām agne akarma samidhā bṛhantam
translated: I will carry the gods, the immortal ones, the strengtheners of truth, to the sacrifice, to the gods🔽We, O Agni, the lord of the house of the people, have served you with fuel, O lofty one

original: asthūri no gārhapatyāni santu tigmena nastejasā saṃ śiśādhi
analyzed: asthūri naḥ gārhapatyāni santu tigmena naḥ tejasā sam śiśādhi
translated: Let our domestic rites be not burdensome to us. Sharpen us with your sharp splendor

original: tvamagne yajñānāṃ hotā viśveṣāṃ hitaḥ
analyzed: tvam agne yajñānām hotā viśveṣām hitaḥ
translated: You, O Agni, are the priest of all sacrifices, appointed

original: devebhirmānuṣe jane
analyzed: devebhiḥ mānuṣe jane

original: sa no mandrābhiradhvare jihvābhiryajā mahaḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ mandrābhiḥ adhvare jihvābhiḥ yaja mahaḥ
translated: With your sweet tongues at our sacrifice, worship the great one

original: ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca
analyzed: ā devān vakṣi yakṣi ca
translated: And bring the gods and worship them.

original: vetthā hi vedho adhvanaḥ pathaśca devāñjasā
analyzed: vettha hi vedhaḥ adhvanaḥ pathaḥ ca deva añjasā
translated: For you know the path, O wise one, and the way to the gods quickly,

original: agne yajñeṣu sukrato
analyzed: agne yajñeṣu sukrato
translated: O Agni, at sacrifices, O wise one.

original: tvāmīḷe adha dvitā bharato vājibhiḥ śunam
analyzed: tvām īḍe adha dvitā bharataḥ vājibhiḥ śunam
translated: I praise you, O Agni, day after day, O Bharata, for good fortune with your strong horses,

original: īje yajñeayat divi
analyzed: īje yajñeayat divi

original: tvamimā vāryā puru divodāsāya sunvate
analyzed: tvam imā vāryā puru divodāsāya sunvate

original: bharadvājāya dāśuṣe
analyzed: bharadvājāya dāśuṣe

original: tvaṃ dūto amartya ā vahā daivyaṃ janam
analyzed: tvam dūtaḥ amartyaḥ ā vaha daivyam janam
translated: You, O immortal messenger, bring the divine people,

original: śṛṇvan viprasya suṣṭutim
analyzed: śṛṇvan viprasya suṣṭutim

original: tvāmagne svādhyo martāso deva vītaye
analyzed: tvām agne su ādhyaḥ martāsaḥ deva vītaye
translated: You, O Agni, the mortals, O god, for the feast,

original: yajñeṣu devamīḷate
analyzed: yajñeṣu devam īḍate

original: tava pra yakṣi sandṛśamuta kratuṃ sudānavaḥ
analyzed: tava pra yakṣi sandṛśam uta kratum sudānavaḥ

original: viśve juṣanta kāminaḥ
analyzed: viśve juṣanta kāminaḥ

original: tvaṃ hotā manurhito vahnirāsā viduṣṭaraḥ🔽agne yakṣidivo viśaḥ

analyzed: agne ā yāhi vītaye gṛṇānaḥ havya dātaye

original: ni hotā satsi barhiṣi
analyzed: ni hotā satsi barhiṣi

original: taṃ tvā samidbhiraṅgiro ghṛtena vardhayāmasi
analyzed: tam tvā samidbhiḥ aṅgiraḥ ghṛtena vardhayāmasi

original: bṛhacchocā yaviṣṭhya
analyzed: bṛhat śoca yaviṣṭhya

analyzed: sa naḥ pṛthu śravāyyam achā deva vivāsasi

original: bṛhadagne suvīryam
analyzed: bṛhat agne su vīryam

analyzed: tam u tvā dadhyam ṛṣiḥ putraḥ īdhe atharvaṇaḥ

original: vṛtrahaṇaṃ purandaram
analyzed: vṛtra haṇam purandaram

original: tamu tvā pāthyo vṛṣā samīdhe dasyuhantamam
analyzed: tam u tvā pāthyaḥ vṛṣā samīdhe dasyu hantamam

analyzed: dhanaṃjayam raṇeraṇe

analyzed: ehi u su bravāṇi te gne itthā itarāḥ giraḥ

original: ebhirvardhāsa indubhiḥ
analyzed: ebhiḥ vardhāse indubhiḥ

original: yatra kva ca te mano dakṣaṃ dadhasa uttaram
analyzed: yatra kva ca te manaḥ dakṣam dadhase uttaram

original: tatrā sadaḥ kṛṇavase
analyzed: tatra sadaḥ kṛṇavase

analyzed: nahi te pūrtam akṣipat bhuvat nemānām vaso

original: athā duvo vanavase
analyzed: athā duvaḥ vanavase

analyzed: ā agniḥ agāmi bhārataḥ vṛtra hā puru cetanaḥ
translated: Agni hath come, the Indian, the Vr̥itra-slayer, the very wise,

original: divodāsasya satpatiḥ
analyzed: divodāsasya satpatiḥ
translated: The good lord of Divodâsa.

original: sa hi viśvāti pārthivā rayiṃ dāśan mahitvanā
analyzed: sa hi viśvā ati pārthivā rayim dāśat mahitvanā

original: vanvannavāto astṛtaḥ
analyzed: vanvan avātaḥ astṛtaḥ

analyzed: sa pratna vat navīyasā agne dyumnena saṃyatā

original: arcagāya ca vedhase
analyzed: arcagāya ca vedhase

analyzed: sa hi yaḥ mānuṣā yugā sīdat hotā kavi kratuḥ

analyzed: dūtaḥ ca havyavāhanaḥ

analyzed: vasvī te agne san dṛṣṭiḥ iṣayate martyāya

analyzed: ūrjaḥ napāt amṛtasya

analyzed: kratvā dāḥ astu śreṣṭhaḥ dya tvā vanvan surekṇāḥ

analyzed: martaḥ ānāśa suvṛktim

analyzed: te te agne tvotāḥ iṣayantaḥ viśvam āyuḥ

analyzed: agniḥ naḥ vanate rayim

analyzed: tvam tam deva jihvayā pari bādhasva duṣkṛtam

original: agne vareṇyaṃvasu
analyzed: agne vareṇyaṃvasu

analyzed: agniḥ vṛtrāṇi jaṅghanat draviṇasyuḥ vipanyayā

analyzed: agne sasṛjmahe giraḥ

analyzed: upa chāyām iva ghṛṇeḥ aganma śarma te vayam

original: evā pāhi pratnathā mandatu tvā śrudhi brahma vāvṛdhasvotagīrbhiḥ
analyzed: evā pāhi pratnathā mandatu tvā śrudhi brahma vāvṛdhasva uta gīrbhiḥ
translated: By whom they have brought the Vasus, the R̥ibhus, the Ṛṣis, the Maruts, the All-gods, the Ādityas, the Rudras, the Sādhyas, the Visve-devas, the gods, the Brahmans, the Kṣattriyas, the Vaiśyas, the Śūdras, the beasts, the birds, the trees, the plants, the herbs, the waters, the earth, the mid-air, the heaven, the quarters, the regions, the worlds, the past, the future, the present, the good, the evil, the truth, the untruth, the right, the wrong, the true, the false, the whole, the incomplete, the created, the uncreated, the born, the unborn, the living, the dead, the moving, the unmoving, the seen, the unseen, the heard, the unheard, the thought, the unthought, the understood, the misunderstood, the known, the unknown, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the unmanifest, the manifest, the un

original: āviḥ sūryaṃ kṛṇuhi pīpihīṣo jahi śatrūnrabhi gā indra tṛndhi
analyzed: āvis sūryam kṛṇuhi pīpihi iṣaḥ jahi śatrūn rabhi gāḥ indra tṛndhi
translated: Make the sun visible, make it shine, crush the foes, O Indra, and open the stalls of cattle.

original: te tvā madā bṛhadindra svadhāva ime pītā ukṣayanta dyumantam
analyzed: te tvā madāḥ bṛhat indra svadhāvas ime pītāḥ ukṣayanta dyumantam
translated: These gladdening draughts, O Indra, of thine own accord, these libations make thee, the mighty one, swell.

original: mahāmanūnaṃ tavasaṃ vibhūtiṃ matsarāso jarhṛṣanta prasāham
analyzed: mahā manūnam tavasam vibhūtim matsarāsaḥ jarhṛṣanta prasāham
translated: The gladdening juices have delighted the mighty, the unvanquished, the strong, the all-pervading one.

original: yebhiḥ sūryamuṣasaṃ mandasāno 'vāsayo 'pa dṛlhāni dardrat
analyzed: yebhiḥ sūryam uṣasam mandasānaḥ vāsaya u pa dṛlhāni dardrat
translated: By which, rejoicing, thou didst burst open the sun and the dawn, and didst burst asunder the firm doors.

original: mahāmadriṃ pari gā indra santaṃ nutthā acyutaṃ sadasas pari svāt
analyzed: mahā madrim pari gāḥ indra santam nutthāḥ acyutam sadasaḥ pari svāt
translated: O Indra, thou didst shake the great mountain, the unshaken one, from its seat, and didst open the stalls of cattle.

original: tava kratvā tava tad daṃsanābhirāmāsu pakvaṃ śacyā ni dīdhaḥ🔽aurṇordura usriyābhyo vi dṛḷhodūrvād gā asṛjo aṅgirasvān
analyzed: tava kratvā tava tat daṃsanā abhirāmāsu pakvam śacyā ni dīdhaḥ  aurṇa urduraḥ usriyābhyaḥ vi dṛḍhaḥ udūrvāt gāḥ asṛjaḥ aṅgirasvān
translated: By thy wisdom, by thy splendour, thou didst illumine the ripe (food) in the houses with thy might.🔽Thou didst burst open the firm door of the clouds for the sake of the cows, and didst create the cattle, O Angiras-like one.

original: paprātha kṣāṃ mahi daṇso vyurvīmupa dyām ṛṣvo bṛhadindra stabhāyaḥ
analyzed: paprātha kṣām mahi daṇsaḥ vi urvīm upa dyām ṛṣvaḥ bṛhat indra stabhāyaḥ
translated: Thou didst extend the great earth, the wide one, with thy mighty strength, O Indra, and didst prop the lofty heaven.

original: adhārayo rodasī devaputre pratne mātarā yahvī ṛtasya🔽adha tvā viśve pura indra devā ekaṃ tavasaṃ dadhire bharāya
analyzed: adhārayaḥ rodasī deva putre pratne mātarā yahvī ṛtasya  adha tvā viśve puras indra devāḥ ekam tavasam dadhire bharāya
translated: Thou didst support the two worlds, O son of the gods, the ancient, the youthful mothers of holy order.🔽All the gods, O Indra, have made thee, the one, the strong one, to be borne on their backs.

original: adevo yadabhyauhiṣṭa devān svarṣātā vṛṇata indramatra
analyzed: adevaḥ yat abhyauhiṣṭa devān svarṣātā vṛṇate indram atra
translated: When thou, the self-luminous one, didst approach the gods, the people chose Indra here.

original: adha dyauścit te apa sā nu vajrād dvitānamad bhiyasā svasya manyoḥ
analyzed: adha dyauḥ cit te apa sā nu vajrāt dvitā anamat bhiyasā svasya manyoḥ
translated: Then even the sky trembled before thy thunderbolt, in fear of thine own terrible Manyu,

original: ahiṃ yadindro abhyohasānaṃ ni cid viśvāyuḥ śayathe jaghāna
analyzed: ahim yat indraḥ abhyohasānam ni cit viśvāyuḥ śayathe jaghāna
translated: When Indra, all-life-supporting, smote down the roaring dragon in the floods.

original: adha tvaṣṭā te maha ugra vajraṃ sahasrabhṛṣṭiṃ vavṛtacchatāśrim
analyzed: adha tvaṣṭā te mahaḥ ugra vajram sahasra bhṛṣṭim vavṛtat śata aśrim
translated: Then Tvastr, O mighty and fierce one, turned thy thunderbolt with a thousand edges and a hundred points,

original: nikāmamaramaṇasaṃ yena navantamahiṃ saṃ piṇagṛjīṣin
analyzed: nikāmam aramaṇasam yena navantam ahim sam piṇak ṛjīṣin
translated: With which, O Gṛījīṣin, thou didst crush the roaring dragon, who delighted in his own abode.

original: vardhān yaṃ viśve marutaḥ sajoṣāḥ pacacchataṃ mahiṣānindra tubhyam🔽pūṣā viṣṇustrīṇi sarāṃsi dhāvan vṛtrahaṇaṃ madiramaṃśumasmai
analyzed: vardhān yam viśve marutaḥ sajoṣāḥ pacat śatam mahiṣān indra tubhyam  pūṣā viṣṇuḥ trīṇi sarāṃsi dhāvan vṛtra haṇam madiram aṃśum asmai
translated: Whom the All-gods, the Maruts, of one mind, have increased, and cooked a hundred buffaloes for thee, O Indra.🔽Pūṣan and Viṣṇu, running to the three lakes, have brought the intoxicating juice to the Vrtra-killer.

original: ā kṣodo mahi vṛtaṃ nadīnāṃ pariṣṭhitamasṛja ūrmimapām
analyzed: ā kṣodaḥ mahi vṛtam nadīnām pariṣṭhitam asṛjaḥ ūrmim apām
translated: The great swelling of the waters, the flood of the rivers, the wave set in motion, have been loosed.

original: tāsāmanu pravata indra panthāṃ prārdayo nīcīrapasaḥ samudram
analyzed: tāsām anu pravataḥ indra panthām prārdayaḥ nīcīḥ apasaḥ samudram
translated: Along the path of those, O Indra, thou hast driven the lowing cows to the ocean.

original: evā tā viśvā cakṛvāṃsamindraṃ mahāmugramajuryaṃ sahodām
analyzed: eva tā viśvā cakṛvāṃsam indram mahām ugram ajuryam sahaḥ dām
translated: Thus have all these made Indra, the mighty, the undecaying, the strong, the bountiful,

original: suvīraṃ tvā svāyudhaṃ suvajramā brahma navyamavase vavṛtyāt
analyzed: su vīram tvā su āyudham su vajramā ā brahma navyam avase vavṛtyāt
translated: The hero with good weapons, the good wielder of the thunderbolt. May the new prayer turn to him for help.

original: sa no vājāya śravasa iṣe ca rāye dhehi dyumata indra viprān
analyzed: sa naḥ vājāya śravase iṣe ca rāye dhehi dyumataḥ indra viprān
translated: Grant us, O Indra, for our strength, for our glory, for our food, for our wealth, O thou who hast thunder, the Brāhmans.

original: bharadvāje nṛvata indra sūrīn divi ca smaidhi pārye na indra🔽ayā vājaṃ devahitaṃ sanema madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ🔽tamu ṣṭuhi yo abhibhūtyojā vanvannavātaḥ puruhūta indraḥ
analyzed: bharadvāje nṛvataḥ indra sūrīn divi ca smā edhi pārye naḥ indra  ayā vājam deva hitam sanema madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ  tam u stuhi yaḥ abhibhūti ojāḥ vanvan avātaḥ puruhūtaḥ indraḥ
translated: Be thou, O Indra, with Bharadvāja, with the princes, in heaven, and on earth, O Indra.🔽May we win strength through thee, O Indra, that is approved by the gods. May we rejoice a hundred winters with brave sons.🔽Praise him whose strength is all-surpassing, who, unresisted, much-invoked, is winning (spoil),

original: aṣāḷhamugraṃ sahamānamābhirgīrbhirvardha vṛṣabhaṃ carṣaṇīnām🔽sa yudhmaḥ satvā khajakṛt samadvā tuvimrakṣo nadanumān ṛjīṣī
analyzed: aṣāḷham ugram sahamānam ābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ vardha vṛṣabham carṣaṇīnām  sa yudhmaḥ satvā khaja kṛt samadvā tuvi mrakṣaḥ nadanumān ṛjīṣī
translated: The irresistible, the mighty, with these hymns exalt the bull of men.🔽He is the warrior, the hero, the destroyer of forts, the mighty, the impetuous, the roaring,

original: bṛhadreṇuścyavano mānuṣīṇāmekaḥ kṛṣṭīnāmabhavat sahāvā
analyzed: bṛhadreṇuḥ cyavanaḥ mānuṣīṇām ekaḥ kṛṣṭīnām abhavat sahāvā
translated: The mighty dust-raising, the invincible, the sole victor of the battles of men.

original: tvaṃ ha nu tyadadamāyo dasyūnrekaḥ kṛṣṭīravanorāryāya
analyzed: tvam ha nu dasyūn rekaḥ kṛṣṭīḥ avanoḥ āryāya
translated: Thou, indeed, hast, alone, for the Ārya, destroyed the Dasyus, O thou of wondrous deeds, and the forts.

original: asti svin nu vīryaṃ tat ta indra na svidasti tad ṛtuthā vi vocaḥ
analyzed: asti svid nu vīryam tat te indra na svid asti tat ṛtuthā vi vocaḥ
translated: Is there such manly strength in thee, O Indra? Is there such strength? Declare it duly.

original: sadid dhi te tuvijātasya manye sahaḥ sahiṣṭha turatasturasya
analyzed: sadid hi te tuvi jātasya manye sahaḥ sahiṣṭha turataḥ turasya
translated: For I think, O thou of mighty birth, that thy might is most invincible, O thou most impetuous of the impetuous.

original: ugramugrasya tavasastavīyo 'radhrasya radhraturo babhūva
analyzed: ugram ugrasya tavasaḥ tavīyaḥ radhrasya radhraturaḥ babhūva
translated: Thou hast become the mightier of the mighty, the more irresistible of the irresistible.

original: tan naḥ pratnaṃ sakhyamastu yuṣme itthā vadadbhirvalamaṅgirobhiḥ
analyzed: tat naḥ pratnam sakhyam astu yuṣme itthā vadadbhiḥ valam aṅgirobhiḥ
translated: Let this ancient friendship of ours be with you, with these speaking ones, with the powerful ones, O Angirases.

original: hannacyutacyud dasmeṣayantam ṛṇoḥ puro vi duroasya viśvāḥ
analyzed: han acyuta cyut dasma iṣayantam ṛṇoḥ puraḥ vi duroasya viśvāḥ
translated: Destroy the one who is to be destroyed, O Achyuta, O Chyu, the one who is to be shaken, the one who is to be driven away, the one who is to be removed from his place, all his obstacles

original: sa hi dhībhirhavyo astyugra īśānakṛn mahati vṛtratūrye🔽sa tokasātā tanaye sa vajrī vitantasāyyo abhavat samatsu
analyzed: sa hi dhībhiḥ havyaḥ asti ugraḥ īśāna kṛt mahati vṛtratūrye  sa toka sātā tanaye sa vajrī vitantasāyyaḥ abhavat samatsu
translated: For he is to be worshipped with thoughts, he is fierce, the lord-maker, in the great battle against Vritra🔽He is the one who protects offspring and the one who protects the son, he is the wielder of the thunderbolt, he is the one who spreads out in the battles

original: sa majmanā janima mānuṣāṇāmamartyena nāmnāti pra sarsre
analyzed: sa majmanā janima mānuṣāṇām amartyena nāmnā ati pra sarsre
translated: He, by his might, has surpassed the birth of humans with his immortal name

original: sa dyumnena sa śavasota rāyā sa vīryeṇa nṛtamaḥ samokāḥ🔽sa yo na muhe na mithū jano bhūt sumantunāmā cumuriṃ dhuniṃ ca
analyzed: sa dyumnena sa śavasā uta rāyā sa vīryeṇa nṛtamaḥ samokāḥ  sa yaḥ na muhe na mithū bhūt sumantu nāmā cumurim dhunim ca
translated: He, with his glory, with his power, and with his wealth, is the most manly of the men, the most excellent🔽He who was not a deceitful or false man, named Sumantu, has defeated Chumuri and Dhuni

original: vṛṇak pipruṃ śambaraṃ śuṣṇamindraḥ purāṃcyautnāya śayathāya nū cit
analyzed: vṛṇak piprum śambaram śuṣṇam indraḥ purāṃcyautnāya śayathāya nu cit
translated: Indra has defeated Pipru, Shambara, and Shushna, in order to open the doors, in order to destroy them

original: udāvatā tvakṣasā panyasā ca vṛtrahatyāya rathamindra tiṣṭha
analyzed: udāvatā tvakṣasā panyasā ca vṛtra hatyāya ratham indra tiṣṭha
translated: Mount your chariot, O Indra, with your swift and excellent strength, in order to kill Vritra

original: dhiṣva vajraṃ hasta ā dakṣiṇatrābhi pra manda purudatra māyāḥ
analyzed: dhiṣva vajram haste ā dakṣiṇatrā abhi pra manda puru datra māyāḥ
translated: Hold the thunderbolt in your right hand, crush the deceitful ones, O you who give much, O you who have many boons

original: agnirna śuṣkaṃ vanamindra hetī rakṣo ni dhakṣyaśanirna bhīmā
analyzed: agniḥ na śuṣkam vanam indra hetiḥ rakṣaḥ ni dhakṣi aśaniḥ na bhīmā
translated: O Indra, like a dry forest, like a terrible thunderbolt, burn the Rakshas to ashes

original: gambhīraya ṛṣvayā yo rurojādhvānayad duritā dambhayacca
analyzed: ṛṣvayā yaḥ ruroja adhvānayat duritā dambhayat ca
translated: He who has shattered with his deep and lofty (voice), who has led away the evils and has destroyed them

original: ā sahasraṃ pathibhirindra rāyā tuvidyumna tuvivājebhirarvāk
analyzed: ā sahasram pathibhiḥ indra rāyā tuvi dyumna tuvi vājebhiḥ arvāk
translated: Come, O Indra, with a thousand paths, with wealth, O thou of mighty splendour, with great booty,

original: yāhi sūno sahaso yasya nū cidadeva īśe puruhūta yotoḥ
analyzed: yāhi sūno sahasaḥ yasya nu cidadevaḥ īśe puruhūta yotoḥ
translated: Come, O Son of Strength, whose is no god, O thou invoked of many, whose is no other than thine.

original: pra tuvidyumnasya sthavirasya ghṛṣverdivo rarapśe mahimā pṛthivyāḥ
analyzed: pra tuvi dyumnasya sthavirasya ghṛṣveḥ divaḥ rarapśe mahimā pṛthivyāḥ
translated: The greatness of the mighty, the strong, the impetuous one, is praised in heaven and on earth.

original: nāsya śatrurna pratimānamasti na pratiṣṭhiḥpurumāyasya sahyoḥ
analyzed: na asya śatruḥ na pratimānam asti na sahyoḥ
translated: He has no foe, no rival, no supporter, no one to withstand the many wiles of the mighty one.

original: pra tat te adyā karaṇaṃ kṛtaṃ bhūt kutsaṃ yadāyumatithigvamasmai
analyzed: pra tat te adyā karaṇam kṛtam bhūt kutsam yat āyum atithigvam asmai
translated: That deed of thine, O Indra, which thou hast done to-day, in granting Kutsa the guest-friend,

original: purū sahasrā ni śiśā abhi kṣāmut tūrvayāṇaṃ dhṛṣatā ninetha
analyzed: purū sahasrā ni śiśāḥ abhi kṣāmudh tūrvayāṇam dhṛṣatā ninetha
translated: In slaying many thousands, in forcibly bringing back Turvaga,

original: anu tvāhighne adha deva devā madan viśve kavitamaṃ kavīnām
analyzed: anu tvā ahi ghne adha deva devāḥ madan viśve kavitamam kavīnām
translated: After thee, O god, the gods rejoice, as the most wise of the wise, in slaying Ahi.

original: karo yatra varivo bādhitāya dive janāya tanve gṛṇānaḥ
analyzed: karaḥ yatra varivaḥ bādhitāya dive janāya tanve gṛṇānaḥ
translated: Where thou makest room for the oppressed, for the sky, for the people, for the body, singing praises.

original: anu dyāvāpṛthivī tat ta ojo 'martyā jihata indra devāḥ
analyzed: anu dyāvāpṛthivī tat te ojaḥ martyāḥ jihate indra devāḥ
translated: After that, O Indra, the immortal gods, heaven and earth, strive for thy might.

original: kṛṣvā kṛtno akṛtaṃ yat te astyukthaṃ navīyo janayasva yajñaiḥ
analyzed: kṛṣva kṛtno a kṛtam yat te asti uktham navīyaḥ janayasva yajñaiḥ
translated: Do thou, O performer, what thou hast to do, generate the newer hymn with sacrifices.

original: mahānindro nṛvadā carṣaṇiprā uta dvibarhā aminaḥ sahobhiḥ
analyzed: mahān indraḥ nṛvadā carṣaṇi prāḥ uta dvibarhāḥ aminaḥ sahobhiḥ
translated: Great Indra, like a man, the leader of men, and with twofold strength, the irresistible one,

original: asmadryag vāvṛdhe viryāyoruḥ pṛthuḥ sukṛtaḥ kartṛbhirbhūt
analyzed: asmadryak vāvṛdhe viryāya uruḥ pṛthuḥ su kṛtaḥ kartṛbhiḥ bhūt
translated: For us, O Indra, grow thou great in strength: be thou mighty, vast, well-made by the makers.

original: indrameva dhiṣaṇā sātaye dhād bṛhantam ṛṣvamajaraṃ yuvānam
analyzed: indram eva dhiṣaṇā sātaye dhāt bṛhantam ṛṣvam ajaram yuvānam
translated: Let the prayer support Indra himself for conquest, the mighty, lofty, undecaying, youthful.

original: aṣāḷhena savasā śūśuvāṃsaṃ sadyaścid yo vāvṛdhe asāmi🔽pṛthū karasnā bahulā gabhastī asmadryak saṃ mimīhi śravāṃsi🔽yūtheva paśvaḥ paśupā damūnā asmānindrābhyā vavṛtsvājau
analyzed: aṣāḷhena savasā śūśuvāṃsam sadyaścit yaḥ vāvṛdhe asāmi  pṛthū karasnā bahulā gabhastī asmadryak sam mimīhi śravāṃsi  yūthā iva paśvaḥ paśu pāḥ damūnāḥ asmān indra ābhyā vavṛtsva ājau
translated: With the imperishable, with the well-being, with the prosperous, whom in a moment he hath caused to wax strong.🔽With broad arms, with abundant grasp, measure thou out glories for us.🔽Like a herdsman, O Indra, dwelling with the folk, turn thou unto us in the battles.

original: taṃ va indraṃ catinamasya śākairiha nūnaṃ vājayanto huvema
