analyzed: tam vaḥ indram catinamasya śākaiḥ iha nūnam vājayantaḥ huvema
translated: To that Indra let us call, to be honoured with praises, even now, exalting him,

original: yathā cit pūrve jaritāra āsuranedyā anavadyā ariṣṭāḥ
analyzed: yathā cit pūrve jaritāraḥ āsuḥ anedyāḥ anavadyāḥ ariṣṭāḥ
translated: So that the former singers, blameless, irreproachable, uninjured,

original: dhṛtavrato dhanadāḥ somavṛddhaḥ sa hi vāmasya vasunaḥ purukṣuḥ
analyzed: dhṛtavrataḥ dhana dāḥ soma vṛddhaḥ sa hi vāmasya vasunaḥ purukṣuḥ
translated: Firm in their vow, bestowers of wealth, increased by Soma, for he is the great lord of good things.

original: saṃ jagmire pathyā rāyo asmin samudre na sindhavo yādamānāḥ🔽śaviṣṭhaṃ na ā bhara śūra śava ojiṣṭhamojo abhibhūtaugram
analyzed: sam jagmire pathyāḥ rāyaḥ asmin samudre na sindhavaḥ yādamānāḥ  śaviṣṭham naḥ ā bhara śūra śavaḥ ojiṣṭham ojaḥ abhibhūta ugram
translated: The paths of wealth have come together in this one, as the rivers striving to the ocean.🔽Bring us, O Indra, the most manly manly power, the mightiest might to overcome the fierce.

original: viśvā dyumnā vṛṣṇyā mānuṣāṇāmasmabhyaṃ dāharivo mādayadhyai
analyzed: viśvā dyumnā vṛṣṇyā mānuṣāṇām asmabhyam dāharivas mādayadhyai
translated: All the glories and manly powers of men, to delight us, O thou who givest delight.

original: yaste madaḥ pṛtaṇāṣāḷ amṛdhra indra taṃ na ā bhara śūśuvāṃsam
analyzed: yaḥ te madaḥ pṛtaṇāṣāh amṛdhraḥ indra tam naḥ ā bhara śūśuvāṃsam
translated: That joy of yours, O Indra, which is irresistible in battle, bring thou to us, O thou who art to be magnified.

original: yena tokasya tanayasya sātau maṃsīmahi jigīvāṃsastvotāḥ
analyzed: yena tokasya tanayasya sātau maṃsīmahi jigīvāṃsaḥ tvā ūtāḥ
translated: By which we may be victorious in the winning of offspring and sons, and be exalted by thee.

original: ā no bhara vṛṣaṇaṃ śuṣmamindra dhanaspṛtaṃ śūśuvāṃsaṃ sudakṣam
analyzed: ā naḥ bhara vṛṣaṇam śuṣmam indra dhana spṛtam śūśuvāṃsam su dakṣam
translated: Bring us, O Indra, the strong, the mighty, the victorious, the self-existent, the very powerful,

original: yena vaṃsāma pṛtanāsu śatrūn tavotibhiruta jāmīnrajāmīn
analyzed: yena vaṃsāma pṛtanāsu śatrūn tava ūtibhiḥ uta jāmīn rajāmīn
translated: By which we may conquer the enemies in battles, and the kinsmen by thy aids, O kinsman.

original: ā te śuṣmo vṛṣabha etu paścādottarādadharādā purastāt
analyzed: ā te śuṣmaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ etu paścāt ā uttarāt adharāt ā purastāt
translated: Let thy strength come to us from the west, from the north, from the south, from the east,

original: ā viśvato abhi sametvarvāṃ indra dyumnaṃ svarvad dhehyasme
analyzed: ā viśvatas abhi sametu arvān indra dyumnam svarvat dhehi asme
translated: From all sides let it come to us, O Indra. Bring us the glory that is heavenly.

original: nṛvat ta indra nṛtamābhirūtī vaṃsīmahi vāmaṃ śromatebhiḥ
analyzed: nṛvat te indra nṛtama abhirūtī vaṃsīmahi vāmam śromatebhiḥ
translated: Like a hero, O Indra, with thy most heroic aids, we will win the good by our praises.

original: īkṣe hi vasva ubhayasya rājan dhā ratnaṃ mahi sthūraṃ bṛhantam
analyzed: īkṣe hi vasvaḥ ubhayasya rājan dhāḥ ratnam mahi sthūram bṛhantam
translated: For I behold, O king of both, thy wealth. Grant us a great, firm, lofty treasure.

original: marutvantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ / / /
analyzed: marutvantam vṛṣabham
translated: Endowed with the Maruts, the bull...

original: janaṃ vajrin mahi cin manyamānamebhyo nṛbhyo randhayā yeṣvasmi
analyzed: janam vajrin mahi cit manyamānam ebhyaḥ nṛbhyaḥ randhaya yeṣu asmi
translated: The people, O wielder of the thunderbolt, however much they may think themselves, deliver them up to these men, in whom I am.

original: adhā hi tvā pṛthivyāṃ śūrasātau havāmahe tanayegoṣvapsu
analyzed: adhā hi tvā pṛthivyām śūrasātau havāmahe tanaye goṣu apsu
translated: For now, O hero, we invoke thee on earth in the winning of booty, in the offspring, in the cattle, in the waters.

original: vayaṃ ta ebhiḥ puruhūta sakhyaiḥ śatroḥśatroruttara itsyāma
analyzed: vayam te ebhiḥ puruhūta sakhyaiḥ śatroḥ śatroḥ uttare itsyāma
translated: By these friendships, O much-invoked one, by these, we will be superior to every foe.

original: ghnanto vṛtrāṇyubhayāni śūra rāyā madema bṛhatātvotāḥ
analyzed: ghnantaḥ vṛtrāṇi ubhayāni śūra rāyā madema bṛhatā ātvā utāḥ
translated: Slaying all the Vr̥itras, O Hero, may we be rich in great possessions, and be prosperous.

original: dyaurna ya indrābhi bhūmāryastasthau rayiḥ śavasā pṛtsu janān
analyzed: dyauḥ na yaḥ indra abhi bhūmā āryaḥ tasthau rayiḥ śavasā pṛtsu janān
translated: As the heaven is above thee, O Indra, so is the noble wealth which standeth in the battles for men.

original: taṃ naḥ sahasrabharamurvarāsāṃ daddhi sūno sahaso vṛtraturam
analyzed: tam naḥ sahasra bharam urvarā sām daddhi sūno sahasaḥ vṛtra turam
translated: Give us that wealth, O Son of Strength, which bringeth a thousand gifts, which conquereth Vr̥itra, in the tilth.

original: divo na tubhyamanvindra satrāsuryaṃ devebhirdhāyi viśvam
analyzed: divaḥ na tubhyam anu indra satrā asuryam devebhiḥ dhāyi viśvam
translated: O Indra, in the battles of the Gods, all this hath been made for thee, as from the sky.

original: ahiṃ yad vṛtramapo vavrivāṃsaṃ hannṛjīṣin viṣṇunāsacānaḥ
analyzed: ahim yat vṛtram apaḥ vavrivāṃsam han ṛjīṣin viṣṇunā asacānaḥ
translated: When thou, O R̥ijiṣvan, with Viṣṇu, slewest the dragon Vr̥itra, who would fain have stayed the waters.

original: tūrvannojīyān tavasastavīyān kṛtabrahmendro vṛddhamahāḥ
analyzed: tūrvan ojīyān tavasaḥ tavīyān kṛta brahmā indraḥ vṛddha mahāḥ
translated: Thou hast become more mighty than the mighty, with prayer accomplished, Indra, great and strong.

original: rājābhavan madhunaḥ somyasya viśvāsāṃ yat purāṃ dartnumāvat
analyzed: rājā abhavat madhunaḥ somyasya viśvāsām yat purām
translated: Thou hast become the King of sweet meath, of Soma, who in the days of old didst smite down all the forts.

original: śatairapadran paṇaya indrātra daśoṇaye kavaye 'rkasātau
analyzed: śataiḥ apadran paṇayaḥ indra atra daśoṇaye kavaye rka sātau
translated: With hundreds the Paṇis have fled hither, O Indra, at the ten-ox contest of the sage.

original: vadhaiḥ śuṣṇasyāśuṣasya māyāḥ pitvo nārirecīt kiṃcana pra
analyzed: vadhaiḥ śuṣṇasya aśuṣasya māyāḥ pitvaḥ na arirecīt kiṃcana pra
translated: The magic arts of the wicked Ṣushṇa, O thou who drinkest the milk, have been cast away.

original: maho druho apa viśvāyu dhāyi vajrasya yat patane pādi śuṣṇaḥ
analyzed: mahaḥ druhaḥ apa viśva āyu dhāyi vajrasya yat patane pādi śuṣṇaḥ
translated: The great, all-sustaining, foe-destroying bolt hath been made ready: Ṣushṇa hath been slain by the fall of the thunderbolt.

original: uru ṣa sarathaṃ sārathaye karindraḥ kutsāya sūryasya sātau
analyzed: uru sa sa ratham sārathaye karindraḥ kutsāya sūryasya sātau
translated: Indra hath made the chariot-path wide for the charioteer, for Kutsa, in the winning of the sun.

original: pra śyeno na madiramaṃśumasmai śiro dāsasya namucermathāyan
analyzed: pra śyenaḥ na madiram aṃśum asmai śiraḥ dāsasya namuceḥ mathāyan
translated: Like a hawk to the intoxicating plant for him, crushing the head of Namuci the Dāsa,

original: prāvan namīṃ sāpyaṃ sasantaṃ pṛṇag rāyā samiṣā saṃ svasti🔽vi piprorahimāyasya dṛḷhāḥ puro vajriñchavasā na dardaḥ
analyzed: prāvat namīm sāpyam sasantam pṛṇak rāyā sam iṣā sam svasti  vi piproḥ ahi māyasya dṛḍhāḥ puraḥ vajrin śavasā na dardar
translated: He sent forth the moistening rain to the parched one, and filled the one who was full with wealth and food.🔽The firm forts of the unbending foe, O Indra, he rent asunder with his might, with his thunderbolt.

original: sudāman tad rekṇo apramṛṣyam ṛjiśvane dātraṃ dāśuṣe dāḥ
analyzed: su dāman tat rekṇaḥ apramṛṣyam ṛjiśvane dātram dāśuṣe dāḥ
translated: Give to the worshipper, O bountiful one, that wealth which is not to be taken away, the gift to Ṛjiśvan.

original: sa vetasuṃ daśamāyaṃ daśoṇiṃ tūtujimindraḥ svabhiṣṭisumnaḥ
analyzed: sa vetasum daśa māyam daśoṇim tūtujim indraḥ su abhiṣṭi sumnaḥ
translated: He, the impetuous Indra, desirous of his own praise, gave to Vetasu, the ten-fold, the ten-spoked (wheel).

original: ā tugraṃ śaśvadibhaṃ dyotanāya māturna sīmupa sṛjā iyadhyai
analyzed: ā tugram śaśvat ibham dyotanāya mātuḥ na sīm upa sṛjai iyadhyai
translated: To Tugra, the ever-shining one, to Dyotitanā, to the mother's son, release him to come hither.

original: sa īṃ spṛdho vanate apratīto bibhrad vajraṃ vṛtrahaṇaṃ gabhastau
analyzed: saḥ īm spṛdhaḥ vanate apratītaḥ bibhrat vajram vṛtra haṇam gabhastau
translated: He conquers the enemies, the unconquered one, bearing in his arms the thunderbolt, the slayer of Vrtra.

original: tiṣṭhad dharī adhyasteva garte vacoyujā vahata indram ṛṣvam
analyzed: tiṣṭhat harī adhyastā iva garte vacaḥ yujā vahataḥ indram ṛṣvam
translated: Standing in the two bays, as in a pit, yoked with speech, they carry the lofty Indra.

original: sanema te 'vasā navya indra pra pūrava stavanta enā yajñaiḥ
analyzed: sanema te vasā navyaḥ indra pra pūravaḥ stavante enā yajñaiḥ
translated: May we, O Indra, with new aid, with the Pūrus, with these (men), with their sacrifices, obtain thee for praise.

original: sapta yat puraḥ śarma śāradīrdard dhan dāsīḥ purukutsāya śikṣan
analyzed: sapta yat puraḥ śarma śāradīḥ dart han dāsīḥ purukutsāya śikṣan
translated: When thou didst shatter the seven autumn forts, giving the Dāsas to Purukutsa to rule.

original: tvaṃ vṛdha indra pūrvyo bhūrvarivasyannuśane kāvyāya
analyzed: tvam vṛdhaḥ indra pūrvyaḥ bhūḥ varivasyan uśane kāvyāya
translated: Thou, O Indra, art the ancient increaser, favouring Uśanā for the sake of Kavya.

original: parā navavāstvamanudeyaṃ mahe pitre dadātha svaṃ napātam
analyzed: parā navavāstvam anudeyam mahe pitre dada atha svam napātam
translated: The new abode, which is to be given to the great father, give to your own son.

original: tvaṃ dhunirindra / / /
analyzed: tvam dhuniḥ indra
translated: You are the shaker, O Indra,

original: tava ha tyadindra viṣvamājau sasto dhunīcumurī yā ha siṣvap
analyzed: tava ha tyad indra viṣvam ājau sastaḥ dhunī cumurī yā ha siṣvap
translated: Your own, O Indra, in all battles, the shaker and the churner, which you shake,

original: dīdayadit tubhyaṃ somebhiḥ sunvan dabhītiridhmabhṛtiḥ pakthyarkaiḥ
analyzed: dīdayat id tubhyam somebhiḥ sunvan dabhītiḥ idhma bhṛtiḥ pakthī arkaiḥ
translated: The light has shone forth for you with the Soma-pressings, the ladle-bearer with the kindling sticks, the Pakthya with the hymns.

original: imā u tvā purutamasya kārorhavyaṃ vīra havyā havante
analyzed: imāḥ u tvā purutamasya kāroḥ havyam vīra havyā havante
translated: These offerings of yours, O hero, are brought as oblations by the most generous one.

original: dhiyo ratheṣṭhāmajaraṃ navīyo rayirvibhūtirīyate vacasyā🔽tamu stuṣa indraṃ yo vidāno girvāhasaṃ gīrbhīryajñavṛddham🔽yasya divamati mahnā pṛthivyāḥ purumāyasya riricemahitvam
analyzed: dhiyaḥ ratheṣṭhām ajaram navīyaḥ rayiḥ vibhūtiḥ īyate vacasyā  tam u stuṣe indram yaḥ vidānaḥ gir vāhasam gīrbhīḥ yajña vṛddham  yasya divam ati mahnā pṛthivyāḥ puru māyasya riricemahi tvam
translated: The thoughts, the chariot-borne, the ageless, the newer, the wealth that is to be divided, comes as the most desirable.

original: sa it tamo 'vayunaṃ tatanvat sūryeṇa vayunavaccakāra🔽kadā te martā amṛtasya dhāmeyakṣanto na minanti svadhāvaḥ🔽yastā cakāra sa kuha svidindraḥ kamā janaṃ carati kāsu vikṣu🔽kaste yajño manase śaṃ varāya ko arka indrakatamaḥ sa hotā
analyzed: saḥ id tamaḥ vayunam tatanvat sūryeṇa vayunavat cakāra 🔽kadā te martāḥ amṛtasya dhāma iyakṣantaḥ na minanti svadhāvas 🔽yaḥ tā cakāra sa kuha svid indraḥ kamā janam carati kāsu vikṣu 🔽kaḥ te yajñaḥ manase śam varāya kaḥ arkaḥ indra katamaḥ sa hotā
translated: We praise that Indra, who, being known, is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns, who is to be praised with hymns,

original: idā hi te veviṣataḥ purājāḥ pratnāsa āsuḥ purukṛt sakhāyaḥ
analyzed: idā hi te veviṣataḥ purājāḥ pratnāsaḥ āsuḥ puru kṛt sakhāyaḥ
translated: For these, O Indra, thy ancient friends, the performers of ancient rites, have come to thee

original: ye madhyamāsa uta nūtanāsa utāvamasya puruhūta bodhi
analyzed: ye madhyamāsaḥ uta nūtanāsaḥ uta avamasya puruhūta bodhi
translated: The middling ones and the new ones, O much-invoked one, be thou also the protector of the lowly.

original: taṃ pṛchanto 'varāsaḥ parāṇi pratnā ta indra śrutyānu yemuḥ
analyzed: tam pṛcchantaḥ varāsaḥ parāṇi pratnā te indra śrutyā anu yemuḥ
translated: The lowly ones, asking thee about the distant ones, have followed thee, O Indra, by the ancient fame.

original: arcāmasi vīra brahmavāho yādeva vidma tāt tvā mahāntam
analyzed: arcāmasi vīra brahma vāhaḥ yādeva vidma tāt tvā mahāntam
translated: We praise thee, O hero, who hast the Brahman as thy bearer, we know thee as the great one.

original: abhi tvā pājo rakṣaso vi tasthe mahi jajñānamabhi tat su tiṣṭha
analyzed: abhi tvā pājaḥ rakṣasaḥ vi tasthe mahi jajñānam abhi tat su tiṣṭha
translated: The flame of the Rakshas has spread out against thee, O mighty one, stand firm against that which is born.

original: tava pratnena yujyena sakhyā vajreṇa dhṛṣṇo apatā nudasva
analyzed: tava pratnena yujyena sakhyā vajreṇa dhṛṣṇo apatā nudasva
translated: With thy ancient yoke-fellowship, O bold one, with thy thunderbolt, drive away the foe.

original: sa tu śrudhīndra nūtanasya brahmaṇyato vīra kārudhāyaḥ
analyzed: sa tu śrudhi indra nūtanasya brahmaṇyataḥ vīra kāru dhāyaḥ
translated: Do thou listen, O Indra, to the new prayer of the Brahman, O hero, to the prayer of the one who desires to do good.

original: tvaṃ hyāpiḥ pradivi pitṝṇāṃ śaśvad babhūtha suhava eṣṭau
analyzed: tvam hi āpiḥ pradivi pitṝṇām śaśvat babhūtha su havaḥ eṣṭau
translated: For thou hast become, O bountiful one, the ever-present good friend of the fathers in the wide (heaven).

original: protaye varuṇaṃ mitramindraṃ marutaḥ kṛṣvāvase no adya
analyzed: protaye varuṇam mitram indram marutaḥ kṛṣva avase naḥ adya
translated: Bring to us today Varuṇa, Mitra, Indra, the Maruts, for our help.

original: pra pūṣaṇaṃ viṣṇumagniṃ purandhiṃ savitāramoṣadhīḥ parvatāṃśca
analyzed: pra pūṣaṇam viṣṇum agnim purandhim savitāram oṣadhīḥ parvatān ca
translated: Bring Pūṣan, Viṣṇu, Agni, Purandhi, Savitar, the plants, and the mountains.

original: ima u tvā puruśāka prayajyo jaritāro abhyarcantyarkaiḥ
analyzed: ime u tvā puru śāka prayajyo jaritāraḥ abhyarcanti arkaiḥ
translated: These thy worshippers, O thou of great power, worthy of sacrifice, praise thee with hymns.

original: śrudhī havamā huvato huvāno na tvāvānanyo amṛta tvadasti
analyzed: śrudhi havam ā huvataḥ huvānaḥ na tvāvān anyaḥ amṛta tvat asti
translated: Listen to the invocation of the invocator, O invocator; none other than thou hast immortality.

original: nū ma ā vācamupa yāhi vidvān viśvebhiḥ sūno sahaso yajatraiḥ
analyzed: nu me ā vācam upa yāhi vidvān viśvebhiḥ sūno sahasaḥ yajatraiḥ
translated: Now come to me, O wise one, with your speech, with all the sons of strength who are worthy of sacrifice,

original: ye agnijihvā ṛtasāpa āsurye manuṃ cakruruparaṃ dasāya
analyzed: ye agni jihvāḥ ṛtasāpaḥ āsuḥ ye manum cakruḥ uparam dasāya
translated: Those who have the tongue of Agni, who are devoted to truth, who have made Manu superior to the enemy.

original: sa no bodhi puraetā sugeṣūta durgeṣu pathikṛd vidānaḥ🔽ye aśramāsa uravo vahiṣṭhāstebhirna indrābhi vakṣi vājam
analyzed: sa naḥ bodhi puraetā sugeṣu uta durgeṣu pathikṛt vidānaḥ  ye aśramāsaḥ uravaḥ vahiṣṭhāḥ tebhiḥ naḥ indra abhi vakṣi vājam
translated: Be our leader on the good paths, our guide on the difficult ones, the maker of paths.🔽With those most excellent paths, those far-reaching ones, O Indra, bring us strength with them.

original: ya eka id dhavyaścarṣaṇīnāmindraṃ taṃ gīrbhirabhyarca ābhiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ id havyaḥ carṣaṇīnām indram tam gīrbhiḥ abhyarce ābhiḥ
translated: He alone is the oblation of the people. I praise that Indra with these songs,

original: yaḥ patyate vṛṣabho vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā purumāyaḥ sahasvān
analyzed: yaḥ patyate vṛṣabhaḥ vṛṣṇyāvān satyaḥ satvā puru māyaḥ sahasvān
translated: The bull who rules, the powerful one, the true hero, the mighty one with many wiles, the conqueror.

original: tamu naḥ pūrve pitaro navagvāḥ sapta viprāso abhi vājayantaḥ
analyzed: tam u naḥ pūrve pitaraḥ navagvāḥ sapta viprāsaḥ abhi vājayantaḥ
translated: Our ancient fathers, the Navagvas, the seven sages, exalting him,

original: nakṣaddābhaṃ taturiṃ parvateṣṭhāmadroghavācaṃ matibhiḥ śaviṣṭham
analyzed: nakṣat dābham taturim parvateṣṭhām amatrogha vācam matibhiḥ śaviṣṭham
translated: The irresistible, swift one, dwelling on the mountain, whose words are guileless, the most powerful one with thoughts.

original: tamīmaha indramasya rāyaḥ puruvīrasya nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ
analyzed: tam īmahe indramasya rāyaḥ puru vīrasya nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ
translated: We invoke that Indra for this wealth, of many heroes, of men, of great strength,

original: yo askṛdhoyurajaraḥ svarvān tamā bhara harivo mādayadhyai
analyzed: yaḥ askṛdhoyuḥ ajaraḥ svarvān tam ā bhara harivas mādayadhyai
translated: Who is the ever-youthful, the undecaying, the possessor of heaven. O bringer of wealth, bring him to delight us.

original: tan no vi voco yadi te purā cijjaritāra ānaśuḥ sumnamindra
analyzed: tat naḥ vi vocaḥ yadi te purā cit jaritāraḥ ānaśuḥ sumnam indra
translated: Tell us that, if the singers of old have brought you bliss, O Indra.

original: kaste bhāgaḥ kiṃ vayo dudhra khidvaḥ puruhūta purūvaso 'suraghnaḥ
analyzed: kaḥ te bhāgaḥ kim vayaḥ dudhra khidvaḥ puruhūta purūvaso sura ghnaḥ
translated: What is thy share, what is thy age, O wondrous one, O much-invoked, O thou of much wealth, O slayer of Asuras?

original: taṃ pṛchantī vajrahastaṃ ratheṣṭhāmindraṃ vepī vakvarīyasya nū gīḥ
analyzed: tam pṛcchantī vajrahastam ratheṣṭhām indram vepī vakvarīyasya nu gīḥ
translated: The eager one, the one with the bent back, asks thee, O Indra, the wielder of the thunderbolt, the rider of the chariot. Now let the hymn of the one who is to be helped go forth to thee.

original: tuvigrābhaṃ tuvikūrmiṃ rabhodāṃ gātumiṣe nakṣate tumramacha
analyzed: tuvi grābham tuvikūrmim rabhaḥ dām gātum iṣe nakṣate tumram acha
translated: The strong, the far-reaching, the impetuous one, the ruddy one, we seek to go to the food.

original: ayā ha tyaṃ māyayā vāvṛdhānaṃ manojuvā svatavaḥ parvatena🔽acyutā cid vīḷitā svojo rujo vi dṛḷhā dhṛṣatā virapśin
analyzed: ayā ha tyam māyayā vāvṛdhānam manaḥ juvā svatavaḥ parvatena  acyutā cit vīḍitā su ojaḥ rujaḥ vi dṛḍhā dhṛṣatā virapśin
translated: This one, grown by his own power, swift as thought, I yoke with magic power, the self-existent one, with the mountain.🔽Even the unshaken ones he has shaken, with his own strength he has crushed, he has rent asunder the firm ones, O thou who art to be praised.

original: taṃ vo dhiyā navyasyā śaviṣṭhaṃ pratnaṃ pratnavat paritaṃsayadhyai
analyzed: tam vaḥ dhiyā navyasyā śaviṣṭham pratnam pratna vat paritaṃsayadhyai
translated: Him, the strongest, the ancient one, we will yoke with the new hymn, as in ancient times.

original: sa no vakṣadanimānaḥ suvahmendro viśvānyatidurgahāṇi
analyzed: sa naḥ vakṣat animānaḥ suvahmā indraḥ viśvāni ati durgahāṇi
translated: May he, the swift-moving one, carry us over all the difficult passages, O Indra.

original: ā janāya druhvaṇe pārthivāni divyāni dīpayo 'ntarikṣā
analyzed: ā janāya druhvaṇe pārthivāni divyāni dīpayaḥ ntarikṣā
translated: Light up for the people who hate, the earthly ones, the heavenly ones, and the ones in the atmosphere.

original: tapā vṛṣan viśvataḥ śociṣā tān brahmadviṣe śocaya kṣāmapaśca
analyzed: tapa vṛṣan viśvatas śociṣā tān brahma dviṣe śocaya kṣāma paḥ ca
translated: O bull, heat them on all sides with thy flame. Burn the back and belly of him who hates prayer.

original: bhuvo janasya divyasya rājā pārthivasya jagatastveṣasandṛk
analyzed: bhuvaḥ janasya divyasya rājā pārthivasya jagataḥ tveṣa sandṛś
translated: Thou art the king of the heavenly people, of the moving world on earth, of wondrous appearance.

original: dhiṣva vajraṃ dakṣiṇa indra haste viśvā ajurya dayase vi māyāḥ
analyzed: dhiṣva vajram dakṣiṇe indra haste viśvāḥ ajurya dayase vi māyāḥ
translated: Hold the thunderbolt in thy right hand, O Indra. Thou dost overcome all deceits, O thou who art not subject to old age.

original: ā saṃyatamindra ṇaḥ svastiṃ śatrutūryāya bṛhatīmamṛdhrām🔽yayā dāsānyāryāṇi vṛtrā karo vajrin sutukā nāhuṣāṇi
analyzed: ā saṃyatam indra naḥ svastim śatru tūryāya bṛhatīm amṛdhrām  yayā dāsāni āryāṇi vṛtrā karaḥ vajrin sutukā nāhuṣāṇi
translated: O Indra, bring us prosperity, to be enjoyed, vast, invincible, to conquer our enemies🔽By which, O wielder of the thunderbolt, you make the Aryan people victorious over the Dasyus, O son of Nahusha

original: sa no niyudbhiḥ puruhūta vedho viśvavārābhirā gahi prayajyo
analyzed: sa naḥ niyudbhiḥ puruhūta vedhaḥ viśva vārābhiḥ ā gahi prayajyo
translated: O Puruhuta, O wise one, come to us with your yokes, which are desired by all, O worthy of sacrifice

original: na yā adevo varate na deva ābhiryāhi tūyamā madryadrik
analyzed: na yāḥ adevaḥ varate na devaḥ ābhiḥ yāhi tūyamā madryadrik
translated: By which yokes neither a non-god nor a god can restrain you. Come quickly with these, O you who love the Madhu river

original: suta it tvaṃ nimiśla indra some stome brahmaṇi śasyamānaukthe🔽yad vā yuktābhyāṃ maghavan haribhyāṃ bibhrad vajrambāhvorindra yāsi
analyzed: sute id tvam nimiślaḥ indra some stome brahmaṇi śasyamāna okthe  yat vā yuktābhyām maghavan haribhyām bibhrat vajram bāhvoḥ indra yāsi
translated: You are pressed, O Indra, in the Nimiṣa Soma, in the praise, in the prayer, in the chanted Uktha🔽Or, O magnanimous one, when you go, O Indra, bearing the thunderbolt in your arms, yoked with the two bay horses

original: yad vā divi pārye suṣvimindra vṛtrahatye 'vasi śūrasātau
analyzed: yat vā divi pārye suṣvim indra vṛtra hatye vasi śūrasātau
translated: Or, O Indra, when you dwell on the last day of the year, in the feast of the strong, in the slaying of Vrtra, O hero

original: yad vā dakṣasya bibhyuṣo abibhyadarandhayaḥ śardhata indra dasyūn
analyzed: yat vā dakṣasya bibhyuṣaḥ a bibhyat arandhayaḥ śardhataḥ indra dasyūn
translated: Or, when you fearlessly helped the trembling Dakṣa, you crushed the Dasyus, O Indra, O you who are to be praised

original: pātā sutamindro astu somaṃ praṇenīrugro jaritāramūtī
analyzed: pātā sutam indraḥ astu somam praṇenīḥ ugraḥ jaritāram ūtī
translated: May Indra, the strong one, be the protector of the Soma that is pressed, and of the singer who is his supporter

original: kartā vīrāya suṣvaya u lokaṃ dātā vasu stuvate kīraye cit
analyzed: kartā vīrāya suṣvaye u lokam dātā vasu stuvate kīraye cit
translated: He makes room for the hero who is devoted to him, he gives wealth even to the poor singer

original: ganteyānti savanā haribhyāṃ babhrirvajraṃ papiḥ somaṃ dadirgāḥ
analyzed: gantā iyānti savanā haribhyām babhriḥ vajram papiḥ somam dadiḥ gāḥ
translated: The tawny one, the drinker of the Soma, the giver of the cows, goes to the libations with the two bays, bearing the thunderbolt

original: kartā vīraṃ naryaṃ sarvavīraṃ śrotā havaṃgṛṇata stomavāhāḥ🔽asmai vayaṃ yad vāvāna tad viviṣma indrāya yo naḥ pradivo apas kaḥ🔽sute some stumasi śaṃsadukthendrāya brahma vardhanaṃ yathāsat
analyzed: kartā vīram naryam sarva vīram śrotā havaṃgṛṇataḥ stoma vāhāḥ  asmai vayam yat vāvāna tat viviṣmaḥ indrāya yaḥ naḥ pradivaḥ apaḥ kaḥ  sute some stumasi śaṃsat ukthā indrāya brahma vardhanam yathā asat
translated: The maker of the hero, the man, the all-hero, the hearer of the one who calls, the bearer of the praise-song🔽We will accomplish for him whatever he desires, for Indra who has given us the waters from the sky🔽We praise Indra at the Soma pressing, with hymns and prayers, so that he may be present

original: brahmāṇi hi cakṛṣe vardhanāni tāvat ta indra matibhirviviṣmaḥ🔽sute some sutapāḥ śantamāni rāndryā kriyāsma vakṣaṇāni yajñaiḥ
analyzed: brahmāṇi hi cakṛṣe vardhanāni tāvat te indra matibhiḥ viviṣmaḥ  sute some suta pāḥ śantamāni rāndryā kriyāsma vakṣaṇāni yajñaiḥ
translated: For you have made prayers and praises, so much we will accomplish for you with our thoughts🔽At the Soma pressing, O you who are purified by the Soma, make the most auspicious🔽With sacrifices, we will make the most beautiful offerings for the sake of Indra

original: sa no bodhi puroḷāśaṃ rarāṇaḥ pibā tu somaṃ goṛjīkamindra
analyzed: sa naḥ bodhi puroḷāśam rarāṇaḥ pibā tu somam goṛjīkam indra
translated: Be pleased with our oblation, O Indra, and drink the Soma mixed with milk

original: edaṃ barhiryajamānasya sīdoruṃ kṛdhi tvāyata u lokam🔽sa mandasvā hyanu joṣamugra pra tvā yajñāsa ime aśnuvantu
analyzed: ā idam barhiḥ yajamānasya sīda urum kṛdhi tvāyataḥ u lokam  sa mandasva hi anu joṣam ugra pra tvā yajñāsaḥ ime aśnuvantu
translated: Sit on this sacrificial grass of the sacrificer, make it wide and spacious for you🔽Be pleased, O mighty one, in accordance with your will, may these sacrifices of ours reach you

original: preme havāsaḥ puruhūtamasme ā tveyaṃ dhīravasa indra yamyāḥ
analyzed: pra ime havāsaḥ puruhūtam asme ā tvā iyam dhīravasaḥ indra yamyāḥ
translated: The prayers have come to us, O Indra, who is invoked by many, this wise one, O Indra, who is to be worshipped by the two twins

original: taṃ vaḥ sakhāyaḥ saṃ yathā suteṣu somebhirīṃ pṛṇatā bhojamindram
analyzed: tam vaḥ sakhāyaḥ sam yathā suteṣu somebhiḥ īm pṛṇata bhojam indram
translated: Just as your friends are satisfied with the Soma juices, so fill him, O friends, the bountiful one, with the Soma juices

original: kuvit tasmā asati no bharāya na suṣvimindro 'vase mṛdhāti
analyzed: kuvid tasmai asati naḥ bharāya na suṣvimindraḥ vase mṛdhāti
translated: Will he not bear us for our support, will not Indra, the good swallower, protect us with his help?

original: evedindraḥ sute astāvi some bharadvājeṣu kṣayadin maghonaḥ
analyzed: eva id indraḥ sute astāvi some bharadvājeṣu kṣaya dit maghonaḥ
translated: Even so, Indra, when the Soma is pressed, sing praises to him among the Bharadvaja clan, the lord of treasures

original: asad yathā jaritra uta sūririndro rāyo viśvavārasya dātā
analyzed: asat yathā jaritre uta sūriḥ indraḥ rāyaḥ viśva vārasya dātā
translated: So that he may be like a sun to the worshipper, Indra, the giver of wealth with all its blessings

original: vṛṣā mada indre śloka ukthā sacā someṣu sutapā ṛjīṣī🔽arcatryo maghavā nṛbhya ukthairdyukṣo rājā girāmakṣitotiḥ
analyzed: vṛṣā made indre śloke ukthā sacā someṣu suta pāḥ ṛjīṣī  arcatryaḥ maghavā nṛbhyaḥ ukthaiḥ dyukṣaḥ rājā girām akṣita ūtiḥ
translated: The bull, the rapture, is with Indra, the hymn and the songs are together with him, the impetuous one, when the pure Soma is pressed🔽The worshipper, the bountiful one, is to be praised by men with hymns, the king of the sky, the protector, the one to be invoked

original: taturirvīro naryo vicetāḥ śrotā havaṃ gṛṇata urvyūtiḥ
analyzed: taturiḥ vīraḥ naryaḥ vicetāḥ śrotā havam gṛṇate urvyūtiḥ
translated: The swift hero, the man who discerns, the hearer of the call, the one with wide protection

original: vasuḥ śaṃso narāṃ kārudhāyā vājī stuto vidathe dāti vājam
analyzed: vasuḥ śaṃsaḥ narām kāru dhāyāḥ vājī stutaḥ vidathe dāti vājam
translated: The good singer, the one who brings about the deeds of men, the strong one praised in the assembly, grants strength

original: akṣo na cakryoḥ śūra bṛhan pra te mahnā ririce rodasyoḥ
analyzed: akṣaḥ na cakryoḥ śūra bṛhan pra te mahnā ririce rodasyoḥ
translated: O hero, the axle is great between the wheels, by your greatness it surpasses the two worlds

original: vṛkṣasya nu te puruhūta vayā vyūtayo ruruhurindra pūrvīḥ
analyzed: vṛkṣasya nu te puruhūta vayāḥ vyūtayaḥ ruruhuḥ indra pūrvīḥ
translated: O much-invoked one, many branches of the tree have grown for you, O Indra, in the past

original: śacīvataste puruśāka śākā gavāmiva srutayaḥ saṃcaraṇīḥ
analyzed: śacīvataḥ te puru śāka śākāḥ gavām iva srutayaḥ saṃcaraṇīḥ
translated: The branches of you who are powerful are like the streams of cows, the paths of wandering

original: vatsānāṃ na tantayasta indra dāmanvanto adāmānaḥ sudāman
analyzed: vatsānām na tantayaḥ te indra dāmanvantaḥ a dāmānaḥ su dāman
translated: O Indra, the ropes of the calves are for you, the bountiful one, the untied ones are for the one who is well to be untied

original: anyadadya karvaramanyadu śvo 'sacca san muhurācakririndraḥ
analyzed: anyat adya karvaram anyat u śvas sat ca sat muhur ācakriḥ indraḥ
translated: Indra has repeatedly done one thing today, another tomorrow, the existent and the non-existent

original: mitro no atra varuṇaśca pūṣāryo vaśasya paryetāsti
analyzed: mitraḥ naḥ atra varuṇaḥ ca pūṣā aryaḥ vaśasya paryetā asti
translated: May Mitra, Varuna, and Pushan be our protectors here, may the noble one be surrounded by them

original: vi tvadāpo na parvatasya pṛṣṭhādukthebhirindrānayanta yajñaiḥ
analyzed: vi tvat āpaḥ na parvatasya pṛṣṭhāt ukthebhiḥ indra anayanta yajñaiḥ
translated: The waters have brought Indra down from the back of the mountain, with hymns and sacrifices, O you who are to be praised.

original: taṃ tvābhiḥ suṣṭutibhirvājayanta ājiṃ na jagmurgirvāho aśvāḥ
analyzed: tam tvā ābhiḥ suṣṭutibhiḥ vājayantaḥ ājim na jagmuḥ gir vāhaḥ aśvāḥ
translated: They delight in you with these excellent praises, the singers have gone to you as to a racecourse.

original: na yaṃ jaranti śarado na māsā na dyāva indramavakarśayanti
analyzed: na yam jaranti śaradaḥ na māsāḥ na dyāvaḥ indram avakarśayanti
translated: Whom neither the autumns nor the months, nor the heavens, O Indra, cause to grow old.

original: vṛddhasya cid vardhatāmasya tanū stomebhirukthaiścaśasyamānā
analyzed: vṛddhasya cit vardhatām asya tanū stomebhiḥ ukthaiḥ caśasyamānā
translated: Even of the aged one, may his body grow by his praises and hymns, being extolled.

original: na vīḷave namate na sthirāya na śardhate dasyujūtāya stavān🔽ajrā indrasya girayaścid ṛṣvā gambhīre cid bhavatigādhamasmai
analyzed: na vīḍave namate na sthirāya na śardhate dasyu jūtāya stavān  ajrāḥ indrasya girayaḥ cit ṛṣvāḥ gambhīre cit bhavati gādham asmai
translated: I do not bow to the strong one, nor to the firm one, nor to the daring one who is sent by the Dasyus, when I praise (you).🔽Even the lofty mountains of Indra are not lofty enough for him, even the deep one has a ford for him.

original: gambhīreṇa na uruṇāmatrin preṣo yandhi sutapāvan vājān
analyzed: gambhīreṇa naḥ uruṇā amatrin pra iṣaḥ yandhi suta pāvan vājān
translated: With your deep and wide path, O you who have good steeds, send us food, O you who are to be praised.

original: sthā ū ṣu ūrdhva ūtī ariṣaṇyannaktorvyuṣṭau paritakmyāyām
analyzed: sthā u su ūrdhve ūtī a riṣaṇyat nakta urvyuṣṭau paritakmyāyām
translated: Stand up, O you who are to be praised, not to be despised, at the dawn of the night, at the end of the darkness.

original: sacasva nāyamavase abhīka ito vā tamindra pāhi riṣaḥ
analyzed: sacasva na ayam avase abhīke itas vā tam indra pāhi riṣaḥ
translated: Be with us, O fearless one, for help, or from here, O Indra, protect him from injury.

original: amā cainamaraṇye pāhi riṣo madema śatahimāḥ suvīrāḥ
analyzed: amā ca enam araṇye pāhi riṣaḥ madema śata himāḥ su vīrāḥ
translated: And protect him in the wilderness from injury. May we rejoice for a hundred winters with brave sons.

original: yā ta ūtiravamā yā paramā yā madhyamendra śuṣminnasti
analyzed: yā te ūtiḥ avamā yā paramā yā madhyamā indra śuṣmin asti
translated: Whatever help is yours, lowest, highest, or in the middle, O Indra, in your strength,

original: tābhirū ṣu vṛtrahatye 'vīrna ebhiśca vājairmahānna ugra
analyzed: tābhiḥ u su vṛtra hatye vīḥ naḥ ebhiḥ ca vājaiḥ mahān naḥ ugra
translated: With those, O you who kill Vrtra, with these foods, O you who are great and strong, send us food.

original: ābhi spṛdho mithatīrariṣaṇyannamitrasya vyathayā manyumindra
analyzed: ābhiḥ spṛdhaḥ mithatīḥ ariṣaṇyan amitrasya vyathaya manyum indra
translated: With these, O Indra, unassailable, crush the hostile bands of those who fight against us, and with the pain of the foe crush down his wrath.

original: ābhirviśvā abhiyujo viṣūcīrāryāya viśo 'va tārīrdāsīḥ🔽indra jāmaya uta ye 'jāmayo 'rvācīnāso vanuṣo yuyujre
analyzed: ābhiḥ viśvāḥ abhiyujaḥ viṣūcīḥ āryāya viśaḥ vaḥ tārīḥ dāsīḥ  indra jāmayaḥ uta ye jāmayaḥ rvācīnāsaḥ vanuṣaḥ yuyujre
translated: With these drive far away from the Ârya all the hostile tribes of men, and make the Dâsa subject to the lord.🔽Those who are kinsmen of thine, O Indra, and those who are not, who have yoked their teams and come hitherward,

original: tvameṣāṃ vithurā śavāṃsi jahi vṛṣṇyāni kṛṇuhī parācaḥ
analyzed: tvam eṣām vithurā śavāṃsi jahi vṛṣṇyāni kṛṇuhi parācaḥ
translated: Crush thou their feeble powers, O thou of mighty strength, and make their manly powers turn back.

original: śūro vā śūraṃ vanate śarīraistanūrucā taruṣi yat kṛṇvaite
analyzed: śūraḥ vā śūram vanate śarīraiḥ tanūrucā taruṣi yat kṛṇvaite
translated: The hero conquers the hero by his body, when he strives to do what thou requirest.

original: toke vā goṣu tanaye yadapsu vi krandasī urvarāsu bravaite
analyzed: toke vā goṣu tanaye yat apsu vi krandasī urvarāsu bravaite
translated: When thou art angry in the youngling, in the cow, in the waters, in the fields, in the people.

original: nahi tvā śūro na turo na dhṛṣṇurna tvā yodho manyamāno yuyodha
analyzed: nahi tvā śūraḥ na turaḥ na dhṛṣṇuḥ na tvā yodhaḥ manyamānaḥ yuyodha
translated: No hero, no swift one, no daring one, no warrior, thinking of thee, will fight with thee.

original: indra nakiṣ ṭvā pratyastyeṣāṃ viśvā jātānyabhyasi tāni🔽sa patyata ubhayornṛmṇamayoryadī vedhasaḥ samithe havante
analyzed: indra nakir tvā viśvā jātāni abhi asi tāni  sa patyate ubhayoḥ nṛmṇamayoḥ yadī vedhasaḥ samithe havante
translated: No one, O Indra, is equal to thee in these things: all creatures are subject to thee.🔽He is the lord of both, he who is full of manly strength, if the wise ones call him to the contest.

original: vṛtre vā maho nṛvati kṣaye vā vyacasvantā yadi vitantasaite🔽adha smā te carṣaṇayo yadejānindra trātota bhavā varūtā
analyzed: vṛtre vā mahaḥ nṛvati kṣaye vā vyacasvantā yadi vitantasaite  adha smā te carṣaṇayaḥ yadā ījān indra trātā uta bhava varūtā
translated: If these two, wide and far-extended, are in the great battle with Vritra, or in the fight of men.🔽Then, O Indra, be thou a protector and a guardian to the people when they go forth.

original: asmākāso ye nṛtamāso arya indra sūrayo dadhire puronaḥ
analyzed: asmākāsaḥ ye nṛtamāsaḥ aryaḥ indra sūrayaḥ dadhire purā ūnaḥ
translated: Those who are most righteous among the Ârya, the priests who have made me their Hotar, O Indra.

original: anu te dāyi maha indriyāya satrā te viṣvamanu vṛtrahatye
analyzed: anu te dāyi mahe indriyāya satrā te viṣvam anu vṛtra hatye
translated: To thee is given the great power, O Indra, at all times to thee for slaying Vr̥itra.

original: anu kṣatramanu saho yajatrendra devebhiranu te nṛṣahye🔽evā na spṛdhaḥ samajā samatsvindra rārandhi mithatīradevīḥ🔽vidyāma vastoravasā gṛṇanto bharadvājā uta ta indra nūnam
analyzed: anu kṣatram anu sahaḥ yajatra indra devebhiḥ anu te nṛṣahye  eva naḥ spṛdhaḥ samaja samatsu indra rārandhi mithatīra devīḥ  vidyāma vastoḥ avasā gṛṇantaḥ bharadvājāḥ uta te indra nūnam
translated: After the lordship, after strength, O holy Indra, after thy power over men, with the Gods.🔽So, Indra, in the battles of the people, be gracious to us in the strife of the wicked.🔽May we, the Bharadvâgas, praising, find that treasure through thy favour, O Indra.

original: śrudhī na indra hvayāmasi tvā maho vājasya sātau vāvṛṣāṇāḥ🔽saṃ yad viśo 'yanta śūrasātā ugraṃ no 'vaḥ pārye ahan dāḥ
analyzed: śrudhi naḥ indra hvayāmasi tvā mahaḥ vājasya sātau vāvṛṣāṇāḥ  sam yat viśaḥ yanta śūra sātau ugram naḥ vaḥ pārye ahan dāḥ
translated: Hear us, O Indra, we invoke thee to the great winning of the spoil, O Thunderer,🔽When the clans have come together, O Hero, give us thy strong protection for the combat.

original: tvāṃ vājī havate vājineyo maho vājasya gadhyasya sātau🔽tvāṃ vṛtreṣvindra satpatiṃ tarutraṃ tvāṃ caṣṭe muṣṭihā goṣu yudhyan
analyzed: tvām vājī havate vājineyaḥ mahaḥ vājasya gadhyasya sātau  tvām vṛtreṣu indra sat patim tarutram tvām caṣṭe muṣṭi hā goṣu yudhyan
translated: The vigorous steed who is to be honoured invokes thee in the winning of great spoil.🔽Thee, O Indra, the lord of battles, the hero, him who wields the dart regardeth in the fray.

original: tvaṃ kaviṃ codayo 'rkasātau tvaṃ kutsāya śuṣṇaṃ dāśuṣe vark
analyzed: tvam kavim codayaḥ rka sātau tvam kutsāya śuṣṇam dāśuṣe vark
translated: Thou hast excited the sage to win the light, thou hast given Kutsa to the worshipper for strength.

original: tvaṃ śiro amarmaṇaḥ parāhannatithigvāya śaṃsyaṃ kariṣyan
analyzed: tvam śiraḥ amarmaṇaḥ parāhan atithigvāya śaṃsyam kariṣyan
translated: Thou hast struck off the head of the unwounded one, to win renown for Atithigva.

original: tvaṃ rathaṃ pra bharo yodham ṛṣvamāvo yudhyantaṃ vṛṣabhaṃ daśadyum
analyzed: tvam ratham pra bharaḥ yodham ṛṣvam āvaḥ yudhyantam vṛṣabham daśadyum
translated: Thou hast set the lofty car in motion, the warrior, the bull who fights, to win the prize.

original: tvaṃ tugraṃ vetasave sacāhan tvaṃ tujiṃ gṛṇantamindra tūtoḥ
analyzed: tvam tugram vetasave sacā ahan tvam tujim gṛṇantam indra tūtoḥ
translated: Thou aidest Tugra when he dwells by the Vetas, thou aidest Tuji when he sings to thee, O Indra.

original: tvaṃ tadukthamindra barhaṇā kaḥ pra yacchatā sahasrāśūra darṣi🔽ava girerdāsaṃ śambaraṃ han prāvo divodāsaṃ citrābhirūtī
analyzed: tvam tat uktham indra barhaṇā kaḥ pra yat śatā sahasrāśūra darṣi  ava gireḥ dāsam śambaram han prāvaḥ divodāsam citra abhirūtī
translated: Thou, O Indra, hast magnified that hymn of praise, O hero, when thou gavest a thousand to the worshipper.🔽Thou slewest the Dâsa of the mountain, Sambara, thou gavest Divodâsa to the wondrous helpers.

original: tvaṃ śraddhābhirmandasānaḥ somairdabhītaye cumurimindrasiṣvap
analyzed: tvam śraddhābhiḥ mandasānaḥ somaiḥ dabhītaye cumurim indra siṣvap
translated: Thou, gladdened by the libations, with the Soma, hast crushed for Dabhit the pot, O Indra.

original: tvaṃ rajiṃ piṭhīnase daśasyan ṣaṣṭiṃ sahasrāśacyā sacāhan
analyzed: tvam rajim piṭhīnase daśasyan ṣaṣṭim sahasrāśacyā sacā ahan
translated: Thou, bestowing on Pitîna the son of Ridashva, hast aided Raji with thy might, O Indra.

original: ahaṃ cana tat sūribhirānaśyāṃ tava jyāya indra sumnamojaḥ
analyzed: aham cana tat sūribhiḥ ānaśyām tava jyāyaḥ indra sumnam ojaḥ
translated: I would not even with the princes share that bliss, O Indra, which is thine, thy power and joy.

original: tvayā yat stavante sadhavīra vīrāstrivarūthena nahuṣā śaviṣṭha
analyzed: tvayā yat stavante sadhavīra vīrāḥ tri varūthena nahuṣā śaviṣṭha
translated: With the Trivrit, O thou of manly deeds, the men whom thou protectest, O most mighty, sing to thee.

original: vayaṃ te asyāmindra dyumnahūtau sakhāyaḥ syāma mahina preṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: vayam te asyām indra dyumna hūtau sakhāyaḥ syāma mahina preṣṭhāḥ
translated: May we, O Indra, be thy friends in this call to glory, most dear, most mighty.

original: prātardaniḥ kṣatraśrīrastu śreṣṭho ghane vṛtrāṇāṃ sanaye dhanānām
analyzed: prātardaniḥ kṣatra śrīḥ astu śreṣṭhaḥ ghane vṛtrāṇām sanaye dhanānām
translated: May he who gives in the morning be best, the lord of the people, to smite down the Dâsas, to win the treasures.

original: kimasya made kiṃ vasya pītāvindraḥ kimasya sakhye cakāra
analyzed: kim asya made kim vasya pītau indraḥ kim asya sakhye cakāra
translated: What hath he done in this his rapture, in this his drinking of the juice? What hath Indra done in this his friendship?

original: raṇā vā ye niṣadi kiṃ te asya pura vividre kimu nūtanāsaḥ
analyzed: raṇā vā ye niṣadi kim te asya pura vividre kimu nūtanāsaḥ
translated: What have they done in the fight, in the seat of battle? What have they gained in his city, the new and the old?

original: sadasya made sad vasya pitavindraḥ sadasya sakhye cakāra
analyzed: sadasya made sat pitavindraḥ sadasya sakhye cakāra
translated: In the joy of the assembly, in the assembly, O Pitri, Indra made friends

original: raṇā vā ye niṣadi sat te asya pura vividre sadu nūtanāsaḥ
analyzed: raṇā vā ye niṣadi sat te asya pura vividre sadu nūtanāsaḥ
translated: Those who sit in the battle, they have penetrated his city, the new ones well

original: nahi nu te mahimanaḥ samasya na maghavan maghavattvasya vidma
analyzed: nahi nu te mahimanaḥ samasya na maghavan maghavat tvasya vidma
translated: For we know not the greatness of thy greatness, O Maghavan, nor the extent of thy wealth

original: na rādhasorādhaso nūtanasyendra nakirdadṛśa indriyaṃ te
analyzed: na rādhasaḥ rādhasaḥ nūtanasya indra nakir dadṛśe indriyam te
translated: Nor of thy new bounty, O Indra, nor thy power, O Indra, do we behold

original: etat tyat ta indriyamaceti yenāvadhīrvaraśikhasya śeṣaḥ
analyzed: etat tyad te indriyam aceti yena avadhīḥ varaśikhasya śeṣaḥ
translated: This is that power of thine, O Indra, by which thou didst slay Varasikha's remnant

original: vajrasya yat te nihatasya śuṣmāt svanāccidindra paramodadāra
analyzed: vajrasya yat te nihatasya śuṣmāt svanāt cit indra paramā udadāra
translated: From the force of thy slain thunderbolt, and from its sound, O Indra, thou didst tear out the highest

original: vadhīdindro varaśikhasya śeṣo 'bhyāvartine cāyamānāya śikṣan
analyzed: vadhīt indraḥ varaśikhasya śeṣaḥ bhyāvartine cāyamānāya śikṣan
translated: Indra slew Varasikha's remnant, instructing him who was returning and coming back

original: vṛcīvato yad dhariyūpīyāyāṃ han pūrve ardhe bhiyasāparo dart
analyzed: vṛcīvataḥ yat hariyūpīyāyām han pūrve ardhe bhiyasā aparaḥ dart
translated: When in the land of the Vrīchis and the Harīyūpas, he struck the first with fear and the latter with terror

original: triṃśacchataṃ varmiṇa indra sākaṃ yavyāvatyāṃ puruhūta śravasyā
analyzed: triṃśat śatam varmiṇaḥ indra sākam yavyāvatyām puruhūta śravasyā
translated: Thirty hundred armored ones, O Indra, together, O much-invoked one, in Yavyāvatī for fame

original: vṛcīvantaḥ śarave patyamānāḥ pātrā bhindānanyarthānyāyan
analyzed: vṛcīvantaḥ śarave patyamānāḥ pātrā bhindān anyarthāni āyan
translated: The Vrīchis, seeking glory, breaking vessels for other purposes, went away

original: yasya gāvāvaruṣā sūyavasyū antarū ṣu carato rerihāṇā
analyzed: yasya gāvāvaruṣā sūyavasyū antaru su carataḥ rerihāṇā
translated: Whose two cows, with good grass, moving about in the middle, lowing,

original: sa sṛñjayāya turvaśaṃ parādād vṛcīvato daivavātāyaśikṣan
analyzed: sa sṛñjayāya turvaśam parādāt vṛcīvataḥ daivavātāya śikṣan
translated: He gave Turvaṣa to the Sṛñjaya, to Vṛcivat, to Daivavāta, teaching them.

original: dvayānagne rathino viṃśatiṃ gā vadhūmato maghavā mahyaṃ samrāṭ
analyzed: dvayān agne rathinaḥ viṃśatim gāḥ vadhūmataḥ maghavā mahyam samrāj
translated: Maghavan, the emperor, gave me two chariots, twenty cows from Vadhūmata, Agni.

original: abhyāvartī cāyamāno dadāti dūṇāśeyaṃ dakṣiṇā pārthavānām
analyzed: abhyāvartī cāyamānaḥ dadāti dūṇāśeyam dakṣiṇā pārthavānām
translated: He gives, returning again and again, the Dakṣiṇā of the Pārthavas is full of hope.

original: ā gāvo agmannuta bhadramakran sīdantu goṣṭhe raṇayantvasme
analyzed: ā gāvaḥ agman uta bhadram akran sīdantu goṣṭhe raṇayantu asme
translated: The cows have come and have done well. May they sit in the cowshed and delight us.

original: prajāvatīḥ pururūpā iha syurindrāya pūrvīruṣaso duhānāḥ
analyzed: prajāvatīḥ puru rūpāḥ iha syuḥ indrāya pūrvīḥ uṣasaḥ duhānāḥ
translated: May they be here, rich in offspring, of many forms, yielding abundant milk at dawn for Indra.

original: indro yajvane pṛṇate ca śikṣatyuped dadāti na svaṃ muṣāyati
analyzed: indraḥ yajvane pṛṇate ca śikṣati upa id dadāti na svam muṣāyati
translated: Indra favors the sacrificer and the giver, he comes and gives, he does not steal his own.

original: bhūyobhūyo rayimidasya vardhayannabhinne khilye nidadhāti devayum
analyzed: bhūyas bhūyas rayim idasya vardhayan abhinne khilye nidadhāti devayum
translated: Increasing his wealth again and again, he places the god-adoring one in an unbroken trough.

original: na tā naśanti na dabhāti taskaro nāsāmāmitro vyathirādadharṣati
analyzed: na tāḥ naśanti na dabhāti taskaraḥ na āsām āmitraḥ vyathirāt adharṣati
translated: They are not lost, a thief does not injure them, an enemy does not inflict misfortune on them.

original: devāṃśca yābhiryajate dadāti ca jyogit tābhiḥ sacate gopatiḥ saha
analyzed: devān ca yābhiḥ yajate dadāti ca jyogit tābhiḥ sacate gopatiḥ saha
translated: With those by which he worships the gods and gives, the cowherd dwells together with them for a long time.

original: na tā arvā reṇukakāṭo aśnute na saṃskṛtatramupa yanti tā abhi
analyzed: na tāḥ arvā reṇu kakāṭaḥ aśnute na saṃskṛtatram upa yanti tāḥ abhi
translated: The dust-heap does not reach those, they do not approach the one who is prepared.

original: urugāyamabhayaṃ tasya tā anu gāvo martasya vicaranti yajvanaḥ
analyzed: uru gāyam abhayam tasya tāḥ anu gāvaḥ martasya vicaranti yajvanaḥ
translated: The cows of that sacrificer, who has wide pasture and is safe, wander freely.

original: gāvo bhago gāva indro me achān gāvaḥ somasya prathamasya bhakṣaḥ
analyzed: gāvaḥ bhagaḥ gāvaḥ indraḥ me achān gāvaḥ somasya prathamasya bhakṣaḥ
translated: The cows are Bhaga, the cows are Indra's helpers to me, the cows are the first portion of Soma's food

original: imā yā gāvaḥ sa janāsa indra ichāmīd dhṛdāmanasā cidindram🔽yūyaṃ gāvo medayathā kṛśaṃ cidaśrīraṃ cit kṛṇuthā supratīkam
analyzed: imāḥ yāḥ gāvaḥ sa janāsaḥ indraḥ ichāmi id hṛdā amanasā cit indram  yūyam gāvaḥ medayatha kṛśam cit aśrīram cit kṛṇutha su pratīkam
translated: These cows are the people, Indra; I desire Indra even with my heart and mind🔽You cows make even the lean one fat, even the ugly one beautiful

original: bhadraṃ gṛhaṃ kṛṇutha bhadravāco bṛhad vo vaya ucyate sabhāsu
analyzed: bhadram gṛham kṛṇutha bhadra vācaḥ bṛhat vaḥ vayaḥ ucyate sabhāsu
translated: You who speak auspicious words, make a good home; your great strength is proclaimed in the assemblies

original: prajāvatīḥ sūyavasaṃ riśantīḥ śuddhā apaḥ suprapāṇepibantīḥ
analyzed: prajāvatīḥ sūyavasam riśantīḥ śuddhāḥ apaḥ su prapāṇe pibantīḥ
translated: Rich in offspring, seeking good pasture, drinking pure water at a good drinking place

original: mā va stena īśata māghaśaṃsaḥ pari vo hetī rudrasya vṛjyāḥ
analyzed: mā vaḥ stenaḥ īśata mā agha śaṃsaḥ pari vaḥ hetiḥ rudrasya vṛjyāḥ
translated: Let no thief rule over you, let no slanderer; may you be free from the dart of Rudra

original: upedamupaparcanamāsu goṣūpa pṛcyatām
analyzed: upa idam upaparcanam āsu goṣu upa pṛcyatām
translated: Here let it be joined to these cows that are coming near

original: upa ṛṣabhasya retasyupendra tava vīrye
analyzed: upa ṛṣabhasya retasi upa indra tava vīrye
translated: To the seed of the bull, to the strength of Indra

original: indraṃ vo naraḥ sakhyāya sepurmaho yantaḥ sumataye cakānāḥ
analyzed: indram vaḥ naraḥ sakhyāya sepuḥ mahaḥ yantaḥ sumataye cakānāḥ
translated: Men have followed Indra for friendship, shining for his good will, seeking the great one

original: maho hi dātā vajrahasto asti mahāmu raṇvamavase yajadhvam
analyzed: mahaḥ hi dātā vajra hastaḥ asti raṇvam avase yajadhvam
translated: For he is the great giver, the wielder of the thunderbolt; worship the great one for help

original: ā yasmin haste naryā mimikṣurā rathe hiraṇyaye ratheṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: ā yasmin haste naryāḥ mimikṣurāḥ rathe hiraṇyaye ratheṣṭhāḥ
translated: In whose hand the men have mingled, the charioteers on the golden chariot

original: ā raśmayo gabhastyo sthūrayorādhvannaśvāso vṛṣaṇo yujānāḥ
analyzed: ā raśmayaḥ gabhastyoḥ sthūrayoḥ ādhvannaśvāsaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ yujānāḥ
translated: The reins, the poles, the yoke, the swift horses, the strong ones are yoked

original: śriye te pādā duva ā mimikṣurdhṛṣṇurvajrī śavasā dakṣiṇāvān
analyzed: śriye te pādā duvaḥ ā mimikṣuḥ dhṛṣṇuḥ vajrī śavasā dakṣiṇāvān
translated: For thy glory, O Indra, they have anointed thy feet, the daring one, the wielder of the thunderbolt, with strength and gifts.

original: vasāno atkaṃ surabhiṃ dṛśe kaṃ svarṇa nṛtaviṣiro babhūtha
analyzed: vasānaḥ atkam surabhim dṛśe kam svarṇa nṛtaviṣiraḥ babhūtha
translated: Thou hast put on the beautiful garment for the eye, O golden one, thou hast become the one with beautiful limbs.

original: sa soma āmiślatamaḥ suto bhūd yasmin paktiḥ pacyate santidhānāḥ
analyzed: sa somaḥ āmiślatamaḥ sutaḥ bhūt yasmin paktiḥ pacyate santidhānāḥ
translated: That Soma has become the most desirable when pressed, in which the well-prepared oblations are cooked.

original: indraṃ nara stuvanto brahmakārā ukthā śaṃsanto devavātatamāḥ
analyzed: indram naraḥ stuvantaḥ brahma kārāḥ ukthā śaṃsantaḥ deva vātatamāḥ
translated: The men who make the prayers, praising Indra, singing the hymns, most devoted to the gods,

original: na te antaḥ śavaso dhāyyasya vi tu bābadhe rodasī mahitvā
analyzed: na te antaḥ śavasaḥ dhāyyasya vi tu bābadhe rodasī mahitvā
translated: The end of thy power that is to be supported, O Indra, is not to be seen. Thou hast spread out the two worlds with thy greatness.

original: ā tā sūriḥ pṛṇati tūtujāno yūthevāpsu samījamāna ūtī
analyzed: ā tā sūriḥ pṛṇati tūtujānaḥ yūthā iva apsu samījamānaḥ ūtī
translated: The lord, eager, fills them, as one eager in the herd, with help in the waters.

original: evedindraḥ suhava ṛṣvo astūtī anūtī hiriśipraḥ satvā🔽evā hi jāto asamātyojāḥ purū ca vṛtrā hanati ni dasyūn
analyzed: eva id indraḥ su havaḥ ṛṣvaḥ astūtī anūtī hiri śipraḥ satvā  eva hi jātaḥ asamātyojāḥ purū ca vṛtrā hanati ni dasyūn
translated: Thus may Indra, lofty, easily invoked, with helpers and without helpers, the tawny-backed one, the strong one,🔽Thus, indeed, the one born with unequalled strength, slays many Vr̥itras and Dasyus.

original: bhūya id vāvṛdhe vīryāyaneko ajuryo dayate vasūni
analyzed: bhūyas id vāvṛdhe vīryāyanā ikaḥ ajuryaḥ dayate vasūni
translated: He has grown greater still for the sake of strength. The one who does not grow old bestows treasures.

original: pra ririce diva indraḥ pṛthivyā ardhamidasya prati rodasī ubhe
analyzed: pra ririce divaḥ indraḥ pṛthivyāḥ ardhamidasya prati rodasī ubhe
translated: Indra has spread out in the sky and on earth. This half of his is the two worlds, heaven and earth.

original: adhā manye bṛhadasuryamasya yāni dādhāra nakirā mināti
analyzed: adhā manye bṛhat asuḥ yamasya yāni dādhāra nakirā mināti
translated: Then I think of his great lordship, which he upholds and does not transgress.

original: divedive sūryo darśato bhūd vi sadmānyurviyā sukraturdhāt
analyzed: dive dive sūryaḥ darśataḥ bhūt vi sadmāni urviyā su kratuḥ dhāt
translated: Day by day the sun has become visible. The wise one has spread out the abodes with his power.

original: adyā cin nū cit tadapo nadīnāṃ yadābhyo arado gātumindra
analyzed: adyā cit nu cit tat apaḥ nadīnām yat ābhyaḥ aradaḥ gātum indra
translated: Even now, or rather long ago, was it, O Indra, when thou gavest passage to the rivers

original: ni parvatā admasado na sedustvayā dṛḷhāni sukrato rajāṃsi
analyzed: ni parvatāḥ adma sadaḥ na seduḥ tvayā dṛḍhāni su krato rajāṃsi
translated: The mountains sat as guests upon the banquet: thou, O most wise one, hast loosened the firm regions.

original: satyamit tan na tvāvānanyo astīndra devo na martyo jyāyān
analyzed: satyam id tat na tvāvān anyaḥ asti indra devaḥ na martyaḥ jyāyān
translated: This is thy truth: there is none other like thee, O Indra, no God, no mortal is greater.

original: ahannahiṃ pariśayānamarṇo 'vāsṛjo apo achā samudram
analyzed: ahan ahim pariśayānam arṇaḥ vā asṛjaḥ apaḥ achā samudram
translated: Thou slewest Ahi, the overflowing dragon: thou lettest loose the waters to the ocean.

original: tvamapo vi duro viṣūcīrindra dṛḷhamarujaḥ parvatasya
analyzed: tvam apaḥ vi duraḥ viṣūcīḥ indra dṛḍham arujaḥ parvatasya
translated: Thou, O Indra, hast opened the firm-closed doors of the waters, and cleft the mountain asunder.

original: rājābhavo jagataścarṣaṇīnāṃ sākaṃ sūryaṃ janayan dyāmuṣāsam
analyzed: rājā abhavaḥ jagataḥ carṣaṇīnām sākam sūryam janayan dyām uṣāsam
translated: Thou hast become the King of the people of the world, begetting the heaven and the dawn with the sun.

original: abhūreko rayipate rayīṇāmā hastayoradhithā indra kṛṣṭīḥ
analyzed: abhūḥ ekaḥ rayi pate rayīṇām ā hastayoḥ adhithāḥ indra kṛṣṭīḥ
translated: Thou art become the one Lord of riches, O Lord of wealth: in both thy hands, O Indra, are the people.

original: vi toke apsu tanaye ca sūre 'vocanta carṣaṇayo vivācaḥ
analyzed: vi toke apsu tanaye ca sūre vocanta carṣaṇayaḥ vivācaḥ
translated: In the son, in the waters, in the light of the sun, the men have uttered their various voices.

original: tvad bhiyendra pārthivāni viśvācyutā ciccyāvayante rajāṃsi
analyzed: tvat bhiyā indra pārthivāni viśvā acyutā cit cyāvayante rajāṃsi
translated: Through thy fear, O Indra, all earthly things, even the moving, move, and the still regions move.

original: dyāvākṣāmā parvatāso vanāni viśvaṃ dṛḷhaṃ bhayate ajmannā te
analyzed: dyāvākṣāmā parvatāsaḥ vanāni viśvam dṛḍham bhayate ajman na ā te
translated: The heavens and the earth, the mountains, the woods, all that is firm tremble at thy approach.

original: tvaṃ kutsenābhi śuṣṇamindrāśuṣaṃ yudhya kuyavaṃ gaviṣṭau
analyzed: tvam kutsena abhi śuṣṇam indra aśuṣam yudhya kuyavam gaviṣṭau
translated: With Kutsa thou, O Indra, hast fought with Sushna, the wicked, in the contest for the cow.

original: daśa prapitve adha sūryasya muṣāyaścakramaviverapāṃsi
analyzed: daśa prapitve adha sūryasya
translated: At the tenth libation of the sun thou hast taken away the wheel and the weapons of Musay.

original: tvaṃ śatānyava śambarasya puro jaghanthāpratīni sasyoḥ
analyzed: tvam śatāni ava śambarasya puraḥ jaghantha apratīni sasyoḥ
translated: Thou slewest a hundred forts of Sambara, unconquerable forts,

original: aśikṣo yatra śacyā śacīvo divodāsāya sunvate sutakre bharadvājāya gṛṇate vasūni
analyzed: aśikṣaḥ yatra śacyā śacīvas divodāsāya sunvate sutakre bharadvājāya gṛṇate vasūni
translated: Where, O mighty one, thou didst learn thy mighty powers, for Divodasa, the presser of Soma, the giver of good gifts, for Bharadvaja, the singer of praises,

original: sa satyasatvan mahate raṇāya rathamā tiṣṭha tuvinṛmṇa bhīmam🔽yāhi prapathinnavasopa madrik pra ca śruta śrāvaya carṣaṇibhyaḥ🔽apūrvyā purutamānyasmai mahe vīrāya tavase turāya
analyzed: sa satya satvan mahate raṇāya rathamā tiṣṭha tuvi nṛmṇa bhīmam  yāhi prapathin navasā upa madrik pra ca śruta śrāvaya carṣaṇibhyaḥ  apūrvyā purutamā anyasmai mahe vīrāya tavase turāya
translated: Do thou, O thou of true strength, for the great conflict, mount thy car, O invincible one, O terrible one,🔽Go, O bountiful one, as a friend to the path; proclaim (thyself) to the people, O thou who art famed for fame.🔽To him, the great hero, the strong one, the swift one, the most ancient (boon)

original: virapśine vajriṇe śantamāni vacāṃsyāsā sthavirāya takṣam
analyzed: virapśine vajriṇe śantamāni vacāṃsi āsā sthavirāya takṣam
translated: To the mighty one, to the wielder of the thunderbolt, fashion most propitious words, (words) that are strong, (words) that are ancient.

original: sa mātarā sūryeṇā kavīnāmavāsayad rujadadriṃ gṛṇānaḥ
analyzed: sa mātarā sūryeṇa kavīnām avāsayat rujat adrim gṛṇānaḥ
translated: He, the son of two mothers, with the Sûrya (hymn) of the sages, rejoicing, cleft the rock, singing (praises).

original: svādhībhirṛkvabhirvāvaśāna udusriyāṇāmasṛjan nidānam🔽sa vahnibhirṛkvabhirgoṣu śaśvan mitajñubhiḥ purukṛtvā jigāya🔽puraḥ purohā sakhibhiḥ sakhīyan dṛḷhā ruroja kavibhiḥ kaviḥ san
analyzed: su ādhībhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ vāvaśānaḥ udusriyāṇām asṛjat nidānam  sa vahnibhiḥ ṛkvabhiḥ goṣu śaśvat mitajñubhiḥ purukṛtvā jigāya  puraḥ purohā sakhibhiḥ sakhīyan dṛḷhā ruroja kavibhiḥ kaviḥ san
translated: With their own thoughts, with the Rkv verses, he, Vâvasvân, created the origin of the kine.🔽He, with the carrying (priests), with the Rkv verses, with the kine, ever, with the well-kneeling (priests), having done many deeds, has conquered.🔽The leader of the people, the friend of friends, the strong one, has broken down the strong (forts), being a sage with the sages.

original: sa nīvyābhirjaritāramachā maho vājebhirmahadbhiśca śuṣmaiḥ
analyzed: sa nīvyābhiḥ jaritāram achā mahaḥ vājebhiḥ mahadbhiḥ ca śuṣmaiḥ
translated: He, with the near ones, with the singers, with the great powers, with the great forces, has come to the worshipper.

original: puruvīrābhirvṛṣabha kṣitīnāmā girvaṇaḥ suvitāya pra yāhi
analyzed: puru vīrābhiḥ vṛṣabha kṣitīnāmā girvaṇaḥ suvitāya pra yāhi
translated: O bull, with many heroes, for the sake of prosperity, go to the assemblies, O lover of song

original: sa sargeṇa śavasā takto atyairapa indro dakṣiṇatasturāṣāṭ
analyzed: sa sargeṇa śavasā taktaḥ atyaiḥ apaḥ indraḥ dakṣiṇatas turāṣāh
translated: With the creation, impelled by strength, with the swift horses, Indra, the conqueror, from the right

original: itthā sṛjānā anapāvṛdarthaṃ divedive viviṣurapramṛṣyam
analyzed: itthā sṛjānāḥ anapāvṛt artham dive dive viviṣuḥ apramṛṣyam
translated: Thus, creating, unhindered, wealth, they have gone forth, day by day, to the irresistible

original: ya ojiṣṭha indra taṃ su no dā mado vṛṣan svabhiṣṭirdāsvān
analyzed: yaḥ ojiṣṭhaḥ indra tam su naḥ dāḥ madaḥ vṛṣan su abhiṣṭiḥ dāsvān
translated: O Indra, give us that most powerful drink, O bull, the most delightful, the most bountiful

original: sauvaśvyaṃ yo vanavat svaśvo vṛtrā samatsu sāsahadamitrān
analyzed: sauvaśvyam yaḥ vanavat su aśvaḥ vṛtrā samatsu sāsahat amitrān
translated: The possession of good horses, the one who has good horses, who conquers Vr̥itras and enemies in battles

original: tvāṃ hīndrāvase vivāco havante carṣaṇayaḥ śūrasātau
analyzed: tvām hi indra avase vivācaḥ havante carṣaṇayaḥ śūrasātau
translated: For the sake of help, O Indra, the people call on you in the battle for the sake of heroes

original: tvaṃ viprebhirvi paṇīnraśāyastvota it sanitā vājamarvā
analyzed: tvam viprebhiḥ vi paṇīn raśāyaḥ tvotaḥ id sanitā vājamarvā
translated: You, with the sages, have crushed the Paṇis; you, the one who is invoked, have brought the booty to us

original: tvaṃ tānindrobhayānamitrān dāsā vṛtrāṇyāryā ca śūra
analyzed: tvam tān indra ubhayān amitrān dāsā vṛtrāṇi āryā ca śūra
translated: You, O Indra, have slain those enemies on both sides, the Dāsa Vr̥itras and the Ārya, O hero

original: vadhīrvaneva sudhitebhiratkairā pṛtsu darṣi nṛṇāṃ nṛtama
analyzed: vadhīḥ vanā iva sudhitebhiḥ atkaiḥ ā pṛtsu darṣi nṛṇām nṛtama
translated: You have struck down in battles, like trees with well-sharpened weapons, the men, O best of men

original: sa tvaṃ na indrākavābhirūtī sakhā viśvāyuravitā vṛdhe bhūḥ
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ indra akava abhirūtī sakhā viśvāyuḥ avitā vṛdhe bhūḥ
translated: You, O Indra, with your helpful aids, be a friend for all life, a protector for prosperity

original: svarṣātā yad dhvayāmasi tvā yudhyanto nemadhitāpṛtsu śūra
analyzed: svarṣātā yat hvayāmasi tvā yudhyantaḥ nemadhitā pṛtsu śūra
translated: When we praise you, O self-dependent one, fighting, seeking booty in battles, O hero

original: nūnaṃ na indrāparāya ca syā bhavā mṛḷīka uta no abhiṣṭau
analyzed: nūnam naḥ indra aparāya ca syāḥ bhava mṛḍīke uta naḥ abhiṣṭau
translated: Now, O Indra, be good to us in the future, and be our protector and supporter

original: itthā gṛṇanto mahinasya śarman divi ṣyāma pārye goṣatamāḥ
analyzed: itthā gṛṇantaḥ mahinasya śarman divi syāma pārye goṣatamāḥ
translated: Thus singing, in the shelter of the mighty, may we dwell in heaven, best at gaining kine.

original: saṃ ca tve jagmurgira indra pūrvīrvi ca tvad yanti vibhvomanīṣāḥ
analyzed: sam ca tve jagmuḥ giraḥ indra pūrvīḥ vi ca tvat yanti vibhvaḥ manīṣāḥ
translated: To thee, O Indra, have the songs of many come, and the far-reaching thoughts of many come.

original: pūrā nūnaṃ ca stutaya ṛṣīṇāṃ paspṛdhra indre adhyukthārkā
analyzed: pūrā nūnam ca stutayaḥ ṛṣīṇām paspṛdhre indre adhi ukthā arkā
translated: The ancient praises of the R̥ishis, O Indra, have been brought together, and the hymns of praise.

original: puruhūto yaḥ purugūrta ṛbhvānekaḥ purupraśasto asti yajñaiḥ
analyzed: puruhūtaḥ yaḥ puru gūrtaḥ ṛbhvān ekaḥ puru praśastaḥ asti yajñaiḥ
translated: He who is much invoked, much lauded, mighty, alone is extolled with many a sacrifice.

original: ratho na mahe śavase yujāno 'smābhirindro anumādyo bhūt
analyzed: rathaḥ na mahe śavase yujānaḥ smābhiḥ indraḥ anumādyaḥ bhūt
translated: As one yokes a chariot for great strength, so must Indra be gladdened by us.

original: na yaṃ hiṃsanti dhītayo na vāṇīrindraṃ nakṣantīdabhi vardhayantīḥ
analyzed: na yam hiṃsanti dhītayaḥ na vāṇīḥ indram nakṣanti id abhi vardhayantīḥ
translated: Whom the hymns of praise and the songs do not injure, whom the praises, coming to him, exalt.

original: yadi stotāraḥ śataṃ yat sahasraṃ gṛṇanti girvaṇasaṃ śaṃ tadasmai
analyzed: yadi stotāraḥ śatam yat sahasram gṛṇanti girvaṇasam śam tat asmai
translated: If a hundred, if a thousand praisers sing to the lover of praise, that is well for him.

original: asmā etad divyarceva māsā mimikṣa indre nyayāmi somaḥ
analyzed: asmai etat divyā ṛcā iva māsā mimikṣe indre nyayāmi somaḥ
translated: This, like the months to the heavenly light, I mix for Indra: Soma is poured forth.

original: janaṃ na dhanvannabhi saṃ yadāpaḥ satrā vāvṛdhurhavanāni yajñaiḥ
analyzed: janam na dhanvan abhi sam yadā āpaḥ satrā vāvṛdhuḥ havanāni yajñaiḥ
translated: As the people to the desert, so have they ever increased the invocations with sacrifices.

original: asmā etan mahyāṅgūṣamasmā indrāya stotraṃ matibhiravāci
analyzed: asmai etat mahya āṅgūṣam asmai indrāya stotram matibhiḥ avāci
translated: This great eulogy have I, this hymn to Indra, have uttered with my thoughts.

original: asad yathā mahati vṛtratūrya indro viśvāyuravitā vṛdhaśca
analyzed: asat yathā mahati vṛtratūrye indraḥ viśvāyuḥ avitā vṛdhaḥ ca
translated: As he was in the great battle with Vritra, so let Indra be the protector and the strengthener of all.

original: kadā bhuvan rathakṣayāṇi brahma kadā stotre sahasrapoṣyandāḥ
analyzed: kadā bhuvan ratha kṣayāṇi brahma kadā stotre sahasra poṣyandāḥ
translated: When will there be chariot-destroying prayers? When will the gifts of a thousand be bestowed in praise?

original: kadā stomaṃ vāsayo 'sya rāyā kadā dhiyaḥ karasi vājaratnāḥ
analyzed: kadā stomam vāsayaḥ sya rāyā kadā dhiyaḥ karasi vāja ratnāḥ
translated: When will you clothe this one's praise with your wealth? When will you make his thoughts rich in booty?

original: karhi svit tadindra yan nṛbhirnṝn vīrairvīrān nīḷayāse jayājīn
analyzed: karhi svid tat indra yat nṛbhiḥ nṝn vīraiḥ vīrān nīḍayāse jaya ājīn
translated: When, indeed, is it, O Indra, that you yoke men with men, heroes with heroes, to win the unconquered?

original: tridhātu gā adhi jayāsi goṣvindra dyumnaṃsvarvad dhehyasme
analyzed: tri dhātu gāḥ adhi jayāsi goṣu indra dyumnam svarvat dhehi asme
translated: You conquer the cattle in three ways in the contests for cattle. O Indra, bring us glory that is heavenly.

original: karhi svit tadindra yajjaritre viṣvapsu brahma kṛṇavaḥ śaviṣṭha
analyzed: karhi svid tat indra yat jaritre viṣu apsu brahma kṛṇavaḥ śaviṣṭha
translated: When, indeed, is it, O Indra, that you perform for the singer, O most powerful one, the rite that brings all good things?

original: kadā dhiyo na niyuto yuvāse kadā gomaghā havanāni gachāḥ🔽sa gomaghā jaritre aśvaścandrā vājaśravaso adhi dhehi pṛkṣaḥ
analyzed: kadā dhiyaḥ na niyutaḥ yuvāse kadā go maghā havanāni gachāḥ  sa go maghāḥ jaritre aśva ścandrāḥ vāja śravasaḥ adhi dhehi pṛkṣaḥ
translated: When do you yoke your thoughts, your teams? When do you come to the offerings rich in cattle?🔽Bestow upon the singer, O Indra, cattle and horses bright as the moon, and food rich in heroes.

original: pīpihīṣaḥ sudughāmindra dhenuṃ bharadvājeṣu suruco rurucyāḥ
analyzed: pīpihi iṣaḥ su dughām indra dhenum bharadvājeṣu su rucaḥ rurucyāḥ
translated: Milk out the cow who yields much milk for Indra, O Bharadvāja, let your bright flames shine forth.

original: tamā nūnaṃ vṛjanamanyathā cicchūro yacchakra vi durogṛṇīṣe
analyzed: tamā nūnam vṛjanam anyathā cit śūraḥ yat śakra vi durogṛṇīṣe
translated: Now, indeed, O Śakra, the hero whom you choose as your friend, you make his people different.

original: mā niraraṃ śukradughasya dhenorāṅgirasān brahmaṇā vipra jinva
analyzed: mā niraram śukra dughasya dhenoḥ āṅgirasān brahmaṇā vipra jinva
translated: Do not abandon the cow who yields pure milk. O Brāhmaṇa, quicken the Aṅgirasas with the prayer.

original: satrā madāsastava viśvajanyāḥ satrā rāyo 'dha ye pārthivāsaḥ
analyzed: satrā madāsaḥ tava viśvajanyāḥ satrā rāyaḥ dha ye pārthivāsaḥ
translated: Your joys are always for all people, always your riches are for the earthly ones.

original: satrā vājānāmabhavo vibhaktā yad deveṣu dhārayathā asuryam
analyzed: satrā vājānām abhavaḥ vibhaktā yat deveṣu dhārayathāḥ asuryam
translated: You are the constant source of powers, when you distribute among the gods the lordship of the immortal ones

original: anu pra yeje jana ojo asya satrā dadhire anu vīryāya🔽syūmagṛbhe dudhaye 'rvate ca kratuṃ vṛñjantyapi vṛtrahatye
analyzed: anu pra yeje janaḥ ojaḥ asya satrā dadhire anu vīryāya  syūmagṛbhe dudhaye rvate ca kratum vṛñjanti api vṛtra hatye
translated: The people have always worshipped him for his strength, and have submitted to him for his heroic deeds🔽They have yoked him to the draught, to the pressing of the juice, to the slaying of Vrtra, the holder of the reins

original: taṃ sadhrīcīrūtayo vṛṣṇyāni pauṃsyāni niyutaḥ saścurindram
analyzed: tam sadhrīcīḥ ūtayaḥ vṛṣṇyāni pauṃsyāni niyutaḥ saścuḥ indram
translated: The strong, the manly teams have harnessed themselves to Indra, the swift ones, the powerful ones

original: samudraṃ na sindhava ukthaśuṣmā uruvyacasaṃ giraā viśanti
analyzed: samudram na sindhavaḥ uktha śuṣmāḥ uru vyacasam giraā viśanti
translated: The rivers, with their praises for the ocean, enter the vast one, the receptacle of all

original: sa rāyas khāmupa sṛjā gṛṇānaḥ puruścandrasya tvamindravasvaḥ
analyzed: sa rāyaḥ khām upa sṛja gṛṇānaḥ puru ścandrasya tvam indra vasvaḥ
translated: Pouring forth wealth, praised, be thou the lord of the most famous treasure, O Indra

original: patirbabhūthāsamo janānāmeko viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā
analyzed: patiḥ babhūtha asamaḥ janānām ekaḥ viśvasya bhuvanasya rājā
translated: Thou hast become the unequalled lord of men, the sole king of the whole world

original: sa tu śrudhi śrutyā yo duvoyurdyaurna bhūmābhi rāyoaryaḥ
analyzed: sa tu śrudhi śrutyā yaḥ duvoyuḥ dyauḥ na bhūmā abhi rāyoaryaḥ
translated: Listen, O thou who art to be invoked by one who desires to serve thee, with the hearing of one who seeks wealth

original: aso yathā naḥ śavasā cakāno yugeyuge vayasā cekitānaḥ
analyzed: asaḥ yathā naḥ śavasā cakānaḥ yuge yuge vayasā cekitānaḥ
translated: As thou art wont to rejoice in our strength, ever watchful in each age

original: arvāg rathaṃ viśvavāraṃ ta ugrendra yuktāso harayo vahantu
analyzed: arvāk ratham viśva vāram te ugra indra yuktāsaḥ harayaḥ vahantu
translated: O Indra, let thy bay steeds, yoked, bring hither thy car, which brings every boon, O mighty one

original: kīriścid dhi tvā havate svarvān ṛdhīmahi sadhamādasteadya
analyzed: kīriḥ cit hi tvā havate svarvān ṛdhīmahi sadhamādaste adya
translated: Even the poor man invokes thee, O thou who hast heaven, that we may be prosperous to-day in thy gifts

original: pro droṇe harayaḥ karmāgman punānāsa ṛjyanto abhūvan
analyzed: pra u droṇe harayaḥ karma agman punānāsaḥ ṛjyantaḥ abhūvan
translated: The tawny ones have come to the trough, purified, they have become straight

original: indro no asya pūrvyaḥ papīyād dyukṣo madasya somyasya rājā
analyzed: indraḥ naḥ asya pūrvyaḥ papīyāt dyukṣaḥ madasya somyasya rājā
translated: Indra is better than this one of old, the king of the sky, of the Soma-drink, of the joy

original: āsasrāṇāsaḥ śavasānamachendraṃ sucakre rathyāso aśvāḥ
analyzed: āsasrāṇāsaḥ śavasānam acha indram su cakre rathyāsaḥ aśvāḥ
translated: The horses, well-wheeled, have brought Indra, the powerful one, to the place of strength, the swift ones

original: abhi śrava ṛjyanto vaheyurnū cin nu vāyoramṛtaṃ vidasyet
analyzed: abhi śravaḥ ṛjyantaḥ vaheyuḥ nu cit nu vāyoḥ amṛtam vidasyet
translated: They would carry him to glory, even if he were far away; one would not find the nectar of Vayu

original: variṣṭho asya dakṣiṇāmiyartīndro maghonāṃ tuvikūrmitamaḥ🔽yayā vajrivaḥ pariyāsyaṃho maghā ca dhṛṣṇo dayase vi sūrīn🔽indro vājasya sthavirasya dātendro gīrbhirvardhatāṃ vṛddhamahāḥ
analyzed: variṣṭhaḥ asya dakṣiṇām iyarti indraḥ maghonām tuvikūrmitamaḥ  yayā vajrivas pariyāsi aṃhaḥ maghā ca dhṛṣṇo dayase vi sūrīn  indraḥ vājasya sthavirasya dātā indraḥ gīrbhiḥ vardhatām vṛddha mahāḥ
translated: He is the most excellent one, he delights in his most southerly gift, Indra, most powerful of the rich🔽By which, O wielder of the thunderbolt, you have overcome his hostility, and, O daring one, you favor the nobles with gifts,🔽Indra, the giver of mighty strength, may Indra, of increased greatness, be exalted by the hymns

original: indro vṛtraṃ haniṣṭho astu satvā tā sūriḥ pṛṇati tūtujānaḥ
analyzed: indraḥ vṛtram haniṣṭhaḥ astu satvā tā sūriḥ pṛṇati tūtujānaḥ
translated: Indra, the most powerful, may he be; the prince, the impetuous one, grants (gifts)

original: apādita udu naścitratamo mahīṃ bharṣad dyumatīmindrahūtim
analyzed: a pāditaḥ udu naḥ citratamaḥ mahīm bharṣat dyumatīm indra hūtim
translated: The most variegated one has risen up; he bears the great, glorious call of Indra

original: panyasīṃ dhītiṃ daivyasya yāmañ janasya rātiṃ vanate sudānuḥ
analyzed: panyasīm dhītim daivyasya yāmam janasya rātim vanate sudānuḥ
translated: The well-disposed thought of the divine one, the generous one obtains the gift of the people

original: dūrāccidā vasato asya karṇā ghoṣādindrasya tanyati bruvāṇaḥ
analyzed: dūrāt cidā vasataḥ asya karṇā ghoṣāt indrasya tanyati bruvāṇaḥ
translated: Even from afar, his ears hear; the one who speaks praises Indra's roar

original: eyamenaṃ devahūtirvavṛtyān madryagindramiyam ṛcyamānā
analyzed: ā iyam enam deva hūtiḥ vavṛtyāt madryak indram iyam ṛcyamānā
translated: This invocation of the gods has come to him; this one, being praised, to Indra, the friend of the Maruts

original: taṃ vo dhiyā paramayā purājāmajaramindramabhyanūṣyarkaiḥ
analyzed: tam vaḥ dhiyā paramayā purā ajām ajaram indram abhyanūṣya arkaiḥ
translated: You, by the highest thought, by the ancient hymns, have praised Indra, the unborn, the imperishable one

original: brahmā ca giro dadhire samasmin mahāṃśca stomo adhi vardhadindre
analyzed: brahmā ca giraḥ dadhire samasmin mahān ca stomaḥ adhi vardhat indre
translated: And in him the Brahmans have placed their voice, and the great laud is increased in Indra.

original: vardhād yaṃ yajña uta soma indraṃ vardhād brahma gira ukthā ca manma
analyzed: vardhāt yam yajñaḥ uta somaḥ indram vardhāt brahma giraḥ ukthā ca manma
translated: He whom sacrifice and Soma increase, him, Indra, whom prayer, hymns, and the hymn increase,

original: vardhāhainamuṣaso yāmannaktorvardhān māsāḥ śarado dyāva indram
analyzed: vardha aha enam uṣasaḥ yāman naktoḥ vardhāt māsāḥ śaradaḥ dyāvaḥ indram
translated: Whom the dawns increase as they go, whom the night, whom the months and the autumns increase, Indra.

original: evā jajñānaṃ sahase asāmi vāvṛdhānaṃ rādhase ca śrutāya
analyzed: eva jajñānam sahase asāmi vāvṛdhānam rādhase ca śrutāya
translated: Even him, born for strength, have I sought for bounty and fame, him who has grown for the gift.

original: mahāmugramavase vipra nūnamā vivāsema vṛtratūryeṣu🔽mandrasya kaverdivyasya vahnervipramanmano vacanasya madhvaḥ
analyzed: mahām ugram avase vipra nūnam ā vivāsema vṛtratūryeṣu  mandrasya kaveḥ divyasya vahneḥ vipra manmanaḥ vacanasya madhvaḥ
translated: The mighty, the fierce, O sage, for help, we would now win him in battles with Vritra.🔽Of the sweet speech of the pleasant, the divine, the carrying sage, the Brahman, the hymn.

original: apā nastasya sacanasya deveṣo yuvasva gṛṇate goagrāḥ
analyzed: apāḥ nastasya sacanasya deva iṣaḥ yuvasva gṛṇate go agrāḥ
translated: Of that speech, O god, do thou, O Indra, grant us a portion, O thou who art rich in kine, to the singer.

original: ayamuśānaḥ paryadrimusra ṛtadhītibhirṛtayug yujānaḥ🔽rujadarugṇaṃ vi valasya sānuṃ paṇīnrvacobhirabhi yodhadindraḥ
analyzed: ayam uśānaḥ paryadrim usraḥ ṛta dhītibhiḥ ṛta yuj yujānaḥ  rujat arugṇam vi valasya sānum paṇīn rvacobhiḥ abhi yodhat indraḥ
translated: This one, the presser, yoking the yoke-fellows, the pious, with the pious, hath encompassed the stone.🔽He hath pierced the unpierced ridge of the cloud; with his words Indra hath fought with the Panis.

original: ayaṃ dyotayadadyuto vyaktūn doṣā vastoḥ śarada indurindra
analyzed: ayam dyotayat adyutaḥ vyaktūn doṣā vastoḥ śaradaḥ induḥ indra
translated: This one hath shone forth, shining, with the lights, in the morning, in the evening, in autumn, O Indra.

original: imaṃ ketumadadhurnū cidahnāṃ śucijanmana uṣasaścakāra🔽ayaṃ rocayadaruco rucāno 'yaṃ vāsayad vy ṛtena pūrvīḥ
analyzed: imam ketum adadhuḥ nu cit ahnām śuci janmanaḥ uṣasaḥ cakāra 🔽ayam rocayat arucaḥ rucānaḥ yam vāsayat vi ṛtena pūrvīḥ
translated: This one have they placed as the light of the days; he hath made the dawns of pure birth.🔽This one hath shone, shining, with the lights; this one hath caused to shine the many with his light.

original: ayamīyata ṛtayugbhiraśvaiḥ svarvidā nābhinā carṣaṇiprāḥ🔽nū gṛṇāno gṛṇate pratna rājanniṣaḥ pinva vasudeyāya pūrvīḥ
analyzed: ayam īyate ṛta yugbhiḥ aśvaiḥ svarvidā nābhinā carṣaṇi prāḥ  nu gṛṇānaḥ gṛṇate pratna rājan iṣaḥ pinva vasu deyāya pūrvīḥ
translated: He went with his horses yoked to truth, the leader of men, knowing the heaven, with the navel🔽Now, O ancient king, being praised, fill the cows for the one who sings, for the bestowal of abundant wealth

original: apa oṣadhīraviṣā vanāni gā arvato nṝn ṛcase rirīhi
analyzed: apaḥ oṣadhīḥ raviṣāḥ vanāni gāḥ arvataḥ nṝn ṛcase rirīhi
translated: Grant waters, plants, and forests free from poison, cattle, horses, and men for the reciter

original: indra piba tubhyaṃ suto madāyāva sya harī vi mucā sakhāyā
analyzed: indra piba tubhyam sutaḥ madāya ava sya harī vi muca sakhāyā
translated: O Indra, drink the Soma pressed for you to make you glad, and let loose your two friends, the bay horses

original: uta pra gāya gaṇa ā niṣadyāthā yajñāya gṛṇate vayo dhāḥ
analyzed: uta pra gāya gaṇe ā niṣadya athā yajñāya gṛṇate vayaḥ dhāḥ
translated: Then sing, O host, when you have sat down, and then bestow strength on the singer for the sacrifice

original: asya piba yasya jajñāna indra madāya kratve apibo virapśin
analyzed: asya piba yasya jajñānaḥ indra madāya kratve apibaḥ virapśin
translated: Drink of that, whose, O Indra, at birth, for joy, you drank, O you who delight in the song,

original: tamu te gāvo nara āpo adririnduṃ samahyan pītaye samasmai
analyzed: tam u te gāvaḥ naraḥ āpaḥ adriḥ indum samahyan pītaye samasmai
translated: The cows, the men, the waters, the stone have churned the juice for him to be drunk by him

original: samiddhe agnau suta indra soma ā tvā vahantu harayo vahiṣṭhāḥ
analyzed: samiddhe agnau sute indra some ā tvā vahantu harayaḥ vahiṣṭhāḥ
translated: In the well-kindled fire, O Indra, the Soma is pressed; let your best bearers, the bays, bring you

original: tvāyatā manasā johavīmīndrā yāhi suvitāya mahe naḥ
analyzed: tvāyatā manasā johavīmi indra ā yāhi suvitāya mahe naḥ
translated: I call you with this thought, O Indra, come to us for great prosperity

original: ā yāhi śaśvaduśatā yayāthendra mahā manasā somapeyam
analyzed: ā yāhi śaśvat uśatā yayātha indra mahā manasā soma peyam
translated: Come always, as you have come before, O Indra, with the great mind to drink the Soma

original: upa brahmāṇi śṛṇava imā no 'thā te yajñastanve vayo dhāt
analyzed: upa brahmāṇi śṛṇave imā naḥ thā te yajña stanve vayaḥ dhāt
translated: Listen to our prayers, and then let your sacrifice give strength to your body

original: yadindra divi pārye yad ṛdhag yad vā sve sadane yatra vāsi
analyzed: yat indra divi pārye yat ṛdhak yat vā sve sadane yatra vā asi
translated: If, O Indra, you are in the heaven, in the atmosphere, or in your own abode, wherever you are,

original: ato no yajñamavase niyutvān sajoṣāḥ pāhi girvaṇo marudbhiḥ🔽aheḷamāna upa yāhi yajñaṃ tubhyaṃ pavanta indavaḥ sutāsaḥ
analyzed: atas naḥ yajñam avase niyutvān sajoṣāḥ pāhi girvaṇaḥ marudbhiḥ  a heḍamānaḥ upa yāhi yajñam tubhyam pavante indavaḥ sutāsaḥ
translated: Therefore, with thy team, come to our sacrifice, O thou who lovest song, with the Maruts, in unison, for help🔽Come to the sacrifice, O thou who art not to be deceived, the pressed Soma juices are purified for thee

original: gāvo na vajrin svamoko achendrā gahi prathamo yajñiyānām
analyzed: gāvaḥ na vajrin sva mokaḥ achā indra ā gahi prathamaḥ yajñiyānām
translated: O Indra, the cows have come to thee, O thou of easy access, O Indra, come as the first of those worthy of sacrifice

original: yā te kākut sukṛtā yā variṣṭhā yayā śaśvat pibasi madhva ūrmim
analyzed: yā te kākud su kṛtā yā variṣṭhā yayā śaśvat pibasi madhvaḥ ūrmim
translated: O thou of beautiful gait, thy best, thy most excellent, by which thou ever drinkest the wave of mead

original: tayā pāhi pra te adhvaryurasthāt saṃ te vajrovartatāmindra gavyuḥ
analyzed: tayā pāhi pra te adhvaryuḥ asthāt sam te vajraḥ vartatām indra gavyuḥ
translated: With that protect him, the Adhvaryu hath stood up for thee, let thy thunderbolt, O Indra, which brings kine, turn back

original: eṣa drapso vṛṣabho viśvarūpa indrāya vṛṣṇe samakāri somaḥ
analyzed: eṣa drapsaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ viśva rūpaḥ indrāya vṛṣṇe samakāri somaḥ
