translated: This drop, the bull, of all forms, hath been made for Indra, the strong, this Soma

original: etaṃ piba hariva sthātarugra yasyeśiṣe pradivi yasteannam
analyzed: etam piba harivas sthātar ugra yasya īśiṣe pradivi yaḥ te annam
translated: Drink this, O thou who dwellest with the Bay Steeds, O thou who art fierce, of which thou hast the wish, which is thy food in the distance

original: sutaḥ somo asutādindra vasyānayaṃ śreyāñcikituṣe raṇāya
analyzed: sutaḥ somaḥ a sutāt indra vasyā anayam śreyān cikituṣe raṇāya
translated: The pressed Soma is better than the unpressed, O Indra, this is better for the wise one to choose for the contest

original: etaṃ titirva upa yāhi yajñaṃ tena viśvāstaviṣīrā pṛṇasva
analyzed: etam titirvaḥ upa yāhi yajñam tena viśva asta viṣīrā pṛṇasva
translated: Come to this sacrifice, O Tirt, satisfy all thy desires with it

original: hvayāmasi tvendra yāhyarvāṃ araṃ te somastanve bhavāti
analyzed: hvayāmasi tvā indra yāhi arvān aram te somaḥ tanve bhavāti
translated: We invoke thee, O Indra, come hither on the swift one, may the Soma be refreshing to thy body

original: śatakrato mādayasvā suteṣu prāsmānava pṛtanāsu pra vikṣu
analyzed: śatakrato mādayasva suteṣu pra asmān ava pṛtanāsu pra vikṣu
translated: O thou of a hundred powers, rejoice in the juices, be thou foremost in the battles and in the contests

original: pratyasmai pipīṣate viśvāni viduṣe bhara
analyzed: prati asmai pipīṣate viśvāni viduṣe bhara
translated: Bring to him who longs for it all things, to the wise one

original: araṃgamāya jagmaye 'paścāddaghvane nare
analyzed: araṃgamāya jagmaye paścāddaghvane nare
translated: To the unconquered, to the one who goes, to the loud-sounding men in the rear

original: emenaṃ pratyetana somebhiḥ somapātamam
analyzed: ā īm enam pratyetana somebhiḥ soma pātamam
translated: Thus let him come to this one, the drinker of Soma, with the Somas

original: amatrebhirṛjīṣiṇamindraṃ sutebhirindubhiḥ
analyzed: amatrebhiḥ ṛjīṣiṇam indram sutebhiḥ indubhiḥ
translated: To Indra, the powerful one, with the bowls, with the pressed Soma juices

original: yadī sutebhirindubhiḥ somebhiḥ pratibhūṣatha
analyzed: yadī sutebhiḥ indubhiḥ somebhiḥ pratibhūṣatha
translated: If you are adorned with the pressed Soma juices, with the Somas

original: vedā viśvasya medhiro dhṛṣat taṃtamideṣate
analyzed: veda viśvasya medhiraḥ dhṛṣat
translated: The wise one knows all this, the daring one seeks this one

original: asmāasmā idandhaso 'dhvaryo pra bharā sutam
analyzed: asmai asmai id andhasaḥ dhvaryo pra bhara sutam
translated: O Adhvaryu, bring this pressed Soma to this one

original: kuvit samasya jenyasya śardhato 'bhiśasteravasparat
analyzed: kuvid samasya jenyasya śardhataḥ bhiśasteḥ avasparat
translated: Has he not overcome the violence of this noble one's wrath?

original: yasya tyacchambaraṃ made divodāsāya randhayaḥ
analyzed: yasya tyad śambaram made divodāsāya randhayaḥ
translated: Whose intoxicating drink you have given to Divodasa in a state of intoxication

original: ayaṃ sa soma indra te sutaḥ piba
analyzed: ayam sa somaḥ indra te sutaḥ piba
translated: This is that Soma, O Indra, pressed for you. Drink

original: yasya tīvrasutaṃ madaṃ madhyamantaṃ ca rakṣase
analyzed: yasya tīvra sutam madam madhyamantam ca rakṣase
translated: Whose strong-pressed intoxicating drink you guard in the middle and at the end

original: ayaṃ sa / / /
analyzed: ayam sa
translated: This is that one...

original: yasya gā antaraśmano made dṛḷhā avāsṛjaḥ
analyzed: yasya gāḥ anta raśmanaḥ made dṛḍhāḥ avāsṛjaḥ
translated: Whose cows you have released from the firm bonds in the intoxication

original: ayaṃ sa / / /
analyzed: ayam sa
translated: This is that one...

original: yasya mandāno andhaso māghonaṃ dadhiṣe śavaḥ
analyzed: yasya mandānaḥ andhasaḥ māghonam dadhiṣe śavaḥ
translated: Whose intoxicating drink you place in the Maghavan's power

original: ayaṃ sa / / /
analyzed: ayam sa
translated: This is that one...

original: yo rayivo rayintamo yo dyumnairdyumnavattamaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ rayivas rayintamaḥ yaḥ dyumnaiḥ dyumnavattamaḥ
translated: Who is the most wealthy of the wealthy, who is the most glorious of the glorious

original: somaḥ sutaḥ sa indra te 'sti svadhāpate madaḥ
analyzed: somaḥ sutaḥ saḥ indra te sti svadhā pate madaḥ
translated: The Soma is pressed, O Indra, that is your intoxicating drink, O Lord of Svâhâ

original: yaḥ śagmastuviśagma te rāyo dāmā matīnām
analyzed: yaḥ śagma stuvi śagma te rāyaḥ dāmā matīnām
translated: Who is the most bountiful of your bountiful gifts of wealth and thoughts

original: somaḥ sutaḥ / / /
analyzed: somaḥ sutaḥ
translated: Soma is pressed...

original: yena vṛddho na śavasā turo na svābhirūtibhiḥ
analyzed: yena vṛddhaḥ na śavasā turaḥ na svābhiḥ ūtibhiḥ
translated: By whom, being old, he is not strong, nor swift, nor by his own help,

original: somaḥ sutaḥ / / /
analyzed: somaḥ sutaḥ
translated: Soma is pressed...

original: tyamu vo aprahaṇaṃ gṛṇīṣe śavasas patim
analyzed: tyamu vaḥ a prahaṇam gṛṇīṣe śavasaḥ patim
translated: I praise that invincible lord of strength,

original: indraṃ viśvāsāhaṃ naraṃ maṃhiṣṭhaṃ viśvacarṣaṇim🔽yaṃ vardhayantīd giraḥ patiṃ turasya rādhasaḥ
analyzed: indram viśvāsāham naram maṃhiṣṭham viśvacarṣaṇim  yam vardhayanti id giraḥ patim turasya rādhasaḥ
translated: Indra, the all-conquering man, the most bountiful, the all-impelling,🔽Whom these songs exalt, the lord of swift bounty,

original: taminnvasya rodasī devī śuṣmaṃ saparyataḥ
analyzed: tamin u asya rodasī devī śuṣmam saparyataḥ
translated: Then indeed these two divine worlds serve his strength,

original: tad va ukthasya barhaṇendrāyopastṛṇīṣaṇi
analyzed: tat vaḥ ukthasya barhaṇā indrāya upastṛṇīṣaṇi
translated: That I will spread out for Indra on the altar of the hymn.

original: vipo na yasyotayo vi yad rohanti sakṣitaḥ
analyzed: vipaḥ na yasya ūtayaḥ vi yat rohanti sakṣitaḥ
translated: Whose thoughts, like rays, rise up from the earth,

original: avidad dakṣaṃ mitro navīyān papāno devebhyo vasyo acait
analyzed: avidat dakṣam mitraḥ navīyān papānaḥ devebhyaḥ vasyaḥ acait
translated: Mitra has found the newest skill, having drunk, he has become better for the gods.

original: sasavān staulābhirdhautarībhiruruṣyā pāyurabhavat sakhibhyaḥ
analyzed: sasavān staulābhiḥ dhautarībhiḥ uruṣyā pāyuḥ abhavat sakhibhyaḥ
translated: Endowed with strength, he has become a protector for his friends with the loud-sounding and the clear-sounding.

original: ṛtasya pathi vedhā apāyi śriye manāṃsi devāso akran
analyzed: ṛtasya pathi vedhāḥ apāyi śriye manāṃsi devāsaḥ akran
translated: The gods have made their minds for glory on the path of truth, on the way of the wise.

original: dadhāno nāma maho vacobhirvapurdṛśaye venyo vyāvaḥ🔽dyumattamaṃ dakṣaṃ dhehyasme sedhā janānāṃ pūrvīrarātīḥ
analyzed: dadhānaḥ nāma mahaḥ vacobhiḥ vapuḥ dṛśaye venyaḥ vyāvaḥ  dyumattamam dakṣam dhehi asme sedha janānām pūrvīḥ arātīḥ
translated: Bearing the great name with his words, the wise one has revealed his form for the seer.🔽Bestow on us the most glorious skill, restrain the many hostilities of men.

original: varṣīyo vayaḥ kṛṇuhi śacībhirdhanasya sātāvasmānaviḍḍhi
analyzed: varṣīyaḥ vayaḥ kṛṇuhi śacībhiḥ dhanasya sātau asmān aviḍḍhi
translated: Make our life longer by your powers, help us in the winning of wealth.

original: indra tubhyamin maghavannabhūma vayaṃ dātre harivo mā vivenaḥ
analyzed: indra tubhyam id maghavan abhūma vayam dātre harivas mā vivenaḥ
translated: To thee, O Indra, O Maghavan, have we come as givers, O Lord of Bay Steeds, be not thou wroth with us

original: nakirāpirdadṛśe martyatrā kimaṅga radhracodanantvāhuḥ
analyzed: nakir āpiḥ dadṛśe martyatrā kim aṅga radhra codanan tu āhuḥ
translated: No one is seen to be a match for thee among mortals: why then do they call thee a punisher of the niggard?

original: mā jasvane vṛṣabha no rarīthā mā te revataḥ sakhye riṣāma🔽pūrvīṣ ṭa indra niṣṣidho janeṣu jahyasuṣvīn pra vṛhāpṛṇataḥ
analyzed: mā jasvane vṛṣabha naḥ rarīthāḥ mā te revataḥ sakhye riṣāma  pūrvīḥ te indra niṣṣidhaḥ janeṣu jahi asuṣvīn pra vṛha apṛṇataḥ
translated: Be not wroth, O Bull, in the time of our festivity: let us not fail of thy favour, O bountiful one🔽Many are the barriers, O Indra, among the people: destroy the drowsy, and extend the bountiful

original: udabhrāṇīva stanayanniyartīndro rādhāṃsyaśvyāni gavyā
analyzed: udabhrāṇi iva stanayan iyarti indraḥ rādhāṃsi aśvyāni gavyā
translated: Like the clouds, roaring, he sends down rain: Indra bestows gifts of horses and of cattle

original: tvamasi pradivaḥ kārudhāyā mā tvādāmāna ā dabhanmaghonaḥ
analyzed: tvam asi pradivaḥ kāru dhāyāḥ mā tvā a dāmānaḥ ā dabhan maghonaḥ
translated: Thou art the giver of wealth, O thou who art to be invoked: let not the niggards, O Maghavan, prevail against thee

original: adhvaryo vīra pra mahe sutānāmindrāya bhara sa hyasya rājā
analyzed: adhvaryo vīra pra mahe sutānām indrāya bhara sa hi asya rājā
translated: O Adhvaryu, bring to the great ones the pressed (Soma), to Indra: for he is their king

original: yaḥ pūrvyābhiruta nūtanābhirgīrbhirvāvṛdhe gṛṇatām ṛṣīṇām
analyzed: yaḥ pūrvyābhiḥ uta nūtanābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ vāvṛdhe gṛṇatām ṛṣīṇām
translated: He who hath waxed great by the ancient and the new praises of the singing R̥ishis

original: asya made puru varpāṃsi vidvānindro vṛtrāṇyapratī jaghāna🔽tamu pra hoṣi madhumantamasmai somaṃ vīrāya śipriṇe pibadhyai
analyzed: asya made puru varpāṃsi vidvān indraḥ vṛtrāṇi apratī jaghāna  tam u pra hoṣi madhumantam asmai somam vīrāya śipriṇe pibadhyai
translated: In his rapture, knowing full well his manifold powers, Indra hath smitten down the Vr̥itras, the invincible🔽Bring thou unto him the gladdening draught, the Soma to the hero, to the wielder of the lance, to drink

original: pātā sutamindro astu somaṃ hantā vṛtraṃ vajreṇa mandasānaḥ
analyzed: pātā sutam indraḥ astu somam hantā vṛtram vajreṇa mandasānaḥ
translated: Let Indra drink the pressed (Soma), the Soma, slaying Vr̥itra with his bolt, rejoicing in the juice

original: gantā yajñaṃ parāvataścidachā vasurdhīnāmavitā kārudhāyāḥ
analyzed: gantā yajñam parāvataḥ cit achā vasuḥ dhīnām avitā kāru dhāyāḥ
translated: He will come to the sacrifice even from afar: the good God is the helper of the singers and of him who prays.

original: idaṃ tyat pātramindrapānamindrasya priyamamṛtamapāyi
analyzed: idam tyad pātram indra pānam indrasya priyam amṛtam apāyi
translated: This is the cup, dear to Indra, the drink of Indra, the immortal has been drunk

original: matsad yathā saumanasāya devaṃ vyasmad dveṣo yuyavad vyaṃhaḥ🔽enā mandāno jahi śūra śatrūñ jāmimajāmiṃ maghavannamitrān
analyzed: matsat yathā saumanasāya devam vi asmat dveṣaḥ yuyavat vi aṃhaḥ  enā mandānaḥ jahi śūra śatrūm jāmim ajāmim maghavan amitrān
translated: Sit as one who delights in the god, drive away our hatred, drive away our sorrow🔽Having drunk this, O hero, slay the enemies, the kinsmen and non-kinsmen, O bountiful one

original: abhiṣeṇānabhyādediśānān parāca indra pra mṛṇājahī ca🔽āsu ṣmā ṇo maghavannindra pṛtsvasmabhyaṃ mahi varivaḥ sugaṃ kaḥ
analyzed: abhiṣeṇān abhyādediśānān parācaḥ indra pra mṛṇa ajahi ca  āsu sma naḥ maghavan indra pṛtsu asmabhyam mahi varivaḥ su gam kaḥ
translated: Those who march against us, those who come to meet us, O Indra, crush them down and destroy them🔽In this, O bountiful Indra, be victorious for us, make a good path for us, a great space

original: apāṃ tokasya tanayasya jeṣa indra sūrīn kṛṇuhismā no ardham
analyzed: apām tokasya tanayasya jeṣe indra sūrīn kṛṇuhisma naḥ ardham
translated: Be victorious, O Indra, over the offspring of the waters, the sons, make the lords our allies

original: ā tvā harayo vṛṣaṇo yujānā vṛṣarathāso vṛṣaraśmayo 'tyāḥ🔽asmatrāñco vṛṣaṇo vajravāho vṛṣṇe madāya suyujovahantu
analyzed: ā tvā harayaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ yujānāḥ vṛṣa rathāsaḥ vṛṣa raśmayaḥ tyāḥ  asmatrāñcaḥ vṛṣaṇaḥ vajra vāhaḥ vṛṣṇe madāya su yujaḥ vahantu
translated: Your strong, powerful horses are yoked, with strong chariots and strong reins🔽The strong, swift ones, carrying the thunderbolt, are driven here for the strong one's delight, well-yoked

original: ā te vṛṣan vṛṣaṇo droṇamasthurghṛtapruṣo normayo madantaḥ
analyzed: ā te vṛṣan vṛṣaṇaḥ droṇam asthuḥ ghṛta pruṣaḥ na ūrmayaḥ madantaḥ
translated: O bull, the bulls have settled in your trough, rejoicing like the waves of ghee

original: indra pra tubhyaṃ vṛṣabhiḥ sutānāṃ vṛṣṇe bharantivṛṣabhāya somam
analyzed: indra pra tubhyam vṛṣabhiḥ sutānām vṛṣṇe bharanti vṛṣabhāya somam
translated: O Indra, the bulls bring the strong one the Soma of the strong ones, the strong one

original: vṛṣāsi divo vṛṣabhaḥ pṛthivyā vṛṣā sindhūnāṃ vṛṣabhastiyānām
analyzed: vṛṣā asi divaḥ vṛṣabhaḥ pṛthivyāḥ vṛṣā sindhūnām vṛṣabhastiyānām
translated: You are the bull of the sky, the bull of the earth, the bull of the rivers, the bull of the ways

original: vṛṣṇe ta indurvṛṣabha pīpāya svādū raso madhupeyo varāya
analyzed: vṛṣṇe te induḥ vṛṣabha pīpāya svāduḥ rasaḥ madhu peyaḥ varāya
translated: For you, O Vr̥itra-slayer, hath this Indu flowed forth, strong, sweet as sap, to be the choicest drink.

original: ayaṃ devaḥ sahasā jāyamāna indreṇa yujā paṇimastabhāyat🔽ayaṃ svasya piturāyudhānīnduramuṣṇādaśivasya māyāḥ
analyzed: ayam devaḥ sahasā jāyamānaḥ indreṇa yujā paṇim astabhāyat  ayam svasya pituḥ āyudhāni induḥ amuṣṇāt aśivasya māyāḥ
translated: This God, at first born with the might of Indra, hath propped the heaven as 'twere a car with spokes.🔽This Indu hath assumed the weapons of his sire: he hath consumed the magic of the godless one.

original: ayamakṛṇoduṣasaḥ supatnīrayaṃ sūrye adadhājjyotirantaḥ
analyzed: ayam akṛṇot uṣasaḥ su patnīḥ ayam sūrye adadhāt jyotiḥ antar
translated: This hath made fair the Dawns, this hath established light within the Sun.

original: ayaṃ tridhātu divi rocaneṣu triteṣu vindadamṛtaṃ nigūḷham
analyzed: ayam tri dhātu divi rocaneṣu triteṣu vindat amṛtam nigūḍham
translated: This in the three lights of the sky hath found the well-concealed ambrosia.

original: ayaṃ dyāvāpṛthivī vi ṣkabhāyadayaṃ rathamayunak saptaraśmim
analyzed: ayam dyāvāpṛthivī vi skabhāyat ayam ratham ayunak sapta raśmim
translated: This hath extended earth and heaven: this hath yoked the car with seven reins.

original: ayaṃ goṣu śacyā pakvamantaḥ somo dādhāra daśayantramutsam
analyzed: ayam goṣu śacyā pakvam antar somaḥ dādhāra daśa yantram utsam
translated: This Soma, with the active one, hath stablished in the cows the ripe food, the spring with ten contrivances.

original: ya ānayat parāvataḥ sunītī turvaśaṃ yadum
analyzed: yaḥ ānayat parāvataḥ sunītī turvaśam yadum
translated: He who from far away hath brought hither with good guidance Turvasa and Yadu,

original: indraḥ sano yuvā sakhā
analyzed: indraḥ sanaḥ yuvā sakhā
translated: May Indra be our youthful Friend.

original: avipre cid vayo dadhadanāśunā cidarvatā
analyzed: a vipre cit vayaḥ dadhat anāśunā cit arvatā
translated: Even to the priestless he hath given strength, and with a feeble horse hath won the prize.

original: indro jetā hitaṃ dhanam
analyzed: indraḥ jetā hitam dhanam
translated: Indra hath won the treasure laid up for him.

original: mahīrasya praṇītayaḥ pūrvīruta praśastayaḥ
analyzed: mahīḥ asya praṇītayaḥ pūrvīḥ uta praśastayaḥ
translated: Great are his aids, and many his heroic deeds,

original: nāsya kṣīyanta ūtayaḥ
analyzed: na asya kṣīyante ūtayaḥ
translated: His succours never fail.

original: sakhāyo brahmavāhase 'rcata pra ca gāyata
analyzed: sakhāyaḥ brahma vāhase rcata pra ca gāyata
translated: Sing forth and praise him, friends, who brings the Brahman forth,

original: sa hi naḥ pramatirmahī
analyzed: sa hi naḥ pramatiḥ mahī
translated: For he is our most liberal Benefactor.

original: tvamekasya vṛtrahannavitā dvayorasi
analyzed: tvam ekasya vṛtrahan avitā dvayoḥ asi
translated: Thou, Vr̥itra-slayer, art the Friend of one, the Helper of two,

original: utedṛśe yathā vayam
analyzed: uta īdṛśe yathā vayam
translated: And to one like us

original: nayasīd vati dviṣaḥ kṛṇoṣyukthaśaṃsinaḥ
analyzed: nayasi id vati dviṣaḥ kṛṇoṣi uktha śaṃsinaḥ
translated: You lead away the enemies, you make the reciters of praises joyful.

original: nṛbhiḥ suvīra ucyase
analyzed: nṛbhiḥ su vīraḥ ucyase
translated: You are called the most heroic among men.

original: brahmāṇaṃ brahmavāhasaṃ gīrbhiḥ sakhāyam ṛgmiyam
analyzed: brahmāṇam brahma vāhasam gīrbhiḥ sakhāyam ṛgmiyam
translated: I invoke with songs the friend worthy of praise, the Brahman, the carrier of the Brahman,

original: gāṃna dohase huve
analyzed: gāṃna dohase huve
translated: Like a milker for the cow.

original: yasya viśvāni hastayorūcurvasūni ni dvitā
analyzed: yasya viśvāni hastayoḥ ūcuḥ vasūni ni dvitā
translated: Whose wealth, O irresistible one, all people have declared to be in his hands,

original: vīrasya pṛtanāṣahaḥ
analyzed: vīrasya pṛtanāṣahaḥ
translated: The hero who conquers in battles.

original: vi dṛḷhāni cidadrivo janānāṃ śacīpate
analyzed: vi dṛḍhāni cit adrivas janānām śacīpate
translated: Even the firm ones, O lord of power, of the people, O you who crush the enemies,

original: vṛha māyā anānata🔽tamu tvā satya somapā indra vājānāṃ pate
analyzed: vṛha māyāḥ an ānata  tam u tvā satya soma pāḥ indra vājānām pate
translated: Expand your unbent powers.🔽To you, O true Indra, the lord of strength,

original: ahūmahi śravasyavaḥ
analyzed: ahūmahi śravasyavaḥ
translated: We have come, O you who enjoy Soma, we who desire fame.

original: tamu tvā yaḥ purāsitha yo vā nūnaṃ hite dhane
analyzed: tam u tvā yaḥ purā āsitha yaḥ vā nūnam hite dhane
translated: To you who were in the past, and who now are in the present wealth,

original: havyaḥsa śrudhī havam
analyzed: havyaḥ sa śrudhi havam
translated: You who are to be invoked, listen to the invocation.

original: dhībhirarvadbhirarvato vājānindra śravāyyān
analyzed: dhībhiḥ arvadbhiḥ arvataḥ vājān indra śravāyyān
translated: With your thoughts, O Indra, with your swift horses, for the sake of the most famous prizes,

original: tvayā jeṣma hitaṃ dhanam
analyzed: tvayā jeṣma hitam dhanam
translated: Through you may we win the wealth that is to be gained.

original: abhūru vīra girvaṇo mahānindra dhane hite
analyzed: abhūru vīra girvaṇaḥ mahān indra dhane hite
translated: You have become great, O hero who loves praise, O Indra, in the wealth that is to be gained,

original: bhare vitantasāyyaḥ
analyzed: bhare vitantasāyyaḥ
translated: In the bearing, you who extend.

original: yā ta ūtiramitrahan makṣūjavastamāsati🔽tayā no hinuhī ratham
analyzed: yā te ūtiḥ amitra han makṣūjavastamā asati  tayā naḥ hinuhi ratham
translated: That help of yours, O slayer of enemies, which is most swift to move,🔽With that urge on our chariot.

original: sa rathena rathītamo 'smākenābhiyugvanā
analyzed: sa rathena rathītamaḥ smākena abhiyugvanā
translated: You, the best charioteer, with your own chariot, O you who yoke the yoke,

original: jeṣi jiṣṇo hitaṃ dhanam
analyzed: jeṣi jiṣṇo hitam dhanam
translated: You, O victorious one, will win the wealth that is to be gained.

original: ya eka it tamu ṣṭuhi kṛṣṭīnāṃ vicarṣaṇiḥ
analyzed: yaḥ ekaḥ id tamu stuhi kṛṣṭīnām vicarṣaṇiḥ
translated: You who are the only one, praise him, the most active of the people,

original: patirjajñe vṛṣakratuḥ
analyzed: patiḥ jajñe vṛṣa kratuḥ
translated: Vrishkratu was born as the lord

original: yo gṛṇatāmidāsithāpirūtī śivaḥ sakhā
analyzed: yaḥ gṛṇatām id asitha apirūtī śivaḥ sakhā
translated: You are the auspicious friend who grants desires to those who praise you

original: sa tvaṃna indra mṛḷaya
analyzed: sa tvaṃnaḥ indra mṛḍaya
translated: So be gracious to us, O Indra

original: dhiṣva vajraṃ gabhastyo rakṣohatyāya vajrivaḥ
analyzed: dhiṣva vajram gabhastyoḥ rakṣaḥ hatyāya vajrivas
translated: Hold the thunderbolt in your grasp, O wielder of the thunderbolt, for the slaying of the Rakshas

original: sāsahīṣṭhā abhi spṛdhaḥ
analyzed: sāsahīṣṭhāḥ abhi spṛdhaḥ
translated: Overcome the enemies

original: pratnaṃ rayīṇāṃ yujaṃ sakhāyaṃ kīricodanam
analyzed: pratnam rayīṇām yujam sakhāyam kīri codanam
translated: I invoke the ancient friend who is yoked with the treasures, who is urged on by the Kīras,

original: brahmavāhastamaṃ huve
analyzed: brahma vāhastamam huve
translated: Who is the most excellent carrier of prayers

original: sa hi viśvāni pārthivāneko vasūni patyate
analyzed: sa hi viśvāni pārthivān ekaḥ vasūni patyate
translated: For he alone rules over all the earthly treasures

original: girvaṇastamo adhriguḥ
analyzed: girvaṇastamaḥ adhriguḥ
translated: Most delightful in song, most impetuous

original: sa no niyudbhirā pṛṇa kāmaṃ vājebhiraśvibhiḥ
analyzed: sa naḥ niyudbhiḥ ā pṛṇa kāmam vājebhiḥ aśvibhiḥ
translated: May he satisfy us with his powers, with the desires, with the horses rich in food,

original: gomadbhirgopate dhṛṣat🔽tad vo gāya sute sacā puruhūtāya satvane
analyzed: gomadbhiḥ gopate dhṛṣat  tat vaḥ gāya sute sacā puruhūtāya satvane
translated: With the cows, O lord of cows, boldly

original: śaṃ yad gave🔽na śākine
analyzed: śam yat gave  na śākine
translated: That, O friend, I may sing to you in union with the pressed (Soma), to the mighty one invoked by many,🔽When there is well-being for the cow🔽Not for the powerful one

original: na ghā vasurni yamate dānaṃ vājasya gomataḥ
analyzed: na ghā vasuḥ ni yamate dānam vājasya gomataḥ
translated: Nor does the good one delay the gift of food rich in cows,

original: yat sīmupa śravad giraḥ
analyzed: yat sīmupa śravat giraḥ
translated: When he listens to the songs here

original: kuvitsasya pra hi vrajaṃ gomantaṃ dasyuhā gamat
analyzed: kuvitsasya pra hi vrajam gomantam dasyu hā gamat
translated: May he go with his might to the cow-pen belonging to the destroyer of the Dasyus

original: śacībhirapa no varat
analyzed: śacībhiḥ apa naḥ varat
translated: May he favor us with his powers

original: imā u tvā śatakrato 'bhi pra ṇonuvurgiraḥ
analyzed: imāḥ u tvā śatakrato bhi pra nonuvuḥ giraḥ
translated: These songs, O Shatakratu, have resounded forth to you

original: indra vatsaṃna mātaraḥ
analyzed: indra vatsaṃna mātaraḥ
translated: O Indra, like calves to their mothers

original: dūṇāśaṃ sakhyaṃ tava gaurasi vīra gavyate
analyzed: dūṇāśam sakhyam tava gauḥ asi vīra gavyate
translated: The hope of friendship is set on you, O hero, O you who are rich in cows

original: aśvo aśvāyate bhava
analyzed: aśvaḥ aśvāyate bhava
translated: Be a horse to the horse-rider

original: sa mandasvā hyandhaso / / /🔽imā u tvā sutesute nakṣante girvaṇo giraḥ
analyzed: sa mandasva hi andhasaḥ  imāḥ u tvā sute sute nakṣante girvaṇaḥ giraḥ
translated: Do thou rejoice in the juice, O thou of great bounty, in the juice of the Soma.🔽These songs, O lover of song, are offered to thee at the well-pressed, well-pressed (Soma).

original: vatsaṃ gāvona dhenavaḥ
analyzed: vatsam gāvona dhenavaḥ
translated: The milch-cows low to their calf,

original: purūtamaṃ purūṇāṃ stotṝṇāṃ vivāci
analyzed: purūtamam purūṇām stotṝṇām vivāci
translated: The most abundant of the many, in the assembly of the singers,

original: vājebhirvājayatām
analyzed: vājebhiḥ vājayatām
translated: Of those who strive to win by strength.

original: asmākamindra bhūtu te stomo vāhiṣṭho antamaḥ
analyzed: asmākam indra bhūtu te stomaḥ vāhiṣṭhaḥ antamaḥ
translated: May our praise, O Indra, be the most excellent and last of all to thee.

original: asmān rāye mahe hinu
analyzed: asmān rāye mahe hinu
translated: Lead us to great riches.

original: adhi bṛbuḥ paṇīnāṃ varṣiṣṭhe mūrdhannasthāt
analyzed: adhi bṛbuḥ paṇīnām varṣiṣṭhe mūrdhan asthāt
translated: Bṛbu stood on the highest head of the Paṇis,

original: uruḥ kakṣo na gāṅgyaḥ
analyzed: uruḥ kakṣaḥ na gāṅgyaḥ
translated: Like the wide-spreading tree of the Ganges.

original: yasya vāyoriva dravad bhadrā rātiḥ sahasriṇī
analyzed: yasya vāyoḥ iva dravat bhadrā rātiḥ sahasriṇī
translated: Whose bounty, like that of Vāyu, moves swiftly, a thousandfold,

original: sadyo dānāya maṃhate
analyzed: sadyas dānāya maṃhate
translated: He is ready to give immediately.

original: tat su no viśve arya ā sadā gṛṇanti kāravaḥ
analyzed: tat su naḥ viśve aryaḥ ā sadā gṛṇanti kāravaḥ
translated: That the bards always sing to us, the All-Aryas,

original: bṛbuṃ sahasradātamaṃ sūriṃ sahasrasātamam🔽tvāmid dhi havāmahe sātā vājasya kāravaḥ🔽tvāṃ vṛtreṣvindra satpatiṃ narastvāṃ kāṣṭhāsvarvataḥ
analyzed: bṛbum sahasra dātamam sūrim sahasra sātamam  tvām id hi havāmahe sātā vājasya kāravaḥ  tvām vṛtreṣu indra sat patim naraḥ tvām kāṣṭhāsu arvataḥ
translated: Bṛbu, the best giver of a thousand, the best giver of a hundred.🔽We call on thee, O Indra, the strong, the singers of praise,🔽Thee, O Indra, the lord of heroes, in battles, the men, in the contests, O thou of the mountain.

original: sa tvaṃ naścitra vajrahasta dhṛṣṇuyā maha stavāno adrivaḥ
analyzed: sa tvam naḥ citra vajra hasta dhṛṣṇuyā mahaḥ stavānaḥ adrivas
translated: Therefore, O thou of wondrous deeds, O thou with the thunderbolt in thy hand, O bold one, when thou art praised, O wielder of the thunderbolt,

original: gāmaśvaṃ rathyamindra saṃ kira satrā vājaṃ na jigyuṣe
analyzed: gām aśvam rathyam indra sam kira satrā vājam na jigyuṣe
translated: Send down the cow, the horse fit for the chariot, O Indra, always the prize to be won.

original: yaḥ satrāhā vicarṣaṇirindraṃ taṃ hūmahe vayam
analyzed: yaḥ satrāhā vicarṣaṇiḥ indram tam hūmahe vayam
translated: We invoke that Indra who is ever victorious, who is most active,

original: sahasramuṣka tuvinṛmṇa satpate bhavā samatsu no vṛdhe
analyzed: sahasra muṣka tuvi nṛmṇa satpate bhava samatsu naḥ vṛdhe
translated: O thou of a thousand testicles, O thou who hast subdued the strong, O lord of the good, be for our prosperity in the battles

original: bādhase janān vṛṣabheva manyunā ghṛṣau mīḷha ṛcīṣama
analyzed: bādhase janān vṛṣabhā iva manyunā ghṛṣau mīḍhe ṛcīṣama
translated: Thou repellest men with wrath like a bull, O thou who art eager to smite, O thou who art full of holy verses

original: asmākaṃ bodhyavitā mahādhane tanūṣvapsu sūrye
analyzed: asmākam bodhyavitā mahādhane tanūṣu apsu sūrye
translated: Be thou our protector in the great battle, in the waters and in the sun, O thou of mighty power

original: indra jyeṣṭhaṃ na ā bharanojiṣṭhaṃ papuri śravaḥ
analyzed: indra jyeṣṭham naḥ ā bharan ojiṣṭham papuri śravaḥ
translated: O Indra, bring us the most manly, the most glorious fame, O thou who art full of food

original: yeneme citra vajrahasta rodasī obhe suśipra prāḥ
analyzed: yena ime citra vajrahasta rodasī ā ubhe su śipra prāḥ
translated: By which, O thou of wondrous deeds, O thou who hast the thunderbolt in thy hand, O thou of beautiful eyebrows, thou hast filled both these worlds

original: tvāmugramavase carṣaṇīsahaṃ rājan deveṣu hūmahe
analyzed: tvām ugram avase carṣaṇī saham rājan deveṣu hūmahe
translated: We invoke thee, O king, for help, the strong one who conquers the people among the gods

original: viśvā su no vithurā pibdanā vaso 'mitrān suṣahān kṛdhi
analyzed: viśvā su naḥ vithurā pibdanā vaso mitrān suṣahān kṛdhi
translated: O good one, crush all our misfortunes and breakings, and make our enemies easy to conquer

original: yadindra nāhuṣīṣvānojo nṛmṇaṃ ca kṛṣṭiṣu🔽yad vāpañca kṣitīnāṃ dyumnamā bhara satrā viśvāni pauṃsyā
analyzed: yat indra nāhuṣīṣu ānojaḥ nṛmṇam ca kṛṣṭiṣu  yat vā apañca kṣitīnām dyumnam ā bhara satrā viśvāni pauṃsyā
translated: If, O Indra, thou hast power and manliness among the sons of Āhuṣ, among the Kṛṣṭis🔽Or if thou bringest the glory of the five peoples, all manly powers for ever

original: yad vā tṛkṣau maghavan druhyāvā jane yat pūrau kacca vṛṣṇyam
analyzed: yat vā tṛkṣau maghavan druhyāvā jane yat pūrau kad ca vṛṣṇyam
translated: Or if, O bountiful one, among the Druhyus, among the people, among the Pūrus, among the Vṛṣṇis

original: asmabhyaṃ tad rirīhi saṃ nṛṣāhye 'mitrān pṛtsuturvaṇe
analyzed: asmabhyam tat rirīhi sam nṛṣāhye mitrān pṛtsuturvaṇe
translated: Bestow that upon us for the battle of men, for the conflict with the enemies, O thou of wondrous deeds

original: indra tridhātu śaraṇaṃ trivarūthaṃ svastimat
analyzed: indra tri dhātu śaraṇam tri varūtham svastimat
translated: O Indra, the threefold refuge, the threefold protection, with prosperity

original: chardiryacha maghavadbhyaśca mahyaṃ ca yāvayā didyumebhyaḥ
analyzed: chardiḥ yaccha maghavadbhyaḥ ca mahyam ca yāvaya didyumebhyaḥ
translated: Grant us shelter, O bountiful one, for the wealthy ones and for me, and ward off the flashing weapons

original: ye gavyatā manasā śatrumādabhurabhipraghnanti dhṛṣṇuyā
analyzed: ye gavyatā manasā śatrum ādabhuḥ abhipraghnanti dhṛṣṇuyā
translated: Those who with a mind greedy for cattle rush upon the enemy, who strike with violence

original: adha smā no maghavannindra girvaṇastanūpā antamo bhava
analyzed: adha smā naḥ maghavan indra girvaṇaḥ tanū pāḥ antamaḥ bhava
translated: Then, O Indra, O you who delight in praise, be our nearest protector of bodies, O bountiful one

original: adha smā no vṛdhe bhavendra nāyamavā yudhi🔽yadantarikṣepatayanti parṇino didyavastigmamūrdhānaḥ
analyzed: adha smā naḥ vṛdhe bhava indra na ayam avāḥ yudhi  yat antarikṣe patayanti parṇinaḥ didyavaḥ tigma mūrdhānaḥ
translated: Then be for our prosperity, O Indra, this (cow) in the battle🔽When the winged thunderbolts fly through the atmosphere, with sharp heads

original: yatra śūrāsastanvo vitanvate priyā śarma pitṝṇām
analyzed: yatra śūrāsaḥ tanvaḥ vitanvate priyā śarma pitṝṇām
translated: Where the heroes spread out their bodies, the dear protection of the fathers

original: adha smā yacha tanve tane ca chardiracittaṃ yāvaya dveṣaḥ
analyzed: adha smā yaccha tanve tane ca chardiḥ acittam yāvaya dveṣaḥ
translated: Then grant to this body and that, drive away the unquiet mind, the hatred

original: yadindra sarge arvataścodayāse mahādhane🔽asamane adhvanivṛjine pathi śyenāniva śravasyatah
analyzed: yat indra sarge arvataḥ codayāse mahādhane  asamane adhvani vṛjine pathi śyenān iva śravasyatah
translated: If, O Indra, you urge on the horses in the creation of the great wealth🔽On the uneven, winding path, like falcons, you strive for glory

original: sindhūnriva pravaṇa āśuyā yato yadi klośamanu ṣvaṇi
analyzed: sindhūn riva pravaṇaḥ āśuyā yataḥ yadi klośam anu svaṇi
translated: Like rivers, swiftly flowing down the slope, if you follow the cry of the birds

original: ā ye vayo na varvṛtatyāmiṣi gṛbhītā bāhvorgavi
analyzed: ā ye vayaḥ na varvṛtati āmiṣi gṛbhītāḥ bāhvoḥ gavi
translated: Those who come like birds spreading out their wings, grasped in the arms, like cows

original: svāduṣ kilāyaṃ madhumānutāyaṃ tīvraḥ kilāyaṃ rasavānutāyam
analyzed: svāduḥ kila ayam tīvraḥ kila ayam
translated: This one is indeed sweet, this one is indeed full of honey, this one is indeed strong, this one is indeed full of juice

original: uto nvasya papivāṃsamindraṃ na kaścanasahata āhaveṣu
analyzed: uta u nu asya papivāṃsam indram na kaścana sahate āhaveṣu
translated: And no one at all can withstand Indra, the drinker of this, in battles

original: ayaṃ svāduriha madiṣṭha āsa yasyendro vṛtrahatye mamāda
analyzed: ayam svāduḥ iha madiṣṭhaḥ āsa yasya indraḥ vṛtra hatye mamāda
translated: This one is sweet here, this one is most intoxicating here, of whom Indra drank at the slaying of Vṛtra

original: purūṇi yaścyautnā śambarasya vi navatiṃ nava ca dehyo han
analyzed: purūṇi yaḥ cyautnā śambarasya vi navatim nava ca dehyaḥ han
translated: And he who smote down the many forts of śambara, and nine and ninety castles

original: ayaṃ me pīta udiyarti vacamayaṃ manīṣāmuśatīmajīgaḥ
analyzed: ayam me pītaḥ udiyarti vacam ayam manīṣām uśatīm ajīgaḥ
translated: This one hath raised my speech to heaven, this one hath helped my longing hymn

original: ayaṃ ṣaḷ urvīramimīta dhīro na yābhyo bhuvanaṃ kaccanāre
analyzed: ayam ṣaṣ urvīḥ amimīta dhīraḥ na yābhyaḥ bhuvanam kad cana āre
translated: This wise one hath measured out the three wide realms from which no one can drive him away

original: ayaṃ sa yo varimāṇaṃ pṛthivyā varṣmāṇaṃ divo akṛṇodayaṃ saḥ
analyzed: ayam sa yaḥ varimāṇam pṛthivyāḥ varṣmāṇam divaḥ akṛṇot ayam saḥ
translated: This is he who hath made the breadth of earth and the height of heaven, this one is he

original: ayaṃ pīyūṣaṃ tisṛṣu pravatsu somo dādhārorvantarikṣam
analyzed: ayam pīyūṣam tisṛṣu pravatsu somaḥ dādhāra uru antarikṣam
translated: This one hath held the milk in the three wide pastures, Soma hath held the atmosphere

original: ayaṃ vidaccitradṛśīkamarṇaḥ śukrasadmanāmuṣasāmanīke
analyzed: ayam vidat citra dṛśīkamarṇaḥ śukra sadmanām uṣasām anīke
translated: This one hath found the wondrously beautiful ocean, in the van of the dawns that have bright abodes

original: ayaṃ mahān mahatā skambhanenod dyāmastabhnād vṛṣabhomarutvān
analyzed: ayam mahān mahatā skambhanena ud dyām astabhnāt vṛṣabhaḥ u marutvān
translated: This great one, the bull, the companion of the Maruts, hath with his mighty support propped up the sky

original: dhṛṣat piba kalaśe somamindra vṛtrahā śūra samare vasūnām
analyzed: dhṛṣat piba kalaśe somam indra vṛtra hā śūra samare vasūnām
translated: Drink boldly, O Indra, the Soma in the bowl, O hero, slayer of Vrtra, in the battle for treasures

original: mādhyandine savana ā vṛṣasva rayisthāno rayimasmāsu dhehi
analyzed: mādhyandine savane ā vṛṣasva rayi sthānaḥ rayim asmāsu dhehi
translated: Be strong at the midday pressing, bestow wealth on us, O thou who dwellest in wealth

original: indra pra ṇaḥ puraeteva paśya pra no naya prataraṃ vasyo acha
analyzed: indra pra naḥ puraetā iva paśya pra naḥ naya prataram vasyaḥ acha
translated: O Indra, look on us as on one who is in front, lead us on to a better course

original: bhavā supāro atipārayo no bhavā sunītiruta vāmanītiḥ
analyzed: bhava su pāraḥ atipārayaḥ naḥ bhava su nītiḥ uta vāma nītiḥ
translated: Be a good leader, a leader beyond, be a good guide and a guide to the left

original: uruṃ no lokamanu neṣi vidvān svarvajjyotirabhayaṃ svasti
analyzed: urum naḥ lokam anu neṣi vidvān svarvat jyotiḥ abhayam svasti
translated: Lead us, O wise one, to a wide world, to the light, to heaven, to safety

original: ṛṣvā ta indra sthavirasya bāhū upa stheyāma śaraṇā bṛhantā
analyzed: ṛṣvā te indra sthavirasya bāhū upa stheyāma śaraṇā bṛhantā
translated: O Indra, may we find support in thy lofty and mighty arms,

original: variṣṭhe na indra vandhure dhā vahiṣṭhayoḥ śatāvannaśvayorā
analyzed: variṣṭhe naḥ indra vandhure dhāḥ vahiṣṭhayoḥ śatāvan aśvayoḥ ā
translated: O Indra, place us in the best of yokes, in the two best of a hundred horses, O thou of a hundred powers,

original: iṣamā vakṣīṣāṃ varṣiṣṭhāṃ mā nastārīn maghavan rāyo aryaḥ
analyzed: iṣam ā vakṣi iṣām varṣiṣṭhām mā naḥ tārīt maghavan rāyaḥ aryaḥ
translated: Bring us the most abundant food, O Maghavan, let not the wealth of the pious pass us by.

original: indra mṛḷa mahyaṃ jīvātumicha codaya dhiyamayaso na dhārām
analyzed: indra mṛḍa mahyam jīvātum icha codaya dhiyam ayasaḥ na dhārām
translated: O Indra, be gracious to me, desire to live, impel the thought of me as a stream of iron.

original: yat kiṃ cāhaṃ tvāyuridaṃ vadāmi tajjuṣasva kṛdhi mā devavantam🔽trātāramindramavitāramindraṃ havehave suhavaṃ śūramindram
analyzed: yat kim ca aham tvāyuḥ idam vadāmi tat juṣasva kṛdhi mā devavantam  trātāram indram avitāram indram havehave su havam śūram indram
translated: Whatever I say to thee, O Indra, for this life, accept it, make me one who has the gods.🔽I call on Indra, the protector, Indra, the deliverer, the hero, easy to invoke, in every invocation.

original: hvayāmi śakraṃ puruhūtamindraṃ svasti no maghavādhātvindraḥ
analyzed: hvayāmi śakram puru hūtam indram svasti naḥ maghavā adhātu indraḥ
translated: I call on Indra, the mighty, the much-invoked, may Indra the bountiful grant us welfare.

original: indraḥ sutrāmā svavānavobhiḥ sumṛḷīko bhavatu viśvavedāḥ
analyzed: indraḥ sutrāmā su avān avobhiḥ su mṛḷīkaḥ bhavatu viśva vedāḥ
translated: May Indra, the good protector, the self-existent one, be well-disposed, the knower of all.

original: bādhatāṃ dveṣo abhayaṃ kṛṇotu suvīryasya patayaḥ syāma
analyzed: bādhatām dveṣaḥ abhayam kṛṇotu su vīryasya patayaḥ syāma
translated: May he drive away hatred, may he make us fearless, may we be lords of good heroism.

original: tasya vayaṃ sumatau yajñiyasyāpi bhadre saumanase syāma🔽sa sutrāmā svavānindro asme ārāccid dveṣaḥ sanutaryuyotu
analyzed: tasya vayam sumatau yajñiyasya api bhadre saumanase syāma  sa sutrāmā svavān indraḥ asme ārāt cit dveṣaḥ sanutar yuyotu
translated: May we be in the favour of that adorable one, in his good will and gracious love.🔽May that good protector, self-existent Indra, drive away hatred from us even from afar.

original: ava tve indra pravato normirgiro brahmāṇi niyuto dhavante
analyzed: ava tve indra pravataḥ nā ūrmiḥ giraḥ brahmāṇi niyutaḥ dhavante
translated: O Indra, thy waves, like those of the sea, thy songs, prayers, and teams, come hither to us.

original: urū na rādhaḥ savanā purūṇyapo gā vajrin yuvase samindūn
analyzed: urū na rādhaḥ savanā purūṇi apaḥ gāḥ vajrin yuvase samindūn
translated: Thou, O bountiful one, takest to thyself many libations, many streams, many milch-kine, O thou who hast the thunderbolt.

original: ka īṃ stavat kaḥ pṛṇāt ko yajāte yadugramin maghavā viśvahāvet
analyzed: kaḥ īm stavat kaḥ pṛṇāt kaḥ yajāte yat ugram id maghavā viśvahā avet
translated: Who will praise him? who will fill his belly? who will worship him, that he may be strong? the bountiful one is to be served at all times.

original: pādāviva praharannanyamanyaṃ kṛṇoti pūrvamaparaṃ śacībhiḥ
analyzed: pādau iva praharan anyam anyam kṛṇoti pūrvam aparam śacībhiḥ
translated: He strikes one foot against the other, and makes the former one the later by his might.

original: śṛṇve vīra ugramugraṃ damāyannanyam anyamatinenīyamānaḥ
analyzed: śṛṇve vīraḥ ugram ugram damāyan anyam anyam atinenīyamānaḥ
translated: I hear the hero, terrible, terrible, subduing one, leading another away.

original: edhamānadviḷ ubhayasya rājā coṣkūyate viśa indro manuṣyān
analyzed: edhamāna dviṣ ubhayasya rājā coṣkūyate viśaḥ indraḥ manuṣyān
translated: The king of both, he who is to be magnified, is exalted among the people, Indra among men.

original: parā pūrveṣāṃ sakhyā vṛṇakti vitarturāṇo aparebhireti
analyzed: parā pūrveṣām sakhyā vṛṇakti vitarturāṇaḥ aparebhiḥ eti
translated: He rejects the former friendships of the people, and comes with others, being much afflicted.

original: anānubhūtīravadhūnvānaḥ pūrvīrindraḥ śaradastartarīti
analyzed: anānubhūtīḥ avadhūnvānaḥ pūrvīḥ indraḥ śaradaḥ tartarīti
translated: Indra, not to be overcome, passes over the former autumns, driving away the unapproachable ones.

original: rūpaṃrūpaṃ pratirūpo babhūva tadasya rūpaṃ praticakṣaṇāya
analyzed: rūpam rūpam pratirūpaḥ babhūva tat asya rūpam praticakṣaṇāya
translated: To every form Prati-rûpa became a counterpart: that is his form for the sake of recognition.

original: indro māyābhiḥ pururūpa īyate yuktā hyasya harayaḥśatā daśa
analyzed: indraḥ māyābhiḥ puru rūpaḥ īyate yuktāḥ hi asya harayaḥ śatāḥ daśa
translated: Indra, with his illusions, goes in many forms, for ten times a hundred are his harnessed bays.

original: yujāno haritā rathe bhūri tvaṣṭeha rājati
analyzed: yujānaḥ haritā rathe bhūri tvaṣṭā iha rājati
translated: Tvastr, yoking his tawny horses to the car, shines here as king.

original: ko viśvāhā dviṣataḥ pakṣa āsata utāsīneṣu sūriṣu
analyzed: kaḥ viśvāhā dviṣataḥ pakṣe āsate uta āsīneṣu sūriṣu
translated: Who is the friend of all men, even of those who sit at home?

original: agavyūti kṣetramāgamna devā urvī satī bhūmiraṃhūraṇābhūt
analyzed: devāḥ urvī satī bhūmiḥ aṃhūraṇā abhūt
translated: The gods have come to the field of battle, the earth, though wide, has become narrow.

original: bṛhaspate pra cikitsā gaviṣṭāvitthā sate jaritraindra panthām
analyzed: bṛhaspate pra cikitsa gaviṣṭau itthā sate jaritrā aindra panthām
translated: O Brihaspati, lead us on to the place of the cow, to the place of wealth, O Indra, to the place of the sacrificer.

original: divedive sadṛśīranyamardhaṃ kṛṣṇā asedhatapa sadmanojāḥ
analyzed: dive dive sadṛśīḥ anyam ardham kṛṣṇāḥ asedhatapa sadmanaḥ jāḥ
translated: Day by day he has driven away the black-spotted ones, the offspring of the house, to another half.

original: ahan dāsā vṛṣabho vasnayantodavraje varcinaṃ śambaraṃ ca
analyzed: ahan dāsā vṛṣabhaḥ vasnayantā udavraje varcinam śambaram ca
translated: The bull has slain the Dasyus, the Vasnis, in the Ud-vraja, the Vr̥ishni, and the Sambara.

original: prastoka in nu rādhasasta indra daśa kośayīrdaśa vājino 'dāt
analyzed: prastokaḥ id nu rādhasaḥ te indra daśa kośayīḥ daśa vājinaḥ dāt
translated: Prastoka has given to me, O Indra, ten treasures, ten strong horses, and ten cows.

original: divodāsādatithigvasya rādhaḥ śāmbaraṃ vasu pratyagrabhīṣma
analyzed: divodāsāt atithigvasya rādhaḥ śāmbaram vasu pratyagrabhīṣma
translated: From Divodasa I have received the gift of Atithigva, the wealth of Sambara.

original: daśāśvān daśa kośān daśa vastrādhibhojanā
analyzed: daśa aśvān daśa kośān daśa vastrā adhibhojanā
translated: Ten horses, ten treasures, ten garments and foods,

original: daśo hiraṇyapiṇḍān divodāsādasāniṣam
analyzed: daśa u hiraṇya piṇḍān divodāsa adasāniṣam
translated: Ten lumps of gold have I received from Divodasa.

original: daśa rathān praṣṭimataḥ śataṃ gā atharvabhyaḥ
analyzed: daśa rathān praṣṭimataḥ śatam gāḥ atharvabhyaḥ
translated: Ten chariots with yokes, a hundred cows to the Atharvans,

original: aśvathaḥ pāyave 'dāt
analyzed: aśvathaḥ pāyave dāt
translated: Ashvatha has given to Payu.

original: mahi rādho viśvajanyaṃ dadhānān bharadvājān sārñjayo abhyayaṣṭa
analyzed: mahi rādhaḥ viśvajanyam dadhānān bharadvājān sārñjayaḥ abhyayaṣṭa
translated: The son of Sarñjaya has worshipped the Bharadvajas, who possess great wealth that belongs to all people.

original: vanaspate vīḍvaṅgo hi bhūyā asmatsakhā prataraṇaḥ suvīraḥ
analyzed: vanaspate vīḍu aṅgaḥ hi bhūyāḥ asmad sakhā prataraṇaḥ su vīraḥ
translated: O Vanaspati, be firm-limbed, be our friend, a good protector of brave men.

original: gobhiḥ saṃnaddho asi vīḷayasvāsthātā te jayatu jetvāni
analyzed: gobhiḥ saṃnaddhaḥ asi vīḍayasva āsthātā te jayatu jetvāni
translated: You are bound with cows, be strong. Let him who relies on you win victories.

original: divas pṛthivyāḥ paryoja udbhṛtaṃ vanaspatibhyaḥ paryābhṛtaṃ sahaḥ
analyzed: divaḥ pṛthivyāḥ pari ojaḥ udbhṛtam vanaspatibhyaḥ paryābhṛtam sahaḥ
translated: The strength that is gathered from heaven and earth, that is gathered from the trees,

original: apāmojmānaṃ pari gobhirāvṛtamindrasya vajraṃ haviṣā rathaṃ yaja
analyzed: apāma ūjmānam pari gobhiḥ āvṛtam indrasya vajram haviṣā ratham yaja
translated: The strength of the waters, surrounded by cows, the thunderbolt of Indra, the chariot, I worship with oblations

original: indrasya vajro marutāmanīkaṃ mitrasya garbho varuṇasya nābhiḥ
analyzed: indrasya vajraḥ marutām anīkam mitrasya garbhaḥ varuṇasya nābhiḥ
translated: The thunderbolt of Indra, the vanguard of the Maruts, the embryo of Mitra, the navel of Varuna

original: semāṃ no havyadātiṃ juṣāṇo deva ratha prati havyā gṛbhāya
analyzed: sa imām naḥ havya dātim juṣāṇaḥ deva ratha prati havyā gṛbhāya
translated: Accepting this our offering, O god, grasp the oblations with your chariot

original: upa śvāsaya pṛthivīmuta dyāṃ purutrā te manutāṃ viṣṭhitaṃ jagat
analyzed: upa śvāsaya pṛthivīm uta dyām purutrā te manutām viṣṭhitam jagat
translated: Bellow at the earth and the sky, let the world that is spread out in many places think of you

original: sa dundubhe sajūrindreṇa devairdūrād davīyoapa sedha śatrūn
analyzed: sa dundubhe sajūs indreṇa devaiḥ dūrāt davīyaḥ apa sedha śatrūn
translated: O Dundubhi, in unison with Indra and the gods, drive away the enemies from afar

original: ā krandaya balamojo na ā dhā ni ṣṭanihi duritā bādhamānaḥ
analyzed: ā krandaya balam ojaḥ naḥ ā dhāḥ ni stanihi duritā bādhamānaḥ
translated: Make them cry out, bring strength and vigor, trampling down the evil ones

original: apa protha dundubhe duchunā ita indrasya muṣṭirasi vīḷayasva
analyzed: apa protha dundubhe duchunāḥ itas indrasya muṣṭiḥ asi vīḍayasva
translated: Roar away, Dundubhi, the evil ones. You are Indra's fist, expand

original: āmūraja pratyāvartayemāḥ ketumad dundubhirvāvadīti
analyzed: ā amūraja pratyāvartaya imāḥ ketumat dundubhiḥ vāvadīti
translated: The bannered Dundubhi resounds, let these return to us, O Amūrā

original: samaśvaparṇāścaranti no naro 'smākamindra rathino jayantu
analyzed: sam aśva parṇāḥ caranti naḥ naraḥ smākam indra rathinaḥ jayantu
translated: Our men move about with winged horses. May our charioteers, O Indra, be victorious

original: yajñāyajñā vo agnaye girāgirā ca dakṣase🔽prapra vayamamṛtaṃ jātavedasaṃ priyaṃ mitraṃ na śaṃsiṣam
analyzed: yajñāyajñāḥ vaḥ agnaye girā girā ca dakṣase  pra pra vayam amṛtam jātavedasam priyam mitram na śaṃsiṣam
translated: To your Agni who is worshipped with every sacrifice, to your Daksha who is praised with every hymn🔽We will extol the immortal one who knows all that exists, the dear friend,

original: ūrjo napātaṃ sa hināyamasmayurdāśema havyadātaye
analyzed: ūrjaḥ napātam sa hina ayam asmayuḥ dāśema havya dātaye
translated: The son of strength, for he is the one who helps us. Let us serve him who gives oblations.

original: bhuvad vājeṣvavitā bhuvad vṛdha uta trātā tanūnām
analyzed: bhuvat vājeṣu avitā bhuvat vṛdhaḥ uta trātā tanūnām
translated: Be thou a helper in battles, be thou a promoter, and a protector of bodies

original: vṛṣā hyagne ajaro mahān vibhāsyarciṣā
analyzed: vṛṣā hi agne ajaraḥ mahān vibhāsi arciṣā
translated: For thou, O Agni, art a bull, undecaying, great, shining with thy flame

original: ajasreṇa śociṣā śośucacchuce sudītibhiḥ su dīdihi🔽maho devān yajasi yakṣyānuṣak tava kratvota daṃsanā
analyzed: ajasreṇa śociṣā śośucat śuce su dītibhiḥ su dīdihi  mahaḥ devān yajasi yakṣya anuṣak tava kratvā uta daṃsanā
translated: Shining with thy undecaying radiance, O pure one, shine with thy fair lights🔽Thou dost worship the great gods in due order, O Agni, by thy wisdom and thy splendour

original: arvācaḥ sīṃ kṛṇuhyagne 'vase rāsva vājota vaṃsva🔽yamāpo adrayo vanā garbham ṛtasya piprati
analyzed: arvācaḥ sīm kṛṇuhi agne vase rāsva vājā uta vaṃsva  yama apaḥ adrayaḥ vanā garbham ṛtasya piprati
translated: Turn thou unto us, O Agni, for help, give food and strength🔽Whom the waters, the mountains, and the woods quicken as the germ of truth

original: sahasā yo mathito jāyate nṛbhiḥ pṛthivyā adhi sānavi
analyzed: sahasā yaḥ mathitaḥ jāyate nṛbhiḥ pṛthivyāḥ adhi sānavi
translated: Who is born by the Nirrti with the men, on the ridge of the earth

original: ā yaḥ paprau bhānunā rodasī ubhe dhūmena dhāvate divi
analyzed: ā yaḥ paprau bhānunā rodasī ubhe dhūmena dhāvate divi
translated: Who hath filled with his light both the worlds, who with smoke runneth in the sky

original: tirastamo dadṛśa ūrmyāsvā śyāvāsvaruṣo vṛṣā śyāvā aruṣo vṛṣā
analyzed: tirastamaḥ dadṛśe ūrmyāsu ā śyāvāsu aruṣaḥ vṛṣā śyāvāḥ aruṣaḥ vṛṣā
translated: He hath dispelled the darkness, he is seen in the waves, the red bull in the dark, the red bull in the dark

original: bṛhadbhiragne arcibhiḥ śukreṇa deva śociṣā
analyzed: bṛhadbhiḥ agne arcibhiḥ śukreṇa deva śociṣā
translated: With thy great flames, O Agni, with thy bright, O god, with thy radiance

original: bharadvāje samidhāno yaviṣṭhya revan naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumat pāvaka dīdihi
analyzed: bharadvāje samidhānaḥ yaviṣṭhya revat naḥ śukra dīdihi dyumat pāvaka dīdihi
translated: Enkindled by Bharadvaja, O youngest, shine thou for us, O bright one, shine with splendour, O shining one, with splendour

original: viśvāsāṃ gṛhapatirviśāmasi tvamagne mānuṣīṇām
analyzed: viśvāsām gṛhapatiḥ viśāmasi tvam agne mānuṣīṇām
translated: Thou art the lord of all the people, thou of the human people, O Agni

original: śataṃ pūrbhiryaviṣṭha pāhyaṃhasaḥ sameddhāraṃ śataṃ himā stotṛbhyo ye ca dadati
analyzed: śatam pūrbhiḥ yaviṣṭha pāhi aṃhasaḥ sameddhāram śatam himā stotṛbhyaḥ ye ca dadati
translated: Protect a hundred winters from harm, O youngest, him who is to be kindled, a hundred winters, to the praisers and to those who give

original: tvaṃ naścitra ūtyā vaso rādhāṃsi codaya
analyzed: tvam naḥ citraḥ ūtyā vaso rādhāṃsi codaya
translated: O wondrous one, O good one, impel the gifts

original: asya rāyastvamagne rathīrasi vidā gādhaṃ tuce tu naḥ
analyzed: asya rāyaḥ tvam agne rathīḥ asi vida gādham tuce tu naḥ
translated: In this wealth, O Agni, thou art the charioteer. Find the ford for our desire

original: parṣi tokaṃ tanayaṃ partṛbhiṣ ṭvamadabdhairaprayutvabhiḥ
analyzed: parṣi tokam tanayam partṛbhiḥ tvam adabdhaiḥ aprayutvabhiḥ
translated: Thou carriest the offspring and the children with the undecaying, unvanquished (helpers).

original: agne heḷāṃsi daivyā yuyodhi no 'devāni hvarāṃsi ca
analyzed: agne heḍāṃsi daivyā yuyodhi naḥ devāni hvarāṃsi ca
translated: O Agni, keep from us the divine deceits, and the human.

original: ā sakhāyaḥ sabardughāṃ dhenumajadhvamupa navyasā vacaḥ
analyzed: ā sakhāyaḥ sabardughām dhenum ajadhvam upa navyasā vacaḥ
translated: O friends, yoke ye the milch-cow who yields abundant milk. Approach with a new song

original: sṛjadhvamanapasphurām
analyzed: sṛjadhvam anapasphurām
translated: Unite her who never fails.

original: yā śardhāya mārutāya svabhānave śravo 'mṛtyu dhukṣata
analyzed: yā śardhāya mārutāya sva bhānave śravaḥ mṛtyu dhukṣata
translated: She who has milked for the Marut host, for the splendid one, glory that is immortal

original: yā mṛḷīke marutāṃ turāṇāṃ yā sumnairevayāvarī
analyzed: yā mṛḍīke marutām turāṇām yā sumnaiḥ eva yāvarī
translated: She who for the swift Maruts, for Mṛḷaka, who ever goes her way with good will

original: bharadvājāyāva dhukṣata dvitā
analyzed: bharadvājāya ava dhukṣata dvitā
translated: Has milked for Bharadvāja two (cows),

original: dhenuṃ ca viśvadohasamiṣaṃ ca viśvabhojasam
analyzed: dhenum ca viśva dohasam iṣam ca viśva bhojasam
translated: A milch-cow and food that all may enjoy, and wealth that all may use.

original: taṃ va indraṃ na sukratuṃ varuṇamiva māyinam
analyzed: tam vaḥ indram na su kratum varuṇam iva māyinam
translated: We will praise that Indra, the very wise one, like Varuna the magician,

original: aryamaṇaṃ na mandraṃ sṛprabhojasaṃ viṣṇuṃ na stuṣa ādiśe🔽tveṣaṃ śardho na mārutaṃ tuviṣvaṇyanarvāṇaṃ pūṣaṇaṃ saṃ yathā śatā
analyzed: aryamaṇam na mandram sṛpra bhojasam viṣṇum na stuṣe ādiśe  tveṣam śardhaḥ na mārutam tuviṣvaṇi anarvāṇam pūṣaṇam sam yathā śatā
translated: Like the delightful Aryaman, the bountiful one, like Vishnu we will praise.🔽The impetuous host like the Marut host, irresistible Pūṣan, as one would (praise) a hundred,

original: saṃ sahasrā kāriṣaccarṣaṇibhya ānāvirgūḷhā vasū karat suvedā no vasū karat
analyzed: sam sahasrā kāriṣat carṣaṇibhyaḥ ānā āvis gūḍhā vasū karat su vedā naḥ vasū karat
translated: As one would (praise) a thousand, we will make him act for the people. May he bring us hidden treasures. May he bring us wealth easy to obtain.

original: ā mā pūṣannupa drava śaṃsiṣaṃ nu te apikarṇa āghṛṇe
analyzed: ā mā pūṣan upa drava śaṃsiṣam nu te apikarṇe āghṛṇe
translated: Come to me, O Pusan, run hither, I will proclaim thee, O thou of the ear-ring, O thou of the nose-ring,

original: aghā aryo arātayaḥ🔽mā kākambīramud vṛho vanaspatimaśastīrvi hi nīnaśaḥ
analyzed: aghāḥ aryaḥ arātayaḥ  mā kākambīram ud vṛhaḥ vanaspatim aśastīḥ vi hi nīnaśaḥ
translated: The wicked, the enemies,🔽Do not destroy the Kakambīra tree, the lord of the forest, for thou drivest away the curses.

original: mota sūro aha evā cana grīvā ādadhate veḥ
analyzed: mā uta sūraḥ aha evā cana grīvāḥ ādadhate veḥ
translated: The sun does not even set his neck on the bird,

original: dṛteriva te 'vṛkamastu sakhyam
analyzed: dṛteḥ iva te vṛkam astu sakhyam
translated: Let thy friendship be like a shield, without a gap,

original: achidrasya dadhanvataḥ supūrṇasya dadhanvataḥ
analyzed: achidrasya dadhanvataḥ su pūrṇasya dadhanvataḥ
translated: Of the one without a gap, of the one with a wide opening,

original: paro hi martyairasi samo devairuta śriyā
analyzed: paraḥ hi martyaiḥ asi samaḥ devaiḥ uta śriyā
translated: For thou art higher than mortals, equal to the gods in glory.

original: abhi khyaḥ pūṣan pṛtanāsu nastvamavā nūnaṃ yathā purā
analyzed: abhi khyaḥ pūṣan pṛtanāsu naḥ tvam avāḥ nūnam yathā purā
translated: Be thou, O Pusan, a helper to us in battles, as thou hast been in the past.

original: vāmī vāmasya dhūtayaḥ praṇītirastu sūnṛtā
analyzed: vāmī vāmasya dhūtayaḥ praṇītiḥ astu sūnṛtā
translated: The left hand of the bountiful, the leader, let the good will be.

original: devasya vāmaruto martyasya vejānasya prayajyavaḥ
analyzed: devasya vāmarutaḥ martyasya vejānasya prayajyavaḥ
translated: Of the bountiful god, O Maruts, of the bountiful one who moves swiftly, who is ready to sacrifice,

original: sadyaścid yasya carkṛtiḥ pari dyāṃ devo naiti sūryaḥ
analyzed: sadyas cit yasya carkṛtiḥ pari dyām devaḥ nā eti sūryaḥ
translated: Whose chariot-path, like that of the god Surya, goes around the sky,

original: tveṣaṃ śavo dadhire nāma yajñiyaṃ maruto vṛtrahaṃ śavo jyeṣṭhaṃ vṛtrahaṃ śavaḥ
analyzed: tveṣam śavaḥ dadhire nāma yajñiyam marutaḥ vṛtra ham śavaḥ jyeṣṭham vṛtra ham śavaḥ
translated: The Maruts have taken the flashing power, the sacrificial power, the best power, the power that slays Vrtra.

original: sakṛd dha dyaurajāyata sakṛd bhūmirajāyata
analyzed: sakṛt ha dyauḥ ajāyata sakṛt bhūmiḥ ajāyata
translated: Once was the sky born, once was the earth born,

original: pṛśnyā dugdhaṃ sakṛt payastadanyo nānu jāyate
analyzed: pṛśnyāḥ dugdham sakṛt payaḥ tat anyaḥ na anu jāyate
translated: The milk of the dappled cow was milked once, no other is born after that.

original: stuṣe janaṃ suvrataṃ navyasībhirgīrbhirmitrāvaruṇā sumnayantā
analyzed: stuṣe janam suvratam navyasībhiḥ gīrbhiḥ mitrāvaruṇā sumnayantā
translated: I praise the people of good vows with new songs, delighting in the friendship of Mitra and Varuna

original: ta ā gamantu ta iha śruvantu sukṣatrāso varuṇomitro agniḥ🔽viśoviśa īḍyamadhvareṣvadṛptakratumaratiṃ yuvatyoḥ

translated: May they come here and listen, the mighty ones, Varuna, Mitra, Agni🔽The people's adorable guest at sacrifices, whose mind is not intoxicated, the two young maidens'

original: divaḥ śiśuṃ sahasaḥ sūnumagniṃ yajñasya ketumaruṣaṃ yajadhyai
analyzed: divaḥ śiśum sahasaḥ sūnum agnim yajñasya ketum aruṣam yajadhyai
translated: The child of the sky, the son of strength, Agni, the ruddy banner of the sacrifice, I worship

original: pāvīravī kanyā citrāyuḥ sarasvatī vīrapatnī dhiyaṃ dhāt
analyzed: pāvīravī kanyā citra āyuḥ sarasvatī vīra patnī dhiyam dhāt
translated: May the daughter of the Pāṇis, the wondrously long-lived Sarasvatī, the wife of the hero, bestow thought.

original: gnābhirachidraṃ śaraṇaṃ sajoṣā durādharṣaṃ gṛṇate śarma yaṃsat
analyzed: gnābhiḥ achidram śaraṇam sajoṣāḥ durādharṣam gṛṇate śarma yaṃsat
translated: May the sisters, of one mind, grant the singer a faultless, unbreakable shelter, hard to assail, and bestow protection.

original: pathaspathaḥ paripatiṃ vacasyā kāmena kṛto abhyānaḷ arkam🔽sa no rāsacchurudhaścandrāgrā dhiyaṃdhiyaṃ sīṣadhāti pra pūṣā🔽prathamabhājaṃ yaśasaṃ vayodhāṃ supāṇiṃ devaṃ sugabhastim ṛbhvam
analyzed: pathaspathaḥ paripatim vacasyā kāmena kṛtaḥ abhyānaṭ arkam  sa naḥ rāsat śurudhaḥ candra agrāḥ dhiyam dhiyam sīṣadhāti pra pūṣā  prathama bhājam yaśasam vayaḥ dhām su pāṇim devam su gabhastim ṛbhvam
translated: The path, the path, the follower of speech, made by desire, has flowed to the sun.🔽May he grant us wide, bright paths. Pūṣan shall further each thought.🔽The first to enjoy, the famous, life-giving, the good-handed, the good-armed, the mighty god.

original: hotā yakṣad yajataṃ pastyānāmagnistvaṣṭāraṃ suhavaṃ vibhāvā
analyzed: hotā yakṣat yajatam pastyānām agniḥ tvaṣṭāram su havam vibhāvā
translated: Let the priest worship Tvaṣṭar, the good invoker, the glorious, the guest of men, the Agni.

original: bhuvanasya pitaraṃ gīrbhirābhī rudraṃ divā vardhayā rudramaktau
analyzed: bhuvanasya pitaram gīrbhiḥ ābhiḥ rudram divā vardhaya rudram aktau
translated: Let us exalt with songs Rudra, the father of the world, in the day, let us strengthen Rudra in the night.

original: bṛhantam ṛṣvamajaraṃ suṣumnam ṛdhag ghuvema kavineṣitāsaḥ
analyzed: bṛhantam ṛṣvam ajaram suṣumnam ṛdhak ghuvema kavinā iṣitāsaḥ
translated: Let us invoke the great, lofty, ageless, well-disposed one, the wise one, we who are sent forth.

original: ā yuvānaḥ kavayo yajñiyāso maruto ganta gṛṇato varasyām🔽acitraṃ cid dhi jinvathā vṛdhanta itthā nakṣanto naro aṅgirasvat
analyzed: ā yuvānaḥ kavayaḥ yajñiyāsaḥ marutaḥ ganta gṛṇataḥ varasyām  acitram cit hi jinvatha vṛdhantaḥ itthā nakṣantaḥ naraḥ aṅgirasvat
translated: O young, wise, worshipful Maruts, come to the best of our songs.🔽Even the wondrous one you quicken, growing, the men who come hither like the Aṅgirases.

original: pra vīrāya pra tavase turāyājā yūtheva paśurakṣirastam
analyzed: pra vīrāya pra tavase turāya ajā yūthā iva paśurakṣi rastam
translated: To the hero, to the strong, to the impetuous one, offer, like a herd to the guardian of cattle.

original: sa pispṛśati tanvi śrutasya stṛbhirna nākaṃ vacanasyavipaḥ
analyzed: sa pispṛśati tanvi śrutasya stṛbhiḥ na nākam vacanasyavipaḥ
translated: He touches the vault of heaven with his rays, as if with wings, of the heard, of the hymn, of the word

original: yo rajāṃsi vimame pārthivāni triścid viṣṇurmanave bādhitāya
analyzed: yaḥ rajāṃsi vimame pārthivāni tris cit viṣṇuḥ manave bādhitāya
translated: Vishnu, who measured the earthly regions thrice for the afflicted Manu

original: tasya te śarmannupadadyamāne rāyā madema tanvā tanā ca🔽tan no 'hirbudhnyo abdhirarkaistat parvatastat savitā cano dhāt
analyzed: tasya te śarman upadadyamāne rāyā madema tanvā tanā ca  tat naḥ hirbudhnyaḥ abdhiḥ arkaiḥ tat parvataḥ tat savitā canaḥ dhāt
translated: In that, O Śarman, we are being protected, may we rejoice in wealth, in body, and in offspring🔽May the serpent Budhnya, the ocean, the mountains, and Savitar grant us that favour

original: tadoṣadhībhirabhi rātiṣāco bhagaḥ purandhirjinvatu pra rāye🔽nu no rayiṃ rathyaṃ carṣaṇiprāṃ puruvīraṃ maha ṛtasya gopām
analyzed: tat oṣadhībhiḥ abhi rātiṣācaḥ bhagaḥ purandhiḥ jinvatu pra rāye  nu naḥ rayim rathyam carṣaṇi prām puru vīram mahaḥ ṛtasya gopām
translated: May Bhaga, Purandhi, and the plants, which are most bountiful, stimulate us for the sake of wealth🔽Grant us that wealth which is to be enjoyed in chariots, which conquers the people, which is rich in many heroes, which is the great guardian of truth

original: kṣayaṃ dātājaraṃ yena janān spṛdho adevīrabhi cakramāma viśa ādevīrabhyaśnavāma
analyzed: kṣayam dāta ajaram yena janān spṛdhaḥ adevīḥ abhi cakramāma viśaḥ ādevīḥ abhyaśnavāma
translated: By which we may overcome the godless people in battle, and may approach the godly people in peace

original: huve vo devīmaditiṃ namobhirmṛḷīkāya varuṇaṃ mitramagnim
analyzed: huve vaḥ devīm aditim namobhiḥ mṛḷīkāya varuṇam mitram agnim
translated: I invoke you, O Goddess Aditi, with salutations, for the sake of mercy, Varuna, Mitra, Agni

original: abhikṣadāmaryamaṇaṃ suśevaṃ trātṝn devān savitāraṃ bhagaṃ ca
analyzed: abhikṣa dām aryamaṇam su śevam trātṝn devān savitāram bhagam ca
translated: We have sought the protection of Aryaman, the beneficent, the saviour gods, Savitar, and Bhaga

original: sujyotiṣaḥ sūrya dakṣapitṝnanāgāstve sumaho vīhi devān
analyzed: su jyotiṣaḥ sūrya dakṣa pitṝn anāgāstve su mahaḥ vīhi devān
translated: O Sun, of great splendour, come to the gods, whose light is good, whose fathers are Daksha, and who are free from sin

original: dvijanmāno ya ṛtasāpaḥ satyāḥ svarvanto yajatā agnijihvāḥ
analyzed: dvi janmānaḥ ye ṛtasāpaḥ satyāḥ svarvantaḥ yajatāḥ agni jihvāḥ
translated: Those who are twice-born, who are true to the law, who are true, who have heaven, who are to be worshipped, whose tongue is Agni

original: uta dyāvāpṛthivī kṣatramuru bṛhad rodasī śaraṇaṃ suṣumne
analyzed: uta dyāvāpṛthivī kṣatram uru bṛhat rodasī śaraṇam suṣumne
translated: And may heaven and earth, the vast and lofty realm, the two world-halves, be a good and pleasant refuge for us.

original: mahas karatho varivo yathā no 'sme kṣayāya dhiṣaṇe anehaḥ
analyzed: mahaḥ karathaḥ varivaḥ yathā naḥ sme kṣayāya dhiṣaṇe anehaḥ
translated: O mighty powers, grant us room and freedom, so that we may dwell in peace and security.

original: ā no rudrasya sūnavo namantāmadyā hūtāso vasavo 'dhṛṣṭāḥ
analyzed: ā naḥ rudrasya sūnavaḥ namantām adyā hūtāsaḥ vasavaḥ dhṛṣṭāḥ
translated: May the irresistible sons of Rudra, the Vasus, today, when called upon, show us honor.

original: yadīmarbhe mahati vā hitāso bādhe maruto ahvāma devān
analyzed: yadi īm arbhe mahati vā hitāsaḥ bādhe marutaḥ ahvāma devān
translated: When we invoke the Maruts, the gods, in a small or great calamity, O those who are set in the sky.

original: mimyakṣa yeṣu rodasī nu devī siṣakti pūṣā abhyardhayajvā
analyzed: mimyakṣa yeṣu rodasī nu devī siṣakti pūṣā abhyardha yajvā
translated: In whom the divine two worlds are measured, in whom Pūṣan, the one who offers the foremost sacrifice,

original: śrutvā havaṃ maruto yad dha yātha bhūmā rejante adhvani pravikte
analyzed: śrutvā havam marutaḥ yat ha yātha bhūmāḥ rejante adhvani pravikte
translated: Having heard the call, O Maruts, when you come, on the wide-spread path, all tremble.

original: abhi tyaṃ vīraṃ girvaṇasamarcendraṃ brahmaṇā jaritarnavena
analyzed: abhi tyam vīram girvaṇasam arca indram brahmaṇā jaritar navena
translated: With new prayer, O singer, praise that hero who loves song, Indra, with holy power.

original: śravadid dhavamupa ca stavāno rāsad vājānupa maho gṛṇānaḥ
analyzed: śravat id havam upa ca stavānaḥ rāsat vājān upa mahaḥ gṛṇānaḥ
translated: He hears the call and is praised, and sits down, praised, bestowing strength and great things.

original: omānamāpo mānuṣīramṛktaṃ dhāta tokāya tanayāya śaṃyoḥ
analyzed: omānam āpaḥ mānuṣīḥ amṛktam dhāta tokāya tanayāya śaṃyoḥ
translated: The waters, the human ones, have made a place of rest, a hymn, for the child and offspring, for good fortune.

original: yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā bhiṣajo mātṛtamā viśvasya sthāturjagato janitrīḥ
analyzed: yūyam hi ṣṭhā bhiṣajaḥ mātṛtamāḥ viśvasya sthātuḥ jagataḥ janitrīḥ
translated: For you are the most motherly of healers, the creators of all that stands and moves.

original: ā no devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇo hiraṇyapāṇiryajato jagamyāt
analyzed: ā naḥ devaḥ savitā trāyamāṇaḥ hiraṇya pāṇiḥ yajataḥ jagamyāt
translated: May the god Savitar, the protector, the one with golden hands, come to the worshipper.

original: yo datravānuṣaso na pratīkaṃ vyūrṇute dāśuṣe vāryāṇi
analyzed: yaḥ datravān uṣasaḥ na pratīkam vyūrṇute dāśuṣe vāryāṇi
translated: He who, like the dawn, spreads out excellent things for the worshipper, the one who possesses gifts.

original: uta tvaṃ sūno sahaso no adyā devānasminnadhvare vavṛtyāḥ
analyzed: uta tvam sūno sahasaḥ naḥ adyā devān asmin adhvare vavṛtyāḥ
translated: And you, O son of strength, turn the gods to us today at this sacrifice.

original: syāmahaṃ te sadamid rātau tava syāmagne 'vasā suvīraḥ
analyzed: syām aham te sadam id rātau tava syām agne vasā su vīraḥ
translated: May I always be in your favor, O Agni, may I be in your favor, O you with good heroes.

original: uta tyā me havamā jagmyātaṃ nāsatyā dhībhiryuvamaṅga viprā
analyzed: uta tyā me havam ā jagmyātam nāsatyā dhībhiḥ yuvam aṅga viprā
translated: And may you two, Nāsatyas, come to my invocation, you two sages through your thoughts.

original: atriṃ na mahastamaso 'mumuktaṃ tūrvataṃ narā duritādabhīke
analyzed: atrim na mahaḥ tamasaḥ mumuktam tūrvatam narā duritāt abhīke
translated: Have delivered Atri from great darkness, have delivered him from misfortune, O heroes.

original: te no rāyo dyumato vājavato dātāro bhūta nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ
analyzed: te naḥ rāyaḥ dyumataḥ vājavataḥ dātāraḥ bhūta nṛvataḥ purukṣoḥ
translated: Be givers to us of wealth with light, with strength, of men, of cattle, of great abundance.

original: daśasyanto divyāḥ pārthivāso gojātā apyā mṛlatā cadevāḥ
analyzed: daśasyantaḥ divyāḥ pārthivāsaḥ go jātāḥ apyāḥ mṛlatā cadevāḥ
translated: The heavenly ones, the earthly ones, the ones born of the cow, the gods, being honored, may they be gracious to us.

original: te no rudraḥ sarasvatī sajoṣā mīḷhuṣmanto viṣṇurmṛḷantu vāyuḥ🔽ṛbhukṣā vājo daivyo vidhātā parjanyāvātā pipyatāmiṣaṃ naḥ
analyzed: te naḥ rudraḥ sarasvatī sajoṣāḥ mīḷhuṣmantaḥ viṣṇuḥ mṛḍantu vāyuḥ  ṛbhukṣāḥ vājaḥ daivyaḥ vidhātā parjanyāvātā pipyata āmiṣam naḥ
translated: May Rudra, Sarasvatī, of one mind, the bountiful ones, Viṣṇu, Vāyu be gracious to us.🔽May Ṛbhukṣaṇ, Vāja, the divine arranger, Parjanya, Vāyu increase our food.

original: uta sya devaḥ savitā bhago no 'pāṃ napādavatu dānu papriḥ
analyzed: uta sya devaḥ savitā bhagaḥ naḥ pām napāt avatu dānu papriḥ
translated: And may that god Savitar, Bhaga, the swift one of the waters, the bountiful one, grant to us.

original: tvaṣṭā devebhirjanibhiḥ sajoṣā dyaurdevebhiḥ pṛthivī samudraiḥ
analyzed: tvaṣṭā devebhiḥ janibhiḥ sajoṣāḥ dyauḥ devebhiḥ pṛthivī samudraiḥ
translated: Tvaṣṭar, of one mind with the gods, the kinsmen, heaven, with the gods, the earth, the oceans.

original: uta no 'hirbudhnyaḥ śṛṇotvaja ekapāt pṛthivī samudraḥ
analyzed: uta naḥ hirbudhnyaḥ śṛṇotu ajaḥ eka pād pṛthivī samudraḥ
translated: And may the serpent of the deep, the one-footed, the earth, the ocean listen to us.

original: viśve devā ṛtāvṛdho huvānā stutā mantrāḥ kaviśastā avantu
analyzed: viśve devāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ huvānāḥ stutāḥ mantrāḥ kavi śastāḥ avantu
translated: May all the gods who strengthen truth, when called, may the hymns praised and arranged by the sages help us.

original: evā napāto mama tasya dhībhirbharadvājā abhyarcantyarkaiḥ
analyzed: eva napātaḥ mama tasya dhībhiḥ bharadvājāḥ abhyarcanti arkaiḥ
translated: So the Napatas, the sons of Bharadvaja, with their thoughts and hymns praise him,

original: gnā hutāso vasavo 'dhṛṣṭā viśve stutāso bhūtā yajatrāḥ
analyzed: gnāḥ hutāsaḥ vasavaḥ dhṛṣṭāḥ viśve stutāsaḥ bhūtāḥ yajatrāḥ
translated: The Gnas, the offerers, the Vasus, the unassailable, all the worshipped beings, the worthy of sacrifice,

original: udu tyaccakṣurmahi mitrayorāneti priyaṃ varuṇayoradabdham
analyzed: udu tyad cakṣuḥ mahi mitrayoḥ āneti priyam varuṇayoḥ adabdham
translated: The eye of the two great ones, Mitra and Varuna, rises up, dear, infallible,

original: ṛtasya śuci darśatamanīkaṃ rukmo na diva uditāvyadyaut
analyzed: ṛtasya śuci darśatam anīkam rukmaḥ na divaḥ uditā avyadyaut
translated: The pure face of truth, shining like the gold risen in the sky, shines forth.

original: veda yastrīṇi vidathānyeṣāṃ devānāṃ janma sanutarā ca vipraḥ
analyzed: veda yaḥ trīṇi vidathāni eṣām devānām janma sanutarā ca vipraḥ
translated: He who knows the three gatherings of these gods, and the most ancient birth of the seers,

original: ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyannabhi caṣṭe sūro arya evān
analyzed: ṛju marteṣu vṛjinā ca paśyan abhi caṣṭe sūraḥ aryaḥ evān
translated: Looking straight at mortals and the crooked, the sun observes the noble and the ignoble.

original: stuṣa u vo maha ṛtasya gopānaditiṃ mitraṃ varuṇaṃ sujātān
analyzed: stuṣe u vaḥ mahaḥ ṛtasya gopān aditim mitram varuṇam sujātān
translated: I praise for you the great guardians of truth, Aditi, Mitra, Varuna, the well-born,

original: aryamaṇaṃ bhagamadabdhadhītīnachā voce sadhanyaḥ pāvakān
analyzed: aryamaṇam bhagam adabdha dhītīn achā voce sadhanyaḥ pāvakān
translated: Aryaman, Bhaga, of infallible thought, I call you, the radiant ones, with wealth.

original: riśādasaḥ satpatīnradabdhān maho rājñaḥ suvasanasya dātṝn
analyzed: riśādasaḥ sat patīn ra dabdhān mahaḥ rājñaḥ su vasanasya dātṝn
translated: The Rishis, the lords of truth, the unassailable, the givers of great wealth, the destroyers of enemies,

original: yūnaḥ sukṣatrān kṣayato divo nṝnādityān yāmyaditiṃ duvoyu
analyzed: yūnaḥ su kṣatrān kṣayataḥ divaḥ nṝn ādityān yāmi aditim duvoyu
translated: The young, of good rule, the men of the sky, the Adityas, I approach, O Aditi, for service.

original: dyauṣ pitaḥ pṛthivi mātaradhrugagne bhrātarvasavo mṛḷatā naḥ
analyzed: dyauḥ pitar pṛthivi mātar adruh agne bhrātar vasavaḥ mṛḍata naḥ
translated: O father heaven, O mother earth, be firm, O brother Agni, be gracious to us, O Vasus,

original: viśva ādityā adite sajoṣā asmabhyaṃ śarma bahulaṃ vi yanta
analyzed: viśve ādityāḥ adite sajoṣāḥ asmabhyam śarma bahulam vi yanta
translated: All the Adityas, O Aditi, of one mind, grant us abundant protection.

original: mā no vṛkāya vṛkye samasmā aghāyate rīradhatā yajatrāḥ
analyzed: mā naḥ vṛkāya vṛkye samasmai aghāyate rīradhata yajatrāḥ
translated: Do not deliver us to the wolf, to the she-wolf, to the wicked one, O you who are to be worshipped.

original: yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā rathyo nastanūnāṃ yūyaṃ dakṣasya vacaso babhūva
analyzed: yūyam hi stha rathyaḥ naḥ tanūnām yūyam dakṣasya vacasaḥ babhūva
translated: For you are the charioteers of our bodies, you have become the guardians of our strength.

original: mā va eno anyakṛtaṃ bhujema mā tat karma vasavo yaccayadhve🔽viśvasya hi kṣayatha viśvadevāḥ svayaṃ ripustanvaṃ rīriṣīṣṭa
analyzed: mā vaḥ enaḥ anya kṛtam bhujema mā tat karma vasavaḥ yat cayadhve  viśvasya hi kṣayatha viśva devāḥ svayam ripuḥ tanvam rīriṣīṣṭa
translated: May we not suffer from the sin we have committed, nor from that deed, O Vasus, which ye remember.🔽For ye are the lords of all, O ye all-gods: let him alone be our foe who hateth us.

original: nama idugraṃ nama ā vivāse namo dādhāra pṛthivīmuta dyām
analyzed: namaḥ id ugram namaḥ ā vivāse namaḥ dādhāra pṛthivīm uta dyām
translated: To the fierce one I offer this homage, to the all-pervading one homage; homage supports the earth and the sky.

original: namo devebhyo nama īśa eṣāṃ kṛtaṃ cideno namasāvivāse
analyzed: namaḥ devebhyaḥ namaḥ īśe eṣām kṛtam cit enaḥ namasā āvivāse
translated: Homage to the gods, homage is their lord; even the committed sin I appease with homage.

original: ṛtasya vo rathyaḥ pūtadakṣān ṛtasya pastyasado adabdhān
analyzed: ṛtasya vaḥ rathyaḥ pūta dakṣān ṛtasya pastyasadaḥ adabdhān
translated: The charioteers of holy order, of pure strength, the guardians of holy order's abode, the unshaken,

original: tānā namobhirurucakṣaso nṝn viśvān va ā name maho yajatrāḥ
analyzed: tāna ā namobhiḥ uru cakṣasaḥ nṝn viśvān vaḥ ā name mahaḥ yajatrāḥ
translated: To those men of far-reaching vision I bow with homage, all you great ones who are to be worshipped.

original: te hi śreṣṭhavarcasasta u nastiro viśvāni duritā nayanti
analyzed: te hi śreṣṭha varcasaḥ te u naḥ tiras viśvāni duritā nayanti
translated: For they are of the most excellent glory: they lead us beyond all misfortunes.

original: sukṣatrāso varuṇo mitro agnirṛtadhītayo vakmarājasatyāḥ
analyzed: su kṣatrāsaḥ varuṇaḥ mitraḥ agniḥ ṛta dhītayaḥ vakma rāja satyāḥ
translated: The mighty ones, Varuna, Mitra, Agni, the true laws of holy order, the truthful ones,

original: te na indraḥ pṛthivī kṣāma vardhan pūṣā bhago aditiḥ pañca janāḥ
analyzed: te naḥ indraḥ pṛthivī kṣāma vardhan pūṣā bhagaḥ aditiḥ pañca janāḥ
translated: May Indra, Pusan, Bhaga, Aditi, the five peoples, increasing the wide earth for us,

original: suśarmāṇaḥ svavasaḥ sunīthā bhavantu naḥsutrātrāsaḥ sugopāḥ🔽nū sadmānaṃ divyaṃ naṃśi devā bhāradvājaḥ sumatiṃ yāti hotā
analyzed: su śarmāṇaḥ su avasaḥ su nīthāḥ bhavantu naḥ su trātrāsaḥ su gopāḥ  nu sadmānam divyam naṃśi devāḥ bhāradvājaḥ sumatim yāti hotā
translated: May they be very glorious, self-dependent, and well-protected for us, with good protection and good guardians.🔽May the divine abode of the gods be unharmed, may Bharadvaja's son go as the priest to the place of good will.

original: āsānebhiryajamāno miyedhairdevānāṃ janma vasūyurvavanda
analyzed: āsānebhiḥ yajamānaḥ miyedhaiḥ devānām janma vasūyuḥ vavanda
translated: With these offerings, the sacrificer, seeking wealth, has worshipped the birth of the gods.

original: apa tyaṃ vṛjinaṃ ripuṃ stenamagne durādhyam
analyzed: apa tyam vṛjinam ripum stenam agne durādhyam
translated: O Agni, drive away that wicked foe, that thief, that one who is difficult to subdue.

original: daviṣṭhamasya satpate kṛdhī sugam
analyzed: daviṣṭham asya satpate kṛdhī sugam
translated: Make him the most despised of all, O lord of the people, make him easy to overcome.

original: grāvāṇaḥ soma no hi kaṃ sakhitvanāya vāvaśuḥ
analyzed: grāvāṇaḥ soma naḥ hi kam sakhitvanāya vāvaśuḥ
translated: The pressing-stones, O Soma, have called to us for the sake of friendship.

original: jahī nyatriṇaṃ paṇiṃ vṛko hi ṣaḥ
analyzed: jahi nyatriṇam paṇim vṛkaḥ hi saḥ
translated: Drive away the worthless one, the miser, for he is a wolf.

original: yūyaṃ hi ṣṭhā sudānava indrajyeṣṭhā abhidyavaḥ🔽kartā no adhvannā sugaṃ gopā amā
analyzed: yūyam hi stha sudānavaḥ indra jyeṣṭhāḥ abhidyavaḥ  karta naḥ adhvan ā sugam gopāḥ amā
translated: For you are the givers of good gifts, O Indra's chief supporters, you who are irresistible.🔽Make an easy path for us, O guardians, on the way.

original: api panthāmaganmahi svastigāmanehasam
analyzed: api panthām aganmahi svasti gām anehasam
translated: We have found the path that leads to prosperity,

original: yena viśvāḥ paridviṣo vṛṇakti vindate vasu
analyzed: yena viśvāḥ paridviṣaḥ vṛṇakti vindate vasu
translated: by which one avoids all enemies and obtains wealth.

original: na tad divā na pṛthivyānu manye na yajñena nota śamībhirābhiḥ
analyzed: na tat divā na pṛthivyā anu manye na yajñena na uta śamībhiḥ ābhiḥ
translated: I do not think that is possible by day or by the earth, or by sacrifice or by these conciliatory acts.

original: ubjantu taṃ subhvaḥ parvatāso ni hīyatāmatiyājasya yaṣṭā
analyzed: ubjantu tam su bhvaḥ parvatāsaḥ ni hīyatām atiyājasya yaṣṭā
translated: Let the mighty mountains crush him, let the sacrificer of the one who sacrifices too much be destroyed.

original: ati vā yo maruto manyate no brahma vā yaḥ kriyamāṇaṃ ninitsāt
analyzed: ati vā yaḥ marutaḥ manyate naḥ brahma vā yaḥ kriyamāṇam ninitsāt
translated: Or if anyone thinks of us as Maruts, or if anyone despises the Brahman that is being performed,

original: tapūṃṣi tasmai vṛjināni santu brahmadviṣamabhi taṃ śocatu dyauḥ
analyzed: tapūṃṣi tasmai vṛjināni santu brahma dviṣam abhi tam śocatu dyauḥ
translated: Let there be burning coals for him, let the sky burn against him who hates the Brahman.

original: kimaṅga tvā brahmaṇaḥ soma gopāṃ kimaṅga tvāhurabhiśastipāṃ naḥ
analyzed: kim aṅga tvā brahmaṇaḥ soma gopām kim aṅga tvā āhuḥ abhiśasti pām naḥ
translated: Why do they call you, O Soma, the guardian of the Brahman, why do they call you the protector from imprecations?

original: kimaṅga naḥ paśyasi nidyamānān brahmadviṣe tapuṣiṃ hetimasya🔽avantu māmuṣaso jāyamānā avantu mā sindhavaḥ pinvamānāḥ
analyzed: kim aṅga naḥ paśyasi nidyamānān brahma dviṣe tapuṣim hetim asya  avantu mām uṣasaḥ jāyamānāḥ avantu mā sindhavaḥ pinvamānāḥ
translated: Why do you look on us who are being oppressed? Let the dart of burning coals be for him who hates the Brahman.🔽May the dawns rising, may the swelling rivers, may the firm mountains protect me.

original: avantu mā parvatāso dhruvāso 'vantu mā pitaro devahūtau
analyzed: avantu mā parvatāsaḥ dhruvāsaḥ vantu mā pitaraḥ deva hūtau
translated: May the fathers protect me in the invocation of the gods.

original: viśvadānīṃ sumanasaḥ syāma paśyema nu sūryamuccarantam
analyzed: viśvadānīm su manasaḥ syāma paśyema nu sūryam uccarantam
translated: May we be of good cheer at all times. May we behold the rising sun.

original: tathā karad vasupatirvasūnāṃ devānohāno 'vasāgamiṣṭhaḥ
analyzed: tathā karat vasu patiḥ vasūnām deva anaḥ hānaḥ vasā āgamiṣṭhaḥ
translated: May the lord of treasures do this, the most frequently visited by the gods, through the treasures.

original: indro nediṣṭhamavasāgamiṣṭhaḥ sarasvatī sindhubhiḥ pinvamānā
analyzed: indraḥ nediṣṭham avasā āgamiṣṭhaḥ sarasvatī sindhubhiḥ pinvamānā
translated: May Indra, the most frequently visited through his protection, Sarasvatī swelling with the rivers,

original: parjanyo na oṣadhībhirmayobhuragniḥ suśaṃsaḥ suhavaḥ piteva
analyzed: parjanyaḥ naḥ oṣadhībhiḥ mayobhuḥ agniḥ su śaṃsaḥ su havaḥ pitā iva
translated: Parjanya with the plants, the delightful Agni, well-praised, easily invoked, like a father.

original: viśve devāsa ā gata śṛṇutā ma imaṃ havam
analyzed: viśve devāsaḥ ā gata śṛṇutā me imam havam
translated: Come all ye gods, listen to this my call.

original: edaṃ barhirni ṣīdata
analyzed: ā idam barhiḥ ni sīdata
translated: Sit on this sacred grass.

original: yo vo devā ghṛtasnunā havyena pratibhūṣati
analyzed: yaḥ vaḥ devāḥ ghṛta snunā havyena pratibhūṣati
translated: O ye gods, whomsoever ye favour with sacrificial food mixed with ghee,

original: taṃ viśva upa gachatha
analyzed: tam viśve upa gacchatha
translated: to him come all of you.

original: upa naḥ sūnavo giraḥ śṛṇvantvamṛtasya ye
analyzed: upa naḥ sūnavaḥ giraḥ śṛṇvantu amṛtasya ye
translated: May the sons of the immortal ones listen to our songs and hymns.

original: sumṛḷīkā bhavantu naḥ
analyzed: su mṛḍīkāḥ bhavantu naḥ
translated: Be gracious to us.

original: viśve devā ṛtāvṛdha ṛtubhirhavanaśrutaḥ
analyzed: viśve devāḥ ṛtāvṛdhaḥ ṛtubhiḥ havana śrutaḥ
translated: All ye gods who strengthen truth, who listen to the call with the seasons,

original: juṣantāṃ yujyaṃ payaḥ
analyzed: juṣantām yujyam payaḥ
translated: Enjoy the offering that is ready.

original: stotramindro marudgaṇastvaṣṭṛmān mitro aryamā
analyzed: stotram indraḥ marut gaṇaḥ tvaṣṭṛmān mitraḥ aryamā
translated: May Indra, the Marut host, Tvashtar, Mitra, Aryaman accept our praise.

original: imā havyā juṣanta naḥ
analyzed: imā havyā juṣanta naḥ
translated: May they enjoy these offerings of ours.

original: imaṃ no agne adhvaraṃ hotarvayunaśo yaja
analyzed: imam naḥ agne adhvaram hotar vayunaśas yaja
translated: This our sacrifice, O Agni, O Hotar, offer to the joyous gods,

original: cikitvān daivyaṃ janam
analyzed: cikitvān daivyam janam
translated: Thou who knowest the divine people.

original: viśve devāḥ śṛṇutemaṃ havaṃ me ye antarikṣe ya upa dyavi ṣṭha
analyzed: viśve devāḥ śṛṇuta imam havam me ye antarikṣe yaḥ upa dyavi ṣṭha
translated: May all the gods, the dwellers in the sky and in heaven, hear this my call,

original: ye agnijihvā uta vā yajatrā āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam
analyzed: ye agni jihvāḥ uta vā yajatrāḥ āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayadhvam
translated: Ye who have Agni for your tongue, or who are worthy of sacrifice, sit on this sacred grass and rejoice.

original: viśve devā mama śṛṇvantu yajñiyā ubhe rodasī apāṃ napācca manma
analyzed: viśve devāḥ mama śṛṇvantu yajñiyāḥ ubhe rodasī apām napāt ca manma
translated: May all the gods who are worthy of sacrifice hear me, and the two world-halves, and the waters' son.

original: mā vo vacāṃsi paricakṣyāṇi vocaṃ sumneṣvid vo antamā madema🔽ye ke ca jmā mahino ahimāyā divo jajñire apāṃ sadhasthe
analyzed: mā vaḥ vacāṃsi paricakṣyāṇi vocam sumneṣu id vaḥ antamāḥ madema  ye ke ca jmā mahinaḥ ahi māyāḥ divaḥ jajñire apām sadhasthe
translated: I will speak to you words that are worthy of being repeated. May we rejoice in your favour.🔽Those who are mighty, of great magic power, born in the abode of the waters and in the sky,

original: te asmabhyamiṣaye viśvamāyuḥ kṣapa usrā varivasyantudevāḥ
analyzed: te asmabhyam iṣaye viśvam āyuḥ kṣapaḥ usrāḥ varivasyantu devāḥ
