translated: May the gods grant us all life for enjoyment, and favour us with night and day.

original: agnīparjanyāvavataṃ dhiyaṃ me 'smin have suhavā suṣṭutiṃnaḥ
analyzed: agnīparjanyau avatam dhiyam me smin have su havā suṣṭutiṃnaḥ
translated: O Agni and Parjanya, ye who are easy to invoke, accept our hymn and our praise in this invocation.

original: iḷāmanyo janayad garbhamanyaḥ prajāvatīriṣa ā dhattamasme
analyzed: iḷām anyaḥ janayat garbham anyaḥ prajāvatīḥ iṣaḥ ā dhattam asme
translated: One has generated the embryo, another has given birth to Ilā. Place the fertile ones among us.

original: stīrṇe barhiṣi samidhāne agnau sūktena mahā namasā vivāse
analyzed: stīrṇe barhiṣi samidhāne agnau su uktena mahā namasā vivāse
translated: On the strewn sacred grass, with the kindled fire, with a hymn and great reverence, I invite (you).

original: asmin no adya vidathe yajatrā viśve devā haviṣi mādayadhvam
analyzed: asmin naḥ adya vidathe yajatrāḥ viśve devāḥ haviṣi mādayadhvam
translated: O you who are to be worshipped, all you gods, rejoice today in this our sacrifice.

original: vayamu tvā pathas pate rathaṃ na vājasātaye
analyzed: vayam u tvā pathaḥ pate ratham na vājasātaye
translated: We yoke you, O lord of the path, like a chariot, for the sake of gaining strength,

original: dhiye pūṣannayujmahi
analyzed: dhiye pūṣan ayujmahi
translated: O Pūṣan, for our thought.

original: abhi no naryaṃ vasu vīraṃ prayatadakṣiṇam
analyzed: abhi naḥ naryam vasu vīram prayata dakṣiṇam
translated: Lead to us the man who is to be served, the hero with prepared gifts,

original: vāmaṃ gṛhapatiṃ naya🔽aditsantaṃ cidāghṛṇe pūṣan dānāya codaya
analyzed: vāmam gṛhapatim naya  a ditsantam cit āghṛṇe pūṣan dānāya codaya
translated: the desirable lord of the house.🔽Even the unwilling, O Pūṣan, the miser, urge to give,

original: paṇeścid vimradā manaḥ
analyzed: paṇeḥ cit vimradā manaḥ
translated: the mind of the rich one to give.

original: vi patho vājasātaye cinuhi vi mṛdho jahi
analyzed: vi pathaḥ vājasātaye cinuhi vi mṛdhaḥ jahi
translated: Open the paths for the gaining of strength, destroy the obstacles,

original: sādhantāmugra no dhiyaḥ
analyzed: sādhantām ugra naḥ dhiyaḥ
translated: let the powerful thoughts be successful for us.

original: pari tṛndhi paṇīnāmārayā hṛdayā kave
analyzed: pari tṛndhi paṇīnām ārayā hṛdayā kave
translated: Twist around the hearts of the Pāṇis, O wise one, lead them away,

original: athemasmabhyaṃ randhaya
analyzed: atha imasmabhyam randhaya
translated: then give them to us.

original: vi pūṣannārayā tuda paṇericha hṛdi priyam
analyzed: vi pūṣan ārayā tuda paṇericha hṛdi priyam
translated: Break, O Pūṣan, the hearts of the Pāṇis, seek out the dear one in the heart,

original: atheṃ / / /
analyzed: atha īṃ
translated: then give him to us.

original: ā rikha kikirā kṛṇu paṇīnāṃ hṛdayā kave
analyzed: ā rikha kikirā kṛṇu paṇīnām hṛdayā kave
translated: Make the hearts of the Pāṇis tremble, O wise one,

original: atheṃ / / /
analyzed: atha īṃ
translated: then give him to us.

original: yāṃ pūṣan brahmacodanīmārāṃ bibharṣyāghṛṇe
analyzed: yām pūṣan brahmacodanīm ārām bibharṣi āghṛṇe
translated: The one who urges the prayer, O Pūṣan, the one who is held in your heart, O you who are not to be despised,

original: tayā samasya hṛdayamā rikha kikirā kṛṇu
analyzed: tayā samasya hṛdayam ā rikha kikirā kṛṇu
translated: with that, break, make tremble, the heart of this one.

original: yā te aṣṭrā goopaśāghṛṇe paśusādhanī
analyzed: yā te aṣṭrā goopaśā aghṛṇe paśu sādhanī
translated: That weapon of thine, O Agni, which is called the cattle-killer,

original: tasyāste sumnamīmahe
analyzed: tasyāḥ te sumnam īmahe
translated: For that we pray to thee for bliss.

original: uta no goṣaṇiṃ dhiyamaśvasāṃ vājasāmuta
analyzed: uta naḥ goṣaṇim dhiyam aśva sām vāja sām uta
translated: And for us the cattle-bringing thought, the horse-winning, and the strength-winning,

original: nṛvat kṛṇuhi vītaye
analyzed: nṛvat kṛṇuhi vītaye
translated: Make thou ready for the feast as for a hero.

original: saṃ pūṣan viduṣā naya yo añjasānuśāsati
analyzed: sam pūṣan viduṣā naya yaḥ añjasā anuśāsati
translated: O Pusan, lead us on with the wise one who rules aright,

original: ya evedamiti bravat
analyzed: yaḥ eva idam iti bravat
translated: Who says, This is indeed so.

original: samu pūṣṇā gamemahi yo gṛhānabhiśāsati
analyzed: samu pūṣṇā gamemahi yaḥ gṛhān abhiśāsati
translated: Together with Pusan let us go to him who rules the houses,

original: ima eveti cabravat
analyzed: ime eva iti cabravat
translated: Who says, These are indeed his.

original: pūṣṇaścakraṃ na riṣyati na kośo 'va padyate
analyzed: pūṣṇaḥ cakram na riṣyati na kośaḥ padyate
translated: Pusan's wheel is not destroyed, his quiver is not emptied,

original: no asya vyathate paviḥ
analyzed: na u asya vyathate paviḥ
translated: His bolt is not broken.

original: yo asmai haviṣāvidhan na taṃ pūṣāpi mṛṣyate
analyzed: yaḥ asmai haviṣā avidhat na tam pūṣā api mṛṣyate
translated: He whom one serves with oblation, Pusan does not forgive,

original: prathamo vidate vasu
analyzed: prathamaḥ vidate vasu
translated: The first obtains the treasure.

original: pūṣā gā anvetu naḥ puṣā rakṣatvarvataḥ
analyzed: pūṣā gāḥ anvetu naḥ puṣā rakṣatu arvataḥ
translated: May Pusan follow our cows, may Pusan protect the horse,

original: pūṣā vājaṃ sanotu naḥ
analyzed: pūṣā vājam sanotu naḥ
translated: May Pusan win strength for us.

original: pūṣannanu pra gā ihi yajamānasya sunvataḥ
analyzed: pūṣan anu pra gāḥ ihi yajamānasya sunvataḥ
translated: O Pusan, go forward to the sacrifice of the worshipper who presses (Soma),

original: asmākaṃ stuvatāmuta
analyzed: asmākam stuvatām uta
translated: To us who praise thee.

original: mākirneśan mākīṃ riṣan mākīṃ saṃ śāri kevaṭe
analyzed: mākir neśat mākīm riṣat mākīm sam śāri kevaṭe
translated: Let us not be deprived, let us not be injured, let us not be destroyed in the camp,

original: athāriṣṭābhirā gahi
analyzed: atha ariṣṭābhiḥ ā gahi
translated: Then come to us with the uninjured (cows).🔽To Pusan, the finder, we, to him whose treasures are not lost,

original: śṛṇvantaṃ pūṣaṇaṃ vayamiryamanaṣṭavedasam🔽īśānaṃrāya īmahe
analyzed: śṛṇvantam pūṣaṇam vayamiryam a naṣṭa vedasam  īśānaṃrāye īmahe
translated: To the lord of wealth we pray.

original: pūṣan tava vrate vayaṃ na riṣyema kadā cana
analyzed: pūṣan tava vrate vayam na riṣyema kadā cana
translated: O Pusan, in thy vow may we never be injured,

original: stotārasta iha smasi
analyzed: stotāraḥ te iha smasi
translated: We who are here thy praisers.

original: pari pūṣā parastād dhastaṃ dadhātu dakṣiṇam🔽punarno naṣṭamājatu
analyzed: pari pūṣā parastāt hastam dadhātu dakṣiṇam  punar naḥ naṣṭam ājatu
translated: May Pusan place his right hand over us from the farther side🔽And may he bring back to us what is lost.

original: ehi vāṃ vimuco napādāghṛṇe saṃ sacāvahai
analyzed: ehi vām vimucaḥ napādā aghṛṇe sam sacāvahai
translated: Come, let us meet together, O you who are free from anger, you who have two feet.

original: rathīrṛtasya no bhava
analyzed: rathīḥ ṛtasya naḥ bhava
translated: Be our charioteer in the path of truth.

original: rathītamaṃ kapardinamīśānaṃ rādhaso mahaḥ
analyzed: rathītamam kapardinam īśānam rādhasaḥ mahaḥ
translated: The best charioteer, the curly-haired one, the lord of great wealth,

original: rāyaḥ sakhāyamīmahe
analyzed: rāyaḥ sakhāyam īmahe
translated: We invoke as a friend for prosperity.

original: rāyo dhārāsyāghṛṇe vaso rāśirajāśva
analyzed: rāyaḥ dhārā asya aghṛṇe vasoḥ rāśiḥ aja aśva
translated: O you who are free from anger, the stream of wealth, the treasure, with your swift horses,

original: dhīvatodhīvataḥ sakhā
analyzed: dhīvataḥ dhīvataḥ sakhā
translated: Be a friend to the one who has thought, to the one who has thought well.

original: pūṣaṇaṃ nvajāśvamupa stoṣāma vājinam
analyzed: pūṣaṇam nu aja aśvam upa stoṣāma vājinam
translated: Let us praise the swift-hoofed Pusan, the strong one,

original: svasuryo jāra ucyate
analyzed: svasuḥ yaḥ jāraḥ ucyate
translated: Whose brother is said to be the sun.

original: māturdidhiṣumabravaṃ svasurjāraḥ śṛṇotu naḥ
analyzed: mātuḥ didhiṣum abravam svasuḥ jāraḥ śṛṇotu naḥ
translated: I have spoken to the brother who delights in his mother's lap. May the brother of the sun listen to us.

original: bhrātendrasya sakhā mama
analyzed: bhrātā indrasya sakhā mama
translated: He is the friend of Indra, my friend.

original: ājāsaḥ pūṣaṇaṃ rathe niśṛmbhāste janaśriyam
analyzed: ājāsaḥ pūṣaṇam rathe niśṛmbhāḥ te jana śriyam
translated: The mares, the reins, carry Pusan in the chariot, they who bring him the glory of men.

original: devaṃ vahantu bibhrataḥ
analyzed: devam vahantu bibhrataḥ
translated: May they, bearing him, carry the god.

original: ya enamādideśati karambhāditi pūṣaṇam
analyzed: yaḥ enam ādideśati karambhāt iti pūṣaṇam
translated: He who directs Pusan, saying From the porridge,

original: na tena deva ādiśe
analyzed: na tena devaḥ ādiśe
translated: By that, O god, he should not be directed.

original: uta ghā sa rathītamaḥ sakhyā satpatiryujā
analyzed: uta gha sa rathītamaḥ sakhyā satpatiḥ yujā
translated: And he, the best charioteer, the lord of good friends, yoked,

original: indro vṛtrāṇi jighnate🔽utādaḥ paruṣe gavi sūraścakraṃ hiraṇyayam
analyzed: indraḥ vṛtrāṇi jighnate  uta adaḥ paruṣe gavi sūraḥ cakram hiraṇyayam
translated: Indra slays the Vr̥itras.🔽And the sun, the golden wheel, in the morning,

original: nyairayadrathītamaḥ
analyzed: nyairayat rathītamaḥ
translated: The best charioteer has set it in motion.

original: yadadya tvā puruṣṭuta bravāma dasra mantumaḥ
analyzed: yat adya tvā puruṣṭuta bravāma dasra mantumas
translated: What we now say to you, O you who are praised by many, O you who are most wise,

original: tat su no manma sādhaya
analyzed: tat su naḥ manma sādhaya
translated: Make that prayer of ours good.

original: imaṃ ca no gaveṣaṇaṃ sātaye sīṣadho gaṇam
analyzed: imam ca naḥ gaveṣaṇam sātaye sīṣadhaḥ gaṇam
translated: And this our search for cattle, O Pūṣan, do thou further for our gain.

original: ārāt pūṣannasi śrutaḥ
analyzed: ārāt pūṣan asi śrutaḥ
translated: Thou art near, O Pūṣan, thou art heard.

original: ā te svastimīmaha āreaghāmupāvasum
analyzed: ā te svastim īmahe āreaghām upāvasum
translated: We invoke thy welfare, O Pūṣan, thy protection from misfortune.

original: adyā ca sarvatātaye śvaśca sarvatātaye🔽indrā nu pūṣaṇā vayaṃ sakhyāya svastaye
analyzed: adyā ca sarvatātaye śvas ca sarvatātaye  indrā nu pūṣaṇā vayam sakhyāya svastaye
translated: For all today and for all tomorrow,🔽We invoke Indra and Pūṣan for friendship and well-being,

original: huvema vājasātaye
analyzed: huvema vājasātaye
translated: For the sake of gaining strength.

original: somamanya upāsadat pātave camvoḥ sutam
analyzed: somam anyaḥ upāsadat pātave camvoḥ sutam
translated: One has approached the Soma to drink, the juice pressed out in the bowls,

original: karambhamanya ichati
analyzed: karambham anyaḥ icchati
translated: Another desires the Karambha.

original: ajā anyasya vahnayo harī anyasya sambhṛtā
analyzed: ajāḥ anyasya vahnayaḥ harī anyasya sambhṛtā
translated: The goats are the carriers of one, the two bay horses are harnessed to the other,

original: tābhyāṃ vṛtrāṇi jighnate
analyzed: tābhyām vṛtrāṇi jighnate
translated: By them he slays the Vr̥itras.

original: yadindro anayad rito mahīrapo vṛṣantamaḥ
analyzed: yat indraḥ anayat ritaḥ mahīrapaḥ vṛṣantamaḥ
translated: When Indra, most manly, brought hither the great waters,

original: tatra pūṣābhavat sacā
analyzed: tatra pūṣā abhavat sacā
translated: There Pūṣan was with him.

original: tāṃ pūṣṇaḥ sumatiṃ vayaṃ vṛkṣasya pra vayāmiva
analyzed: tām pūṣṇaḥ sumatim vayam vṛkṣasya pra vayām iva
translated: We invoke that favour of Pūṣan, like the top of a tree,

original: indrasya cā rabhāmahe
analyzed: indrasya ca ā rabhāmahe
translated: And of Indra.

original: ut pūṣaṇaṃ yuvāmahe 'bhīśūnriva sārathiḥ
analyzed: ud pūṣaṇam yuvāmahe bhīśūn iva sārathiḥ
translated: We urge Pūṣan on like a charioteer his horses,

original: mahyā indraṃ svastaye
analyzed: mahyai indram svastaye
translated: For great prosperity, for Indra.

original: śukraṃ te anyad yajataṃ te anyad viṣurūpe ahanī dyaurivāsi
analyzed: śukram te anyat yajatam te anyat viṣurūpe ahanī dyauḥ iva asi
translated: One of thy forms is bright, O Pūṣan, another is to be worshipped. Thou art of various forms, like heaven and earth in a day.

original: viśvā hi māyā avasi svadhāvo bhadrā te pūṣanniharātirastu
analyzed: viśvāḥ hi māyāḥ avasi svadhāvas bhadrā te pūṣan nihara atiḥ astu
translated: For all thy magic powers are self-existent, O Pūṣan. Let thy most auspicious favour be to us.

original: ajāśvaḥ paśupā vājapastyo dhiyaṃjinvo bhuvane viśve arpitaḥ
analyzed: aja aśvaḥ paśu pāḥ vāja pastyaḥ dhiyaṃjinvaḥ bhuvane viśve arpitaḥ
translated: The lord of cattle, the winner of strength, the impeller of thought, is set up in all the worlds.

original: aṣṭrāṃ pūṣā śithirāmudvarīvṛjat saṃcakṣāṇobhuvanā deva īyate
analyzed: aṣṭrām pūṣā śithirām udvarīvṛjat saṃcakṣāṇaḥ bhuvanā devaḥ īyate
translated: Pūṣan hath loosed the firmly-fastened chariot, looking on all the worlds the God is moving.

original: yāste pūṣan nāvo antaḥ samudre hiraṇyayīrantarikṣe caranti
analyzed: yāḥ te pūṣan nāvaḥ antar samudre hiraṇyayīḥ antarikṣe caranti
translated: Those ships of thine, O Pūṣan, which within the sea, golden, move through the air,

original: tābhiryāsi dūtyāṃ sūryasya kāmena kṛta śrava ichamānaḥ
analyzed: tābhiḥ yāsi dūtyām sūryasya kāmena kṛta śravaḥ ichamānaḥ
translated: On them thou goest as a messenger, O thou who art made by the will of Sūrya, seeking glory.

original: pūṣā subandhurdiva ā pṛthivyā iḷas patirmaghavā dasmavarcāḥ
analyzed: pūṣā su bandhuḥ divaḥ ā pṛthivyāḥ iḷaḥ patiḥ maghavā dasma varcāḥ
translated: Pūṣan, the kinsman, is on high from earth, the lord of wealth, the bountiful, of wondrous thought,

original: yaṃ devāso adaduḥ sūryāyai kāmena kṛtaṃ tavasaṃ svañcam
analyzed: yam devāsaḥ adaduḥ sūryāyai kāmena kṛtam tavasam svañcam
translated: Whom the gods have given to Sūrya, the strong, self-moving, made by the will of thee.

original: pra nu vocā suteṣu vāṃ vīryā yāni cakrathuḥ
analyzed: pra nu vocā suteṣu vām vīryā yāni cakrathuḥ
translated: Now will I tell among your pressed (juices) the deeds of prowess which ye have done.

original: hatāso vāṃ pitaro devaśatrava indrāgnī jīvatho yuvam
analyzed: hatāsaḥ vām pitaraḥ deva śatravaḥ indra agnī jīvathaḥ yuvam
translated: Your fathers are slain, the foes of the gods, O Indra and Agni; ye two live.

original: baḷ itthā mahimā vāmindrāgnī paniṣṭha ā
analyzed: baṭ itthā mahimā vām indra agnī paniṣṭhaḥ ā
translated: Even thus, O Indra and Agni, is your greatness most excellent.

original: samāno vāṃ janitā bhrātarā yuvaṃ yamāvihehamātarā🔽okivāṃsā sute sacānaśvā saptī ivādane
analyzed: samānaḥ vām janitā bhrātarā yuvam yamau iha iha mātarā  okivāṃsā sute sacānaśvā saptī iva adane
translated: The same one hath begotten you, O brothers; ye two are twins, here the two mothers.🔽Ye two, O Indra and Agni, have sat down, looking on, at the pressing, as two horses in the stable.

original: indrā nvagnī avaseha vajriṇā vayaṃ devā havāmahe
analyzed: indrā nu agnī avasā iha vajriṇā vayam devā havāmahe
translated: O Indra and Agni, we invoke you, O ye who have the thunderbolt, for help, O ye gods.

original: ya indrāgnī suteṣu vāṃ stavat teṣv ṛtāvṛdhā
analyzed: yaḥ indra agnī suteṣu vām stavat teṣu ṛtāvṛdhā
translated: O Indra and Agni, who among you two, O ye who are to be praised by the pressers,

original: joṣavākaṃ vadataḥ pajrahoṣiṇā na devā bhasathaścana
analyzed: joṣavākam vadataḥ pajrahoṣiṇā na devā bhasathaḥ cana
translated: Will not the gods accept the willing speech of the singer who is devoted to you?

original: indrāgnī ko asya vāṃ devau martaściketati
analyzed: indra agnī kaḥ asya vām devau martaḥ ciketati
translated: Indra and Agni, what mortal knows you two gods?

original: viṣūco aśvān yuyujāna īyata ekaḥ samāna ā rathe
analyzed: viṣūcaḥ aśvān yuyujānaḥ īyate ekaḥ samānaḥ ā rathe
translated: One goes yoking his horses in different directions, the other on the same chariot.

original: indrāgnī apādiyaṃ pūrvāgāt padvatībhyaḥ
analyzed: indra agnī apa āt iyam pūrvā āgāt padvatībhyaḥ
translated: Indra and Agni, this foot has come first from the many-footed ones.

original: hitvī śiro jihvayā vāvadaccarat triṃśat padā nyakramīt
analyzed: hitvī śiraḥ jihvayā vāvadat carat triṃśat padā nyakramīt
translated: The tongue has licked the head and moved on, it has stepped on the thirty steps.

original: indrāgnī ā hi tanvate naro dhanvāni bāhvoḥ
analyzed: indra agnī ā hi tanvate naraḥ dhanvāni bāhvoḥ
translated: Indra and Agni, men stretch out the bows in their arms.

original: mā no asmin mahādhane parā varktaṃ gaviṣṭiṣu
analyzed: mā naḥ asmin mahādhane parā varktam gaviṣṭiṣu
translated: Do not forsake us in this great contest, in the battles for cattle.

original: indrāgnī tapanti māghā aryo arātayaḥ
analyzed: indra agnī tapanti mā aghāḥ aryaḥ arātayaḥ
translated: Indra and Agni, the wicked, the enemies, the evil spirits torment me.

original: apa dveṣāṃsyā kṛtaṃ yuyutaṃ sūryādadhi
analyzed: apa dveṣāṃsyā kṛtam yuyutam sūryāt adhi
translated: You have driven away the hostilities from above the sun.

original: indrāgnī yuvorapi vasu divyāni pārthivā
analyzed: indra agnī yuvoḥ api vasu divyāni pārthivā
translated: Indra and Agni, to you belong the treasures, the heavenly and the earthly.

original: ā na iha prayachataṃ rayiṃ viśvāyupoṣasam
analyzed: ā naḥ iha prayacchatam rayim viśvāyu poṣasam
translated: Bestow on us here wealth for all life.

original: indrāgnī ukthavāhasā stomebhirhavanaśrutā
analyzed: indra agnī uktha vāhasā stomebhiḥ havana śrutā
translated: Indra and Agni, who carry the hymns, who are to be invoked with the praises,

original: viśvābhirgīrbhirā gatamasya somasya pītaye
analyzed: viśvābhiḥ gīrbhiḥ ā gatam asya somasya pītaye
translated: Come with all the songs to drink this Soma.

original: śnathad vṛtramuta sanoti vājamindrā yo agnī sahurī saparyāt
analyzed: śnathat vṛtram uta sanoti vājam indrā yaḥ agnī sahurī saparyāt
translated: He who worships Indra and Agni, the strong ones, shatters Vrtra and obtains strength.

original: irajyantā vasavyasya bhūreḥ sahastamā sahasā vājayantā
analyzed: irajyantā vasavyasya bhūreḥ sahastamā sahasā vājayantā
translated: Ruling over the abundance of wealth, most powerful, bestowing strength,

original: tā yodhiṣṭamabhi gā indra nūnamapaḥ svaruṣaso agna ūḷhaḥ
analyzed: tā yodhiṣṭam abhi gāḥ indra nūnam apaḥ svar uṣasaḥ agne ūḍhaḥ
translated: Fight for the cattle, O Indra, now. O Agni, the waters, the dawns, the light.

original: diśaḥ svaruṣasa indra citrā apo gā agne yuvase niyutvān🔽ā vṛtrahaṇā vṛtrahabhiḥ śuṣmairindra yātaṃ namobhiragne arvāk
analyzed: diśaḥ svaruṣasaḥ indra citrāḥ apaḥ gāḥ agne yuvase niyutvān  ā vṛtra haṇā vṛtra habhiḥ śuṣmaiḥ indra yātam namobhiḥ agne arvāk
translated: The quarters, O Indra, the dawns, the wondrous waters, the cows, O Agni, thou winnest with thy team🔽Come, O Indra, with the Vrtra-killing powers, with the Vrtra-killing forces, with the salutations, O Agni, come hither

original: yuvaṃ rādhobhirakavebhirindrāgne asme bhavatamuttamebhiḥ
analyzed: yuvam rādhobhiḥ akavebhiḥ indra agne asme bhavatam uttamebhiḥ
translated: Be ye, O Indra and Agni, with the most excellent gifts, with the gifts that need not be sought, with us

original: tā huve yayoridaṃ papne viśvaṃ purā kṛtam
analyzed: tā huve yayoḥ idam papne viśvam purā kṛtam
translated: I invoke those two by whom this all was made firm in the beginning

original: indrāgnī namardhataḥ
analyzed: indra agnī namardhataḥ
translated: To Indra and Agni, the repressors

original: ugrā vighaninā mṛdha indrāgnī havāmahe
analyzed: ugrā vighaninā mṛdhaḥ indra agnī havāmahe
translated: The terrible repressors of the foe, Indra and Agni we invoke

original: tā no mṛḷāta īdṛśe🔽hato vṛtrāṇyāryā hato dāsāni satpatī
analyzed: tā naḥ mṛḷātaḥ īdṛśe  hataḥ vṛtrāṇi āryā hataḥ dāsāni sat patī
translated: May they be gracious to such as we are🔽Slayers of Vr̥itras, slayers of the Dasyus, slayers of all who hate devotion, Indra and Agni

original: hato viśvā apa dviṣaḥ
analyzed: hataḥ viśvāḥ apa dviṣaḥ
translated: Slayers of all who hate devotion

original: indrāgnī yuvāmime 'bhi stomā anūṣata
analyzed: indra agnī yuvām ime bhiḥ stomāḥ anūṣata
translated: To you, Indra and Agni, these praises have been sung

original: pibataṃ śambhuvā sutam🔽yā vāṃ santi puruspṛho niyuto dāśuṣe narā
analyzed: pibatam śambhuvā sutam  yāḥ vām santi puruspṛhaḥ niyutaḥ dāśuṣe narā
translated: Drink ye the gladdening juice that is pressed🔽Those teams of yours, O ye Heroes, which are much desired by the worshipper, O Indra and Agni

original: indrāgnī tābhirā gatam
analyzed: indra agnī tābhiḥ ā gatam
translated: With those come hither

original: tābhirā gachataṃ naropedaṃ savanaṃ sutam
analyzed: tābhiḥ ā gacchatam narā upa idam savanam sutam
translated: With those come hither, O Heroes, to this libation that is pressed

original: indrāgnī somapītaye
analyzed: indra agnī soma pītaye
translated: O Indra and Agni, to drink the Soma

original: tamīḷiṣva yo arciṣā vanā viśvā pariṣvajat
analyzed: tam īḍiṣva yaḥ arciṣā vanā viśvā pariṣvajat
translated: Worship him who with his flame encircles all the woods

original: kṛṣṇākṛṇoti jihvayā
analyzed: kṛṣṇā ākṛṇoti jihvayā
translated: And with his tongue makes them black

original: ya iddha āvivāsati sumnamindrasya martyaḥ
analyzed: yaḥ iddhe āvivāsati sumnam indrasya martyaḥ
translated: He who kindles the fire and attends on it, the mortal who seeks the favour of Indra

original: dyumnāya sutarā apaḥ
analyzed: dyumnāya su tarāḥ apaḥ
translated: For glory, for the sake of the waters

original: tā no vājavatīriṣa āśūn pipṛtamarvataḥ
analyzed: tāḥ naḥ vājavatīḥ iṣaḥ āśūn pipṛtamarvataḥ
translated: O ye two, grant us swift steeds and food rich in nourishment.

original: indramagniṃ ca voḷhave🔽ubhā vāmindrāgnī āhuvadhyā ubhā rādhasaḥ saha mādayadhyai
analyzed: indram agnim ca voḷhave  ubhā vām indra agnī āhuvadhyai ubhā rādhasaḥ saha mādayadhyai
translated: Indra and Agni, for the contest.🔽Both of you, O Indra and Agni, are to be invoked; both of you are to rejoice together in the offerings.

original: ubhā dātārāviṣāṃ rayīṇāmubhā vājasya sātaye huve vām
analyzed: ubhā dātārā iṣām rayīṇām ubhā vājasya sātaye huve vām
translated: Both of you are givers of food and wealth; both of you I invoke for the winning of strength.

original: ā no gavyebhiraśvyairvasavyairupa gachatam🔽sakhāyau devau sakhyāya śambhuvendrāgnī tā havāmahe
analyzed: ā naḥ gavyebhiḥ aśvyaiḥ vasavyaiḥ upa gacchatam  sakhāyau devau sakhyāya śambhuvā indra agnī tā havāmahe
translated: Come to us with your possessions in cattle, horses, and wealth,🔽O Indra and Agni, O ye two friends, for the sake of auspicious friendship. We invoke you, O Indra and Agni.

original: indrāgnī śṛṇutaṃ havaṃ yajamānasya sunvataḥ
analyzed: indra agnī śṛṇutam havam yajamānasya sunvataḥ
translated: O Indra and Agni, listen to the call of the sacrificer who presses out the Soma.

original: vītaṃ havyānyā gataṃ pibataṃ somyaṃ madhu
analyzed: vītam havyānyā gatam pibatam somyam madhu
translated: Accept the oblations and drink the Soma-nectar.

original: iyamadadād rabhasam ṛṇacyutaṃ divodāsaṃ vadhryaśvāya dāśuṣe
analyzed: iyam adadāt rabhasam ṛṇa cyutam divodāsam vadhryaśvāya dāśuṣe
translated: She has given strength to Divodasa, the debtor, to Vadhryashva, the worshipper.

original: yā śaśvantamācakhādāvasaṃ paṇiṃ tā te dātrāṇi taviṣā sarasvati
analyzed: yā śaśvantam ācakhāda avasam paṇim tā te dātrāṇi taviṣā sarasvati
translated: She who has always devoured the miserly Prani, O Sarasvati, those are your mighty gifts.

original: iyaṃ śuṣmebhirbisakhā ivārujat sānu girīṇāṃ taviṣebhirūrmibhiḥ🔽pārāvataghnīmavase suvṛktibhiḥ sarasvatīmā vivāsema dhītibhiḥ
analyzed: iyam śuṣmebhiḥ bisakhā iva arujat sānu girīṇām taviṣebhiḥ ūrmibhiḥ  pārāvata ghnīm avase suvṛktibhiḥ sarasvatīm ā vivāsema dhītibhiḥ
translated: She, with the powers of the mountains, has shaken with her waves, like a friend with her limbs.🔽With good hymns, let us serve Sarasvati, the destroyer of the Pāravata, for the sake of help, with our thoughts.

original: sarasvati devanido ni barhaya prajāṃ viśvasya bṛsayasya māyinaḥ
analyzed: sarasvati deva nidaḥ ni barhaya prajām viśvasya bṛsayasya māyinaḥ
translated: O Sarasvati, destroy the enemies of the gods, the offspring of the wicked magician of the universe.

original: uta kṣitibhyo 'vanīravindo viṣamebhyo asravo vājinīvati
analyzed: uta kṣitibhyaḥ vanīra vindaḥ viṣamebhyaḥ asravaḥ vājinīvati
translated: And from the earths, O finder of the house, the uneven, the flowing, the rich in strength

original: pra ṇo devī sarasvatī vājebhirvājinīvatī
analyzed: pra naḥ devī sarasvatī vājebhiḥ vājinīvatī
translated: Do thou, O goddess Sarasvatî, with our treasures, O thou rich in treasures,

original: dhīnāmavitryavatu
analyzed: dhīnām avitrī avatu
translated: Do thou, O thou who art to be invoked, protect our thoughts.

original: yastvā devi sarasvatyupabrūte dhane hite
analyzed: yaḥ tvā devi sarasvati upabrūte dhane hite
translated: He who, O goddess Sarasvatî, invokes thee when wealth is at stake,

original: indraṃ na vṛtratūrye
analyzed: indram na vṛtratūrye
translated: Like Indra in the battle with Vritra.

original: tvaṃ devi sarasvatyavā vājeṣu vājini
analyzed: tvam devi sarasvati avāḥ vājeṣu vājini
translated: Thou, O goddess Sarasvatî, art to be invoked in contests for booty, O thou rich in booty,

original: radā pūṣeva naḥsanim
analyzed: rada pūṣā iva naḥsanim
translated: Give us gain like Pûshan.

original: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī ghorā hiraṇyavartaniḥ
analyzed: uta syā naḥ sarasvatī ghorā hiraṇya vartaniḥ
translated: And may Sarasvatî be terrible to us, having a golden path,

original: vṛtraghnī vaṣṭi suṣṭutim
analyzed: vṛtra ghnī vaṣṭi suṣṭutim
translated: The slayer of Vritra, accept our praise.

original: yasyā ananto ahrutastveṣaścariṣṇurarṇavaḥ
analyzed: yasyāḥ anantaḥ ahrutaḥ tveṣaḥ cariṣṇuḥ arṇavaḥ
translated: Whose endless, unerring, flashing, moving flood,

original: amaścarati roruvat
analyzed: amaḥ carati roruvat
translated: The terrible one, moves on roaring.

original: sā no viśvā ati dviṣaḥ svasṝranyā ṛtāvarī
analyzed: sā naḥ viśvāḥ ati dviṣaḥ svasṝḥ anyā ṛtāvarī
translated: May she, the most truthful of all our sisters, carry us over all enmities,

original: atannaheva sūryaḥ🔽uta naḥ priyā priyāsu saptasvasā sujuṣṭā
analyzed: a tanna hā iva sūryaḥ  uta naḥ priyā priyāsu sapta svasā su juṣṭā
translated: Like the sun, with a thousand rays.🔽And may Sarasvatî, the seven-sistered, much-loved one, be dear to us among the dear ones,

original: sarasvatī stomyā bhūt
analyzed: sarasvatī stomyā bhūt
translated: To be praised by us.

original: āpapruṣī pārthivānyuru rajo antarikṣam
analyzed: āpapruṣī pārthivāni uru rajaḥ antarikṣam
translated: The rain-showering one, the wide region, the wide atmosphere,

original: sarasvatī nidas pātu
analyzed: sarasvatī nidaḥ pātu
translated: May Sarasvatî protect the floods.

original: triṣadhasthā saptadhātuḥ pañca jātā vardhayantī
analyzed: triṣadhasthā sapta dhātuḥ pañca jātā vardhayantī
translated: She who is in three places, who has seven constituents, who is born fivefold, who increases,

original: vājevāje havyā bhūt
analyzed: vājevāje havyā bhūt
translated: Is to be invoked in every contest.

original: pra yā mahimnā mahināsu cekite dyumnebhiranyā apasāmapastamā
analyzed: pra yā mahimnā mahināsu cekite dyumnebhiḥ anyāḥ apasām apastamā
translated: She who is marked by greatness among the great, by glories more glorious than the most glorious,

original: ratha iva bṛhatī vibhvane kṛtopastutyā cikituṣā sarasvatī🔽sarasvatyabhi no neṣi vasyo māpa spharīḥ payasā mā na ādhak
analyzed: rathaḥ iva bṛhatī vibhvane kṛtā upastutyā cikituṣā sarasvatī  sarasvati abhi naḥ neṣi vasyaḥ mā apa spharīḥ payasā mā naḥ ādhak
translated: Like a chariot, made for the all-pervading one, with the praise of Sarasvatī, the discerning one🔽O Sarasvatī, lead us to what is good, do not leave us in want, do not deprive us of milk

original: juṣasva naḥ sakhyā veśyā ca mā tvat kṣetrāṇyaraṇāni ganma🔽stuṣe narā divo asya prasantāśvinā huve jaramāṇo arkaiḥ
analyzed: juṣasva naḥ sakhyā veśyā ca mā tvat kṣetrāṇi araṇāni ganma  stuṣe narā divaḥ asya prasantā aśvinā huve jaramāṇaḥ arkaiḥ
translated: Be pleased with us in our dwelling as friends, may we not go from your fields to the deserts🔽I praise you, O men, I call upon you, O Aśvins, with my glowing hymns, O you who rejoice in this heaven

original: yā sadya usrā vyuṣi jmo antān yuyūṣataḥ paryurūvarāṃsi
analyzed: yā sadyas usrā vyuṣi jmaḥ antān yuyūṣataḥ paryurū varāṃsi
translated: You who in one day, in the night, traverse the ends of the earth, and the near and distant places

original: tā yajñamā śucibhiścakramāṇā rathasya bhānuṃ rurucūrajobhiḥ
analyzed: tāḥ yajñamā śucibhiḥ cakramāṇāḥ rathasya bhānum rurucuḥ rajobhiḥ
translated: You who go to the sacrifice with your pure ones, and shine with the light of the chariot with your rays

original: purū varāṃsyamitā mimānāpo dhanvānyati yātho ajrān
analyzed: purū varāṃsi amitā mimānā apaḥ dhanvāni ati yāthaḥ ajrān
translated: You who measure out many unmeasured boons, and go over the waters and the deserts

original: tā ha tyad vartiryadaradhramugretthā dhiya ūhathuḥ śaśvadaśvaiḥ🔽manojavebhiriṣiraiḥ śayadhyai pari vyathirdāśuṣo martyasya🔽tā navyaso jaramāṇasya manmopa bhūṣato yuyujānasaptī
analyzed: tā ha tyad vartiḥ yat aradhram ugrā itthā dhiyaḥ ūhathuḥ śaśvat aśvaiḥ  manaḥ javebhiḥ iṣiraiḥ śayadhyai pari vyathiḥ dāśuṣaḥ martyasya  tā navyasaḥ jaramāṇasya manma upa bhūṣataḥ yuyujāna saptī
translated: That is your way, O you who are swift in anger, in that you always carry your thoughts with your swift horses🔽In order to rest with your mind-swift, powerful ones, you go around the distress of the mortal worshipper🔽Those two, O you who are new and old, come to the thought of the one who is purified

original: śubhaṃ pṛkṣamiṣamūrjaṃ vahantā hotā yakṣat pratno adhrug yuvānā
analyzed: śubham pṛkṣam iṣam ūrjam vahantā hotā yakṣat pratnaḥ adruh yuvānā
translated: Bringing good food, nourishment, and strength, may the ancient, unerring, youthful one worship

original: tā valgū dasrā puruśākatamā pratnā navyasā vacasā vivāse
analyzed: tā valgū dasrā puruśākatamā pratnā navyasā vacasā vivāse
translated: Those two beautiful, wondrous ones, most powerful, the ancient ones, I invite with a new hymn

original: yā śaṃsate stuvate śambhaviṣṭhā babhūvaturgṛṇate citrarātī
analyzed: yā śaṃsate stuvate śambhaviṣṭhā babhūvatuḥ gṛṇate citra rātī
translated: Most auspicious to him who praises and extols you, be ye to the singer, O ye of wondrous bounty.

original: tā bhujyuṃ vibhiradbhyaḥ samudrāt tugrasya sūnumūhathūrajobhiḥ
analyzed: tā bhujyum vibhiradbhyaḥ samudrāt tugrasya sūnum ūhathuḥ rajobhiḥ
translated: Ye bore Bhujyu across the waters, across the sea, the son of Tugra, with your rapid-moving (chariots).

original: areṇubhiryojanebhirbhujantā patatribhirarṇasonirupasthāt🔽vi jayuṣā rathyā yātamadriṃ śrutaṃ havaṃ vṛṣaṇā vadhrimatyāḥ
analyzed: areṇubhiḥ yojanebhiḥ bhujantā patatribhiḥ arṇasā niḥ upasthāt  vi jayuṣā rathyā yātam adrim śrutam havam vṛṣaṇā vadhrimatyāḥ
translated: With dustless, yoked, flying (chariots), the swift one came from the water.🔽Ye came to the stone with the victorious chariot, O ye mighty ones, to the call of the lame one.

original: daśasyantā śayave pipyathurgāmiti cyavānā sumatiṃ bhuraṇyū
analyzed: daśasyantā śayave pipyathuḥ gām iti cyavānā sumatim bhuraṇyū
translated: Favouring Śayu, ye filled the cow with milk, ye two who are ever moving, bountiful.

original: yad rodasī pradivo asti bhūmā heḷo devānāmuta martyatrā
analyzed: yat rodasī pradivaḥ asti bhūmā heḍaḥ devānām uta martyatrā
translated: What space there is between heaven and earth, between the sky and the earth, the abode of the gods and of mortals,

original: tadādityā vasavo rudriyāso rakṣoyuje tapuraghaṃ dadhāta
analyzed: tat ādityāḥ vasavaḥ rudriyāsaḥ rakṣaḥ yuje tapuḥ agham dadhāta
translated: There, O Ādityas, ye Vasus, ye Rudras, place the thunderbolt for him who is joined with the Rakṣas.

original: ya īṃ rājānāv ṛtuthā vidadhad rajaso mitro varuṇaściketat
analyzed: yaḥ īm rājānau ṛtuthā vidadhat rajasaḥ mitraḥ varuṇaḥ ciketat
translated: The king who, as king, shall duly distribute, shall know Mitra and Varuṇa, the two rulers.

original: gambhīrāya rakṣase hetimasya droghāya cid vacasa ānavāya
analyzed: gambhīrāya rakṣase hetimasya droghāya cit vacase ānavāya
translated: For the deep-reaching Rakṣas, for the deceitful word, for the contemptible one,

original: antaraiścakraistanayāya vartirdyumatā yātaṃ nṛvatā rathena
analyzed: antaraiḥ cakraiḥ tanayāya vartiḥ dyumatā yātam nṛvatā rathena
translated: With wheels that go within, with a radiant chariot, with a chariot that goes to the young one, to the child,

original: sanutyena tyajasā martyasya vanuṣyatāmapi śīrṣāvavṛktam
analyzed: sa nutyena tyajasā martyasya vanuṣyatām api śīrṣa avavṛktam
translated: With the eternal, with the abandoning of the mortal, with the abandoning of the human, ye have crushed the head.

original: ā paramābhiruta madhyamābhirniyudbhiryātamavamābhirarvāk
analyzed: ā paramābhiḥ uta madhyamābhiḥ niyudbhiḥ yātam avamābhiḥ arvāk
translated: Come with the highest, with the midmost, with the lowest yokings, come with the lowest yokings.

original: dṛḷhasya cid gomato vi vrajasya duro vartaṃ gṛṇate citrarātī🔽kva tyā valgū puruhūtādya dūto na stomo 'vidan namasvān
analyzed: dṛḷhasya cit gomataḥ vi vrajasya duraḥ vartam gṛṇate citra rātī  kva tyā valgū puru hūtā adya dūtaḥ na stomaḥ vidat namasvān
translated: Of the firm, the rich in cattle, the moving house, the door is opened for the singer, O ye of wondrous deeds🔽Where is that swift messenger, O ye invoked of many, today? The praise hath not found him, nor the humble prayer

original: ā yo arvāṃ nāsatyā vavarta preṣṭhā hyasatho asya manman
analyzed: ā yaḥ arvān nāsatyā vavarta preṣṭhā hi asathaḥ asya manman
translated: He who hath turned hither, O Nâsatyas, for he esteems you most, hath sent his thought

original: araṃ me gantaṃ havanāyāsmai gṛṇānā yathā pibātho andhaḥ
analyzed: aram me gantam havanāya asmai gṛṇānā yathā pibāthaḥ andhaḥ
translated: Come easily to this invocation of mine, that ye may drink the offered juice, while I sing praise

original: pari ha tyad vartiryātho riṣo na yat paro nāntarastuturyāt
analyzed: pari ha tyad vartiḥ yāthaḥ riṣaḥ na yat paras na antara stuturyāt
translated: Ye have passed by that trouble, that ye may not be praised either from near or from afar

original: akāri vāmandhaso varīmannastāri barhiḥ suprāyaṇatamam🔽uttānahasto yuvayurvavandā vāṃ nakṣanto adraya āñjan
analyzed: akāri vām andhasaḥ varīman astāri barhiḥ suprāyaṇatamam  uttāna hastaḥ yuvayuḥ vavanda vām nakṣantaḥ adrayaḥ āñjan
translated: Ye have done this, ye have bestowed this boon, ye have made the grass the easiest way of access🔽With uplifted hands, with the pair of you, I have worshipped, anointing you, O ye of the stones, with oil

original: ūrdhvo vāmagniradhvareṣvasthāt pra rātireti jūrṇinīghṛtācī
analyzed: ūrdhvaḥ vām agniḥ adhvareṣu asthāt pra rātiḥ eti jūrṇinī ghṛtācī
translated: Upward hath stood your Agni in the sacrifices, your gift goeth forth, the well-oiled, the well-fed

original: pra hotā gūrtamanā urāṇo 'yukta yo nāsatyā havīman
analyzed: pra hotā gūrta manāḥ urāṇaḥ yukta yaḥ nāsatyā havīman
translated: The priest, of lofty mind, hath yoked you, O Nâsatyas, in the invocation, the flyer

original: adhi śriye duhitā sūryasya rathaṃ tasthau purubhujā śatotim
analyzed: adhi śriye duhitā sūryasya ratham tasthau puru bhujā śata ūtim
translated: For glory, the daughter of Sûrya hath mounted the chariot, the much-extended, the hundred-aided

original: pra māyābhirmāyinā bhūtamatra narā nṛtū janiman yajñiyānām
analyzed: pra māyābhiḥ māyinā bhūtam atra narā nṛtū janiman yajñiyānām
translated: Ye two, O Nâsatyas, by your powers, by your powers, have become the two most wonderful in the birth of the holy ones

original: yuvaṃ śrībhirdarśatābhirābhiḥ śubhe puṣṭimūhathuḥsūryāyāḥ
analyzed: yuvam śrībhiḥ darśatābhiḥ ābhiḥ śubhe puṣṭim ūhathuḥ sūryāyāḥ
translated: With your most radiant glories ye have gained the most splendid prosperity for Sûryâ

original: pra vāṃ vayo vapuṣe 'nu paptan nakṣad vāṇī suṣṭutā dhiṣṇyā vām🔽ā vāṃ vayo 'śvāso vahiṣṭhā abhi prayo nāsatyā vahantu
analyzed: pra vām vayaḥ vapuṣe nu paptan nakṣat vāṇī suṣṭutā dhiṣṇyā vām  ā vām vayaḥ śvāsaḥ vahiṣṭhāḥ abhi prayaḥ nāsatyā vahantu
translated: Your bird has flown away to the body, the well-praised speech has settled in your two hearths.🔽May your best horses, O Nāsatyas, carry you to the place of sacrifice, your bird.

original: pra vāṃ ratho manojavā asarjīṣaḥ pṛkṣa iṣidho anu pūrvīḥ
analyzed: pra vām rathaḥ manaḥ javāḥ asarji iṣaḥ pṛkṣaḥ iṣidhaḥ anu pūrvīḥ
translated: Your chariot, swift as thought, has come forth, with food, with fuel, following the early dawns.

original: puru hi vāṃ purubhujā deṣṇaṃ dhenuṃ na iṣaṃ pinvatamasakrām
analyzed: puru hi vām puru bhujā deṣṇam dhenum naḥ iṣam pinvatam asakrām
translated: For you have much to give, O you who have much to give, you have filled the cow with food, with milk.

original: stutaśca vāṃ mādhvī suṣṭutiśca rasāśca ye vāmanu rātimagman
analyzed: stutaḥ ca vām mādhvī suṣṭutiḥ ca rasāḥ ca ye vām anu rātim agman
translated: And your praise, O you who love the praise, and the juices that have come to the offering, and the good praise.

original: uta ma ṛjre purayasya raghvī sumīḷhe śataṃ peruke ca pakvā
analyzed: uta me ṛjre purayasya raghvī sumīḷhe śatam peruke ca pakvā
translated: And to the poor man, O you who have many goods, a hundred fat cows and ten fat bulls.

original: śāṇḍo dād dhiraṇinaḥ smaddiṣṭīn daśa vaśāso abhiṣāca ṛṣvān
analyzed: śāṇḍaḥ dāt hiraṇinaḥ smaddiṣṭīn daśa vaśāsaḥ abhiṣācaḥ ṛṣvān
translated: Śāṇḍa gave the golden ones, the ones who are to be pointed out, ten strong bulls, the tall ones.

original: saṃ vāṃ śatā nāsatyā sahasrāśvānāṃ purupanthā gire dāt
analyzed: sam vām śatā nāsatyā sahasrā aśvānām purupanthāḥ gire dāt
translated: To you, O Nāsatyas, the mountain gave a hundred thousand horses, O you who go to many men.

original: bharadvājāya vīra nū gire dād dhatā rakṣāṃsi purudaṃsasā syuḥ
analyzed: bharadvājāya vīra nu gire dāt hatā rakṣāṃsi puru daṃsasā syuḥ
translated: To the hero Bharadvāja the mountain gave, may the very bountiful ones destroy the Rākṣasas.

original: ā vāṃ sumne variman sūribhiḥ ṣyām🔽udu śriya uṣaso rocamānā asthurapāṃ normayo ruśantaḥ
analyzed: ā vām sumne variman sūribhiḥ syām  udu śriyaḥ uṣasaḥ rocamānāḥ asthuḥ apām na ūrmayaḥ ruśantaḥ
translated: With the nobles I will be in your favour, in your wide room.🔽The shining dawns have risen, the shining waves of the waters.

original: kṛṇoti viśvā supathā sugānyabhūdu vasvī dakṣiṇāmaghonī
analyzed: kṛṇoti viśvā su pathā sugāni abhūt u vasvī dakṣiṇā maghonī
translated: She makes all the good paths, the easy paths, she has become the one who gives wealth, the one who gives gifts to the right.

original: bhadrā dadṛkṣa urviyā vi bhāsyut te śocirbhānavo dyāmapaptan
analyzed: bhadrā dadṛkṣe urviyā vi bhāsi ud te śociḥ bhānavaḥ dyām apaptan
translated: The auspicious one shines far and wide, thy flames of light have fallen down upon the sky

original: āvirvakṣaḥ kṛṇuṣe śumbhamānoṣo devi rocamānāmahobhiḥ🔽vahanti sīmaruṇāso ruśanto gāvaḥ subhagāmurviyā prathānām🔽apejate śūro asteva śatrūn bādhate tamo ajiro navoḷhā
analyzed: āvis vakṣaḥ kṛṇuṣe śumbhamānā uṣaḥ devi rocamānā mahobhiḥ  vahanti sīm aruṇāsaḥ ruśantaḥ gāvaḥ subhagām urviyā prathānām  apejate śūraḥ astā iva śatrūn bādhate tamaḥ ajiraḥ na voḷhā
translated: Thou fillest thy breast, adorning thee, O Dawn, with light, O Goddess, through the days🔽The ruddy ones bear thee, shining, the prosperous one, through the wide expanse, the famous one🔽The hero goes forth, like a warrior, to the foes, the swift one repels the dark ones, the new ones

original: sugota te supathā parvateṣvavāte apastarasi svabhāno
analyzed: sugā uta te supathā parvateṣu avāte apastarasi sva bhāno
translated: O thou of good birth, thou of good paths, thou passest over the mountains, the waters, O thou of fair light

original: sā na ā vaha pṛthuyāmannṛṣve rayiṃ divo duhitariṣayadhyai
analyzed: sā naḥ ā vaha pṛthu yāman ṛṣve rayim divaḥ duhitar iṣayadhyai
translated: Bring thou to us, O thou of wide sway, O thou of the sky, O daughter, wealth to be desired

original: sā vaha yokṣabhiravātoṣo varaṃ vahasi joṣamanu
analyzed: sā vaha yā ukṣabhiḥ avātā uṣaḥ varam vahasi joṣam anu
translated: Bring that, O Dawn, with thy yoking teams; thou bearest the boon in accordance with thy will

original: tvaṃ divo duhitaryā ha devī pūrvahūtau maṃhanā darśatā bhūḥ
analyzed: tvam divaḥ duhitaryā ha devī pūrva hūtau maṃhanā darśatā bhūḥ
translated: Thou, O Goddess, art the daughter of the sky, O thou who art to be worshipped first, art to be adored with honour, art to be seen

original: ut te vayaś / / /
analyzed: ud te vayaḥ
translated: Let thy strength...

original: eṣā syā no duhitā divojāḥ kṣitīruchantī mānuṣīrajīgaḥ🔽yā bhānunā ruśatā rāmyāsvajñāyi tirastamasaścidaktūn
analyzed: eṣā syā naḥ duhitā divaḥ jāḥ kṣitīḥ uchantī mānuṣīḥ ajīgaḥ  yā bhānunā ruśatā rāmyāsu ajñāyi tiras tamasaḥ cit aktūn
translated: This daughter of thine, O sky, born of the earth, hath come to us, the human ones, to be worshipped🔽She who with her ruddy light hath been known in the bright dwellings, beyond even the rays of the sun

original: vi tad yayuraruṇayugbhiraśvaiścitraṃ bhāntyuṣasaścandrarathāḥ
analyzed: vi tat yayuḥ aruṇayugbhiḥ aśvaiḥ citram bhānti uṣasaḥ candra rathāḥ
translated: The dawns, with their ruddy-yoked horses, shine forth in wondrous ways, with their chariots of light

original: agraṃ yajñasya bṛhato nayantīrvi tā bādhantetama ūrmyāyāḥ
analyzed: agram yajñasya bṛhataḥ nayantīḥ vi tāḥ bādhanta itamaḥ ūrmyāyāḥ
translated: Leading the foremost part of the great sacrifice, they repel the darkness of the deep

original: śravo vājamiṣamūrjaṃ vahantīrni dāśuṣa uṣaso martyāya
analyzed: śravaḥ vājam iṣam ūrjam vahantīḥ ni dāśuṣe uṣasaḥ martyāya
translated: Bringing glory, strength, food, and vigour, O Ushas, to the mortal man who offers you

original: maghonīrvīravat patyamānā avo dhāta vidhate ratnamadya🔽idā hi vo vidhate ratnamastīdā vīrāya dāśuṣa uṣāsaḥ
analyzed: maghonīḥ vīravat patyamānāḥ avaḥ dhāta vidhate ratnam adya  idā hi vaḥ vidhate ratnam asti idā vīrāya dāśuṣe uṣāsaḥ
translated: Magnificent, shining with heroic power, grant to the worshipper wealth this day🔽For this is your wealth, O Ushas, for the worshipper, this for the mortal man who offers you

original: idā viprāya jarate yadukthā ni ṣma māvate vahatha pura cit
analyzed: idā viprāya jarate yat ukthā ni sma māvate vahatha pura cit
translated: This for the sage who sings your praises, bring even now the food for the man who has hymns

original: idā hi ta uṣo adrisāno gotrā gavāmangiraso gṛṇanti🔽vyarkeṇa bibhidurbrahmaṇā ca satyā nṛṇāmabhavad devahūtiḥ
analyzed: idā hi te uṣaḥ adri sāno gotrā gavām angirasaḥ gṛṇanti  vyarkeṇa bibhiduḥ brahmaṇā ca satyāḥ nṛṇām abhavat deva hūtiḥ
translated: For these, O Ushas, the sons of Aditi, the Angirases, the singers, praise🔽With the sun they have cleft the rock asunder, and by prayer the call of men hath been made effectual to the gods

original: uchā divo duhitaḥ pratnavan no bharadvājavad vidhate maghoni
analyzed: ucha divaḥ duhitaḥ pratna vat naḥ bharadvājavat vidhate maghoni
translated: Rise up, O daughter of the sky, as of old, O bountiful one, for the worshipper, as for the son of Bharadvaja

original: suvīraṃ rayiṃ gṛṇate rirīhyurugāyamadhi dhehi śravo naḥ
analyzed: su vīram rayim gṛṇate rirīhi uru gāyam adhi dhehi śravaḥ naḥ
translated: Inspire with heroes the wealth of the singer, bestow on us high fame, O thou of wide dominion

original: vapurnu taccikituṣe cidastu samānaṃ nāma dhenu patyamānam
analyzed: vapuḥ nu tat cikituṣe cit astu samānam nāma dhenu patyamānam
translated: Let that be a form even for the seeker to behold, the common name of the two milch-kine that are to be praised

original: marteṣvanyad dohase pīpāya sakṛcchukraṃ duduhe pṛśnirūdhaḥ
analyzed: marteṣu anyat dohase pīpāya sakṛt śukram duduhe pṛśni rūdhaḥ
translated: One hath flowed forth among mortals to be milked for the milking, the bright one hath once shed forth its milk

original: ye agnayo na śośucannidhānā dviryat trirmaruto vāvṛdhanta
analyzed: ye agnayaḥ na śośucan nidhānāḥ dvis yat tris marutaḥ vāvṛdhanta
translated: Those fires that are not to be extinguished, wherewith the Maruts have twice or thrice increased themselves

original: areñavo hiraṇyayāsa eṣāṃ sākaṃ nṛmṇaiḥ pauṃsyebhiśca bhūvan
analyzed: areñavaḥ hiraṇyayāsaḥ eṣām sākam nṛmṇaiḥ pauṃsyebhiḥ ca bhūvan
translated: These, with their manly powers and their virility, have become like men, like those who toil with gold

original: rudrasya ye mīḷhuṣaḥ santi putrā yāṃśco nu dādhṛvirbharadhyai
analyzed: rudrasya ye mīḍhuṣaḥ santi putrāḥ yān ca u nu dādhṛviḥ bharadhyai
translated: Those who are Rudra's sons, the rain-bestowing ones, whom he supports and nourishes,

original: vide hi mātā maho mahī ṣā set pṛśniḥ subhve garbhamādhāt
analyzed: vide hi mātā mahaḥ mahī sā sā id pṛśniḥ su bhve garbham ādhāt
translated: For the mother knows the great and mighty one, the dappled one has laid the embryo in the strong one.

original: na ya iṣante januṣo 'yā nvantaḥ santo 'vadyāni punānāḥ
analyzed: na ye iṣante januṣaḥ yāḥ nu antaḥ santaḥ vadyāni punānāḥ
translated: They who, born from the womb, are not inclined to sin, but purify themselves,

original: niryad duhre śucayo 'nu joṣamanu śriyā tanvamukṣamāṇāḥ
analyzed: niḥ yat duhre śucayaḥ nu joṣam anu śriyā tanvam ukṣamāṇāḥ
translated: When the pure ones have been milked according to his will, anointing their body with glory,

original: makṣū na yeṣu dohase cidayā ā nāma dhṛṣṇu mārutandadhānāḥ
analyzed: makṣū na yeṣu dohase cidayāḥ ā nāma dhṛṣṇu mārutandadhānāḥ
translated: They who, even for the sake of milking, do not bear the name of the swift Maruts,

original: na ye staunā ayāso mahnā nū cit sudānurava vāsadugrān🔽ta idugrāḥ śavasā dhṛṣṇuṣeṇā ubhe yujanta rodasī sumeke
analyzed: na ye staunāḥ ayāsaḥ mahnā nu cit sudānuḥ ava vāsadugrān  te id ugrāḥ śavasā dhṛṣṇuṣeṇāḥ ubhe yujanta rodasī sumeke
translated: They who praise with toil, with greatness, with good gifts, never the fierce ones,🔽They, the fierce ones, with strength and courage, yoke both worlds, well-formed,

original: adha smaiṣu rodasī svaśocirāmavatsu tasthau na rokaḥ
analyzed: adha sma eṣu rodasī sva śocirā amavatsu tasthau na rokaḥ
translated: Then in these two worlds, with their own radiance, he stands, like a post, in the lowing ones.

original: aneno vo maruto yāmo astvanaśvaścid yamajatyarathīḥ
analyzed: an enaḥ vaḥ marutaḥ yāmaḥ astu an aśvaḥ cit yama jati a rathīḥ
translated: Let this be your way, O Maruts, even the one who is without a horse, without a swift chariot,

original: anavaso anabhīśū rajastūrvi rodasī pathyā yāti sādhan
analyzed: an avasaḥ an abhīśuḥ rajastu urvi rodasī pathyāḥ yāti sādhan
translated: Without a good chariot, without reins, crossing the path, going to the two worlds, accomplishing it.

original: nāsya vartā na tarutā nvasti maruto yamavatha vajasātau
analyzed: na asya vartā na tarutā nu asti marutaḥ yamavatha vajasātau
translated: He has no turning back, no failure, O Maruts, whom you help in the battle for booty,

original: toke vā goṣu tanaye yamapsu sa vrajaṃ dartā pārye adha dyoḥ
analyzed: toke vā goṣu tanaye yam apsu sa vrajam dartā pārye adha dyoḥ
translated: In the birth of cattle, in the offspring, in the waters, he breaks through the stable at the end of the day.

original: pra citramarkaṃ gṛṇate turāya mārutāya svatavase bharadhvam🔽ye sahāṃsi sahasā sahante rejate agne pṛthivī makhebhyaḥ
analyzed: pra citram arkam gṛṇate turāya mārutāya svatavase bharadhvam  ye sahāṃsi sahasā sahante rejate agne pṛthivī makhebhyaḥ
translated: Bring the wondrous hymn to the strong one who sings, to the Marut company, to him of noble nature🔽Who with might conquer mighty ones, O Agni, the earth trembles for the sacrifices

original: tviṣīmanto adhvarasyeva didyut tṛṣucyavaso juhvo nāgneḥ
analyzed: tviṣīmantaḥ adhvarasya iva didyut tṛṣucyavasaḥ juhvaḥ nā agneḥ
translated: Sparkling like the lightning of a sacrifice, the ladles of Trishi Chyavana, like those of Agni

original: arcatrayo dhunayo na vīrā bhrājajjanmāno maruto adhṛṣṭāḥ
analyzed: arcatrayaḥ dhunayaḥ na vīrāḥ bhrājat janmānaḥ marutaḥ adhṛṣṭāḥ
translated: The Architraves, the Dhunas, like heroes, the Maruts, of resplendent birth, invincible

original: taṃ vṛdhantaṃ mārutaṃ bhrājadṛṣṭiṃ rudrasya sūnuṃ havasā vivāse
analyzed: tam vṛdhantam mārutam bhrājat ṛṣṭim rudrasya sūnum havasā vivāse
translated: I invoke with adoration that Marut who waxes strong, whose look is resplendent, Rudra's son

original: divaḥ śardhāya śucayo manīṣā girayo nāpa ugrā aspṛdhran
analyzed: divaḥ śardhāya śucayaḥ manīṣāḥ girayaḥ na apaḥ ugrāḥ aspṛdhran
translated: The pure thoughts for the host of heaven, the terrible ones, have contended like mountains

original: viśveṣāṃ vaḥ satāṃ jyeṣṭhatamā gīrbhirmitrāvaruṇāvāvṛdhadhyai
analyzed: viśveṣām vaḥ satām jyeṣṭhatamāḥ gīrbhiḥ mitrāvaruṇau āvṛdhadhyai
translated: Of you all who are, most exalted by our songs, I honour with praises Mitra and Varuna

original: saṃ yā raśmeva yamaturyamiṣṭhā dvā janānasamā bāhubhiḥ svaiḥ🔽iyaṃ mad vāṃ pra stṛṇīte manīṣopa priyā namasā barhiracha🔽yantaṃ no mitrāvaruṇāvadhṛṣṭaṃ chardiryad vāṃ varūthyaṃ sudānū
analyzed: sam yā raśmā iva yama turyamiṣṭhā dvā janāna samā bāhubhiḥ svaiḥ  iyam mat vām pra stṛṇīte manīṣā upa priyā namasā  yantam naḥ mitrāvaruṇau adhṛṣṭam chardiḥ yat vām varūthyam sudānū
translated: Who, like two yoked reins, have measured out the two worlds with their own arms🔽This my thought spreads out for you two, O Mitra and Varuna, I strew the dear sacred grass with adoration🔽Come to us, O Mitra and Varuna, the invincible, the refuge which you are, O bountiful ones

original: ā yātaṃ mitrāvaruṇā suśastyupa priyā namasā hūyamānā
analyzed: ā yātam mitrāvaruṇā su śasti upa priyā namasā hūyamānā
translated: Come, O Mitra and Varuna, to the fair praise, invoked with dear adoration

original: saṃ yāvapnaḥ stho apaseva janāñchrudhīyataścid yatatho mahitvā🔽aśvā na yā vājinā pūtabandhū ṛtā yad garbhamaditirbharadhyai
analyzed: sam yā avapnaḥ sthaḥ apasā iva janān śrudhīyataḥ cit yatathaḥ mahitvā  aśvā na yā vājinā pūta bandhū ṛtā yat garbham aditiḥ bharadhyai
translated: Ye are the two averters, repelling men, even the most famous by your greatness🔽Like two well-harnessed horses, when Aditi bears the germ for the sake of strength,

original: pra yā mahi mahāntā jāyamānā ghorā martāyaripave ni dīdhaḥ
analyzed: pra yā mahi mahāntā jāyamānā ghorā martāya ripave ni dīdhaḥ
translated: When the great one, the mighty one, is born, terrible to the mortal foe, to be looked at,

original: viśve yad vāṃ maṃhanā mandamānāḥ kṣatraṃ devāso adadhuḥ sajoṣāḥ🔽pari yad bhūtho rodasī cidurvī santi spaśo adabdhāso amūrāḥ🔽tā hi kṣatraṃ dhārayethe anu dyūn dṛṃhethe sānumupamādiva dyoḥ🔽dṛḷho nakṣatra uta viśvadevo bhūmimātān dyāṃ dhāsināyoḥ🔽tā vigraṃ dhaithe jaṭharaṃ pṛṇadhyā ā yat sadma sabhṛtayaḥ pṛṇanti
analyzed: viśve yat vām maṃhanā mandamānāḥ kṣatram devāsaḥ adadhuḥ sajoṣāḥ  pari yat bhūthaḥ rodasī cit urvī santi spaśaḥ adabdhāsaḥ amūrāḥ  tā hi kṣatram dhārayethe anu dyūn dṛṃhethe sānum upamāt iva dyoḥ  dṛḷhaḥ nakṣatraḥ uta viśva devaḥ bhūmi mātā dyām dhāsinā ayoḥ  tā vigram dhaithe jaṭharam pṛṇadhyai ā yat sadma sabhṛtayaḥ pṛṇanti
translated: When the gods, all of one mind, rejoicing in your bounty, have established your sway,

original: na mṛṣyante yuvatayo 'vātā vi yat payo viśvajinvā bharante🔽tā jihvayā sadamedaṃ sumedhā ā yad vāṃ satyo aratirṛte bhūt🔽tad vāṃ mahitvaṃ ghṛtānnāvastu yuvaṃ dāśuṣevi cayiṣṭamaṃhaḥ
analyzed: na mṛṣyante yuvatayaḥ vātāḥ vi yat payaḥ viśvajinvāḥ bharante 🔽tā jihvayā sadamā idam sumedhāḥ ā yat vām satyaḥ aratiḥ ṛte bhūt 🔽tat vām mahitvam ghṛtān nā avastu yuvam dāśuṣe ivi
translated: When ye have encompassed the two wide worlds, the unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring, unerring,

original: pra yad vāṃ mitrāvaruṇā spūrdhan priyā dhāma yuvadhitā minanti
analyzed: pra yat vām mitrāvaruṇā spūrdhan priyā dhāma yuvadhitā minanti
translated: When, O Mitra-Varuṇa, they who strive against you, who seek your dear abode, offend against you,

original: na ye devāsa ohasā na martā ayajñasāco apyo naputrāḥ
analyzed: na ye devāsaḥ ohasā na martāḥ ayajñasācaḥ apyaḥ na putrāḥ
translated: Those who are neither gods by worship nor men, who are not sons of the waters, who are not worshippers,

original: vi yad vācaṃ kīstāso bharante śaṃsanti ke cin nivido manānāḥ🔽ād vāṃ bravāma satyānyukthā nakirdevebhiryatatho mahitvā
analyzed: vi yat vācam kīstāsaḥ bharante śaṃsanti ke cit nividaḥ manānāḥ  āt vām bravāma satyāni ukthā nakir devebhiḥ yatathaḥ mahitvā
translated: When the priests bring forth your speech, some proclaim their grudges, being angry with the enemies,🔽We will speak to you of true praises, for none is equal to you in greatness among the gods.

original: avoritthā vāṃ chardiṣo abhiṣṭau yuvormitrāvaruṇāvaskṛdhoyu🔽anu yad gāva sphurān ṛjipyaṃ dhṛṣṇuṃ yad raṇevṛṣaṇaṃ yunajan
analyzed: avoḥ itthā vām chardiṣaḥ abhiṣṭau yuvoḥ mitrāvaruṇa avaskṛdhoyu  anu yat gāvaḥ sphurān ṛjipyam dhṛṣṇum yat raṇevṛṣaṇam yunajan
translated: We have come to you, O Mitra-Varuṇa, to the two most bountiful, to the two most ready to help,🔽When they yoke the swift horse to the chariot, the strong horse to the battle, the bull to the plough,

original: śruṣṭī vāṃ yajña udyataḥ sajoṣā manuṣvad vṛktabarhiṣo yajadhyai
analyzed: śruṣṭī vām yajñaḥ udyataḥ sajoṣāḥ manuṣvat vṛkta barhiṣaḥ yajadhyai
translated: We will worship you, O Indra-Varuṇa, who are ready to hear, of one mind, who are to be worshipped by men who have strewn the sacred grass,

original: ā ya indrāvaruṇāviṣe adya mahe sumnāya maha āvavartat
analyzed: ā yaḥ indrāvaruṇā aviṣe adya mahe sumnāya mahaḥ āvavartat
translated: To you, O Indra-Varuṇa, who have turned to us today for great bliss, for great favour,

original: tā hi śreṣṭhā devatātā tujā śūrāṇāṃ śaviṣṭhātā hi bhūtam
analyzed: tā hi śreṣṭhā devatātā tujā śūrāṇām śaviṣṭhā atā hi bhūtam
translated: For you are the best of the gods, the strongest of the strong, you are the existent,

original: maghonāṃ maṃhiṣṭhā tuviśuṣma ṛtena vṛtraturā sarvasenā
analyzed: maghonām maṃhiṣṭhā tuvi śuṣmaḥ ṛtena vṛtra turā sarva senā
translated: The most bountiful of the bountiful, the most impetuous, the most powerful by law, the conqueror of Vṛtra, the leader of all armies,

original: tā gṛṇīhi namasyebhiḥ śūṣaiḥ sumnebhirindrāvaruṇā cakānā
analyzed: tā gṛṇīhi namasyebhiḥ śūṣaiḥ sumnebhiḥ indrāvaruṇā cakānā
translated: Praise them with these your most venerable praises, O Indra-Varuṇa, shining with your favours.

original: vajreṇānyaḥ śavasā hanti vṛtraṃ siṣaktyanyo vṛjaneṣu vipraḥ
analyzed: vajreṇa anyaḥ śavasā hanti vṛtram siṣakti anyaḥ vṛjaneṣu vipraḥ
translated: One with the thunderbolt slays Vṛtra with might, another the sage is active in battles.

original: gnāśca yan naraśca vāvṛdhanta viśve devāso narāṃ svagūrtāḥ🔽praibhya indrāvaruṇā mahitvā dyauśca pṛthivi bhūtamurvī
analyzed: gnāḥ ca yat naraḥ ca vāvṛdhanta viśve devāsaḥ narām sva gūrtāḥ  pra ebhyaḥ indrāvaruṇāḥ mahitvā dyauḥ ca pṛthivi bhūtam urvī
translated: When the people and the divine ones were waxing great, all the gods, self-praised, of the people.🔽Through these two, O Indra and Varuṇa, through your greatness, heaven and earth have become the wide expanse.

original: sa it sudānuḥ svavān ṛtāvendrā yo vāṃ varuṇa dāśatitman
analyzed: saḥ id sudānuḥ svavān ṛtāvā indrā yaḥ vām varuṇa dāśatitman
translated: He, the bountiful one, the prosperous one, O Indra and Varuṇa, who serves you with his whole being,

original: iṣā sa dviṣastared dāsvān vaṃsad rayiṃ rayivataśca janān
analyzed: iṣā sa dviṣaḥ taret dāsvān vaṃsat rayim rayivataḥ ca janān
translated: may he, the generous one, overcome his enemies with food, and may he increase his wealth and the people who have wealth.

original: yaṃ yuvaṃ dāśvadhvarāya devā rayiṃ dhattho vasumantaṃ purukṣum🔽asme sa indrāvaruṇāvapi ṣyāt pra yo bhanakti vanuṣāmaśastīḥ
analyzed: yam yuvam dāśu adhvarāya devā rayim dhatthaḥ vasumantam purukṣum  asme saḥ indrāvaruṇau api syāt pra yaḥ bhanakti vanuṣām aśastīḥ
translated: The wealth which you, O gods, bestow upon the worshipper, rich in goods and abundant in food,🔽may that, O Indra and Varuṇa, be with us, he who breaks the hostilities of the enemies.

original: uta naḥ sutrātro devagopāḥ sūribhya indrāvaruṇā rayiḥ ṣyāt
analyzed: uta naḥ su trātraḥ deva gopāḥ sūribhyaḥ indrāvaruṇā rayiḥ syāt
translated: And may wealth be with the princes, O you who protect well, O you who are guarded by the gods, O Indra and Varuṇa,

original: yeṣāṃ śuṣmaḥ pṛtanāsu sāhvān pra sadyo dyumnātirate taturiḥ
analyzed: yeṣām śuṣmaḥ pṛtanāsu sāhvān pra sadyas dyumnā atirate taturiḥ
translated: whose strength, victorious in battles, is immediate, whose glory is abundant and swift.

original: nū na indrāvaruṇā gṛṇānā pṛṅktaṃ rayiṃ sauśravasāya devā
analyzed: nu naḥ indrāvaruṇā gṛṇānā pṛṅktam rayim sauśravasāya devā
translated: Now, O Indra and Varuṇa, when we are singing, fill us with wealth for fame, O gods.

original: itthā gṛṇanto mahinasya śardho 'po na nāvā duritātarema
analyzed: itthā gṛṇantaḥ mahinasya śardho paḥ na nāvā duritā atarema
translated: Thus singing the host of the mighty one, may we cross over the difficulties like ships on water.

original: pra samrāje bṛhate manma nu priyamarca devāya varuṇāya saprathaḥ
analyzed: pra samrāje bṛhate manma nu priyam arca devāya varuṇāya saprathaḥ
translated: To the great king, to the dear thought, to the god Varuṇa, offer the hymn of wide extent.

original: ayaṃ ya urvī mahinā mahivrataḥ kratvā vibhātyajaro na śociṣā
analyzed: ayam yaḥ urvī mahinā mahi vrataḥ kratvā vibhāti ajaraḥ na śociṣā
translated: He who is vast, great in majesty, great in holy power, shines with wisdom, undecaying with his radiance.

original: indrāvaruṇā sutapāvimaṃ sutaṃ somaṃ pibataṃ madyaṃ dhṛtavratā
analyzed: indrāvaruṇā suta pau imam sutam somam pibatam madyam dhṛtavratā
translated: O Indra and Varuṇa, you who press the juice well, drink this pressed Soma, the intoxicating one, you who are firm in your vow.

original: yuvo ratho adhvaraṃ devavītaye prati svasaramupa yāti pītaye
analyzed: yuvoḥ rathaḥ adhvaram deva vītaye prati svasaram upa yāti pītaye
translated: Your chariot, O gods, goes to the sacrifice to drink the naturally flowing (Soma).

original: indrāvaruṇā madhumattamasya vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām
analyzed: indrāvaruṇāḥ madhumattamasya vṛṣṇaḥ somasya vṛṣaṇā vṛṣethām
translated: O Indra and Varuṇa, you who are bulls, enjoy the most sweet intoxicating Soma, O bulls.

original: idaṃ vāmandhaḥ pariṣiktamasme āsadyāsmin barhiṣi mādayethām
analyzed: idam vām andhaḥ pariṣiktam asme āsadya asmin barhiṣi mādayethām
translated: This Soma is sprinkled for you here with us. Having sat down on this sacrificial grass, rejoice.

original: saṃ vāṃ karmaṇā samiṣā hinomīndrāviṣṇū apasas pareasya
analyzed: sam vām karmaṇā sam iṣā hinomi indrāviṣṇū apasaḥ pareasya
translated: With this rite I yoke you together, O Indra and Viṣṇu, with food, O you who have the best forms.

original: juṣethāṃ yajñaṃ draviṇaṃ ca dhattamariṣṭairnaḥ pathibhiḥ pārayantā
analyzed: juṣethām yajñam draviṇam ca dhattam ariṣṭaiḥ naḥ pathibhiḥ pārayantā
translated: Accept this sacrifice and grant wealth, leading us by safe paths.

original: yā viśvāsāṃ janitarā matīnāmindrāviṣṇū kalaśā somadhānā
analyzed: yā viśvāsām janitarā matīnām indrāviṣṇū kalaśā soma dhānā
translated: You who are the most frequent begetters of all thoughts, O Indra and Viṣṇu, you who have Soma-filled goblets,

original: pra vāṃ giraḥ śasyamānā avantu pra stomāso gīyamānāso arkaiḥ
analyzed: pra vām giraḥ śasyamānāḥ avantu pra stomāsaḥ gīyamānāsaḥ arkaiḥ
translated: May your praises when being sung help us, and your hymns when being chanted with the Ṛc verses.

original: indrāviṣṇū madapatī madānāmā somaṃ yātaṃ draviṇo dadhānā
analyzed: indrāviṣṇū mada patī madā nāmā somam yātam draviṇaḥ dadhānā
translated: O Indra and Viṣṇu, you who are the lords of intoxication, come to the Soma, bestowing wealth.

original: saṃ vāmañjantvaktubhirmatīnāṃ saṃ stomāsaḥ śasyamānāsa ukthaiḥ
analyzed: sam vām añjantu aktubhiḥ matīnām sam stomāsaḥ śasyamānāsaḥ ukthaiḥ
translated: Let your thoughts be united with the songs, let the hymns that are being praised be united with the praises

original: ā vāmaśvāso abhimātiṣāha indrāviṣṇū sadhamādo vahantu
analyzed: ā vāmaśvāsaḥ abhimātiṣāhaḥ indrāviṣṇū sadhamādaḥ vahantu
translated: Let the horses that conquer hostility bring you, Indra and Vishnu, to the feast

original: juṣethāṃ viśvā havanā matīnāmupa brahmāṇi śṛṇutaṃ giro me
analyzed: juṣethām viśvā havanā matīnām upa brahmāṇi śṛṇutam giraḥ me
translated: Accept all the invocations of the thoughts, listen to my prayers and songs

original: indrāviṣṇū tat panayāyyaṃ vāṃ somasya mada uru cakramāthe
analyzed: indrāviṣṇū tat panayāyyam vām somasya made uru cakramāthe
translated: O Indra and Vishnu, that is worthy of you, you have made the Soma's joy wide-reaching

original: akṛṇutamantarikṣaṃ varīyo 'prathataṃ jīvase no rajāṃsi
analyzed: akṛṇutam antarikṣam varīyaḥ prathatam jīvase naḥ rajāṃsi
translated: You have made the atmosphere wider, you have extended the realms for our life

original: indrāviṣṇū haviṣā vāvṛdhānāgrādvānā namasā rātahavyā
analyzed: indrāviṣṇū haviṣā vāvṛdhānā agrādvānā namasā rāta havyā
translated: O Indra and Vishnu, growing through the offering, accepting worship, first to eat the food

original: ghṛtāsutī draviṇaṃ dhattamasme samudraḥ sthaḥ kalaśaḥ somadhānaḥ
analyzed: ghṛta āsutī draviṇam dhattam asme samudraḥ sthaḥ kalaśaḥ soma dhānaḥ
translated: Bestow wealth on us, O you whose paths are full of ghee, you are the ocean, the pot, the Soma-holder

original: indrāviṣṇū pibataṃ madhvo asya somasya dasrā jaṭharaṃ pṛṇethām
analyzed: indrāviṣṇū pibatam madhvaḥ asya somasya dasrā jaṭharam pṛṇethām
translated: O Indra and Vishnu, drink of this sweet Soma, O wondrous ones, fill your bellies

original: ā vāmandhāṃsi madirāṇyagmannupa brahmāṇi śṛṇutaṃ havaṃ me
analyzed: ā vām andhāṃsi madirāṇi agman upa brahmāṇi śṛṇutam havam me
translated: The intoxicating juices have come to you, listen to the prayers, hear my call

original: ubhā jigyathurna parā jayethe na parā jigye kataraścanainoḥ
analyzed: ubhā jigyathuḥ na parā jayethe na parā jigye kataraḥ cana enoḥ
translated: You have both conquered, none has conquered you, none has conquered either of you in battle

original: indraśca viṣṇo yadapaspṛdhethāṃ tredhā sahasraṃ vi tadairayethām
analyzed: indraḥ ca viṣṇo yat apaspṛdhethām tredhā sahasram vi tat airayethām
translated: O Indra and Vishnu, when you contended, you divided the thousand into three parts

original: ghṛtavatī bhuvanānāmabhiśriyorvī pṛthvī madhudughe supeśasā
analyzed: ghṛtavatī bhuvanānām abhiśriyā urvī pṛthvī madhu dughe supeśasā
translated: Rich in ghee, the two worlds' most excellent abodes, the broad earth, the milker of sweet milk, well-formed,

original: dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇasya dharmaṇā viṣkabhite ajarebhūriretasā
analyzed: dyāvāpṛthivī varuṇasya dharmaṇā viṣkabhite ajare bhūri retasā
translated: The heaven and earth, by Varuna's law, the two unaging ones, the two with abundant seed, are stretched apart.

original: asaścantī bhūridhāre payasvatī ghṛtaṃ duhāte sukṛte śucivrate
analyzed: a saścantī bhūri dhāre payasvatī ghṛtam duhāte sukṛte śuci vrate
translated: The two inexhaustible ones, the two with abundant streams, the two rich in milk, the two that yield ghee, the two of pure vows, for the one who acts well,

original: rājantī asya bhuvanasya rodasī asme retaḥ siñcataṃyan manurhitam
analyzed: rājantī asya bhuvanasya rodasī asme retaḥ siñcataṃyat manuḥ hitam
translated: The two worlds of this creation shine forth. Pour into us the seed that is beneficial to Manu.

original: yo vām ṛjave kramaṇāya rodasī marto dadāśa dhiṣaṇe sa sādhati
analyzed: yaḥ vām ṛjave kramaṇāya rodasī martaḥ dadāśa dhiṣaṇe sa sādhati
translated: The mortal who, for your straight course, O heaven and earth, gives to you, O two mighty ones, he prospers.

original: pra prajābhirjāyate dharmaṇas pari yuvoḥ siktā viṣurūpāṇi savratā
analyzed: pra prajābhiḥ jāyate dharmaṇaḥ pari yuvoḥ siktā viṣurūpāṇi savratā
translated: He is born again and again through offspring, around the law. The various forms, of you two, are sprinkled, of the same vow.

original: ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī abhīvṛte ghṛtaśriyā ghṛtapṛcā ghṛtāvṛdhā
analyzed: ghṛtena dyāvāpṛthivī abhīvṛte ghṛta śriyā ghṛta pṛcā ghṛtāvṛdhā
translated: With ghee, O heaven and earth, covered above, with the glory of ghee, with ghee as your messenger, with ghee as your growth,

original: urvī pṛthvī hotṛvūrye purohite te id viprā īḷate sumnamiṣṭaye
analyzed: urvī pṛthvī hotṛ vūrye purohite te id viprāḥ īḍate sumnam iṣṭaye
translated: The two broad ones, the two priests, the two who are to be worshipped, the two sages, they are invoked for the sake of desired bliss.

original: madhu no dyāvāpṛthivī mimikṣatāṃ madhuścutā madhudughe madhuvrate
analyzed: madhu naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī mimikṣatām madhuścutā madhu dughe madhu vrate
translated: Let heaven and earth mix for us the sweet, the two that flow with sweetness, the two that yield sweet milk, the two of sweet vows,

original: dadhāne yajñaṃ draviṇaṃ ca devatā mahi śravo vājamasme suvīryam
analyzed: dadhāne yajñam draviṇam ca devatā mahi śravaḥ vājam asme su vīryam
translated: The two that establish the sacrifice and wealth and the gods, great fame and strength and good heroism for us.

original: ūrjaṃ no dyauśca pṛthivī ca pinvatāṃ pitā mātā viśvavidā sudaṃsasā
analyzed: ūrjam naḥ dyauḥ ca pṛthivī ca pinvatām pitā mātā viśva vidā su daṃsasā
translated: Let heaven and earth swell for us with nourishment, the father and mother, the two who know all, the two who are very lovely,

original: saṃrarāṇe rodasī viśvaśambhuvā saniṃ vājaṃ rayimasme saminvatām
analyzed: saṃrarāṇe rodasī viśva śambhuvā sanim vājam rayim asme saminvatām
translated: may he who fills both worlds with all-bounteous gifts vouchsafe us strength and booty and heroic might

original: udu ṣya devaḥ savitā hiraṇyayā bāhū ayaṃsta savanāyasukratuḥ
analyzed: udu sya devaḥ savitā hiraṇyayā bāhū ayaṃsta savanāya su kratuḥ
translated: the god savitar hath lifted up his arms of gold the very wise one to the banquet of the gods

original: ghṛtena pāṇī abhi pruṣṇute makho yuvā sudakṣo rajaso vidharmaṇi
analyzed: ghṛtena pāṇī abhi pruṣṇute makhaḥ yuvā su dakṣaḥ rajasaḥ vidharmaṇi
translated: the sacrifice with oil bedews his hands the young the very strong in the worlds ordinance

original: devasya vayaṃ savituḥ savīmani śreṣṭhe syāma vasunaścadāvane
analyzed: devasya vayam savituḥ savīmani śreṣṭhe syāma vasu naścadāvane
translated: in the impulse of the god savitar may we be foremost in the bestowal of wealth and in the giving of treasure

original: yo viśvasya dvipado yaścatuṣpado niveśane prasave cāsi bhūmanaḥ🔽adabdhebhiḥ savitaḥ pāyubhiṣ ṭvaṃ śivebhiradya pari pāhi no gayam
analyzed: yaḥ viśvasya dvipadaḥ yaḥ catuṣpadaḥ niveśane prasave ca asi bhūmanaḥ  adabdhebhiḥ savitar pāyubhiḥ tvam śivebhiḥ adya pari pāhi naḥ gayam
translated: thou who art in the dwelling and in the birth of all that hath four feet and all that hath two feet on earth🔽with undeceivable guards savitar today with propitious guards guard thou our dwelling

original: hiraṇyajihvaḥ suvitāya navyase rakṣā mākirnoaghaśaṃsa īśata🔽udu ṣya devaḥ savitā damūnā hiraṇyapāṇiḥ pratidoṣamasthāt
analyzed: hiraṇya jihvaḥ suvitāya navyase rakṣa mākir naḥ agha śaṃsaḥ īśata  udu sya devaḥ savitā damūnāḥ hiraṇya pāṇiḥ pratidoṣam asthāt
translated: with his golden tongue for fresh prosperity guard me let no evil-wisher rule over me🔽the god savitar the priest hath lifted up his arms of gold he hath sat down at the place of worship

original: ayohanuryajato mandrajihva ā dāśuṣe suvati bhūrivāmam🔽udū ayānupavakteva bāhū hiraṇyayā savitā supratīkā
analyzed: ayaḥ hanuḥ yajataḥ mandra jihvaḥ ā dāśuṣe suvati bhūri vāmam  udu ayānupavaktā iva bāhū hiraṇyayā savitā su pratīkā
translated: the god with iron jaws with pleasant tongue bestows much booty on the worshipper🔽savitar hath lifted up his arms as a priest his arms of gold of fair appearance

original: divo rohāṃsyaruhat pṛthivyā arīramat patayat kaccidabhvam
analyzed: divaḥ rohāṃsi aruhat pṛthivyāḥ arīramat patayat kaccit abhvam
translated: he hath mounted the heights of heaven and earth he hath moved on the back of the swift steed

original: vāmamadya savitarvāmamu śvo divedive vāmamasmabhyaṃ sāvīḥ
analyzed: vāmam adya savitar vāmam u śvas dive dive vāmam asmabhyam sāvīḥ
translated: Favour us this day, O Savitar, favour us tomorrow, day by day, O Savitar, grant us favour.

original: vāmasya hi kṣayasya deva bhūrerayā dhiyā vāmabhājaḥ syāma
analyzed: vāmasya hi kṣayasya deva bhūrerayā dhiyā vāma bhājaḥ syāma
translated: For by the favour of the God of wide dominion, O God, may we be partakers of favour.

original: indrāsomā mahi tad vāṃ mahitvaṃ yuvaṃ mahāni prathamāni cakrathuḥ
analyzed: indrāsomāḥ mahi tat vām mahi tvam yuvam mahāni prathamāni cakrathuḥ
translated: O Indra and Soma, great is that greatness of you two: you have made great and preeminent deeds.

original: yuvaṃ sūryaṃ vividathuryuvaṃ svarviśvā tamāṃsyahataṃ nidaśca
analyzed: yuvam sūryam vividathuḥ yuvam svar viśvā tamāṃsi ahatam nidaḥ ca
translated: You have discovered the sun, you have discovered heaven: you have destroyed all the darkness and the mists.

original: indrāsomā vāsayatha uṣāsamut sūryaṃ nayatho jyotiṣā saha
analyzed: indrāsomā vāsayathaḥ uṣāsamud sūryam nayathaḥ jyotiṣā saha
translated: O Indra and Soma, you cause the dawn to shine: you lead the sun with light.

original: upa dyāṃ skambhathuḥ skambhanenāprathataṃ pṛthivīṃ mātaraṃ vi
analyzed: upa dyām skambhathuḥ skambhanena aprathatam pṛthivīm mātaram vi
translated: You have supported the sky with your support: you have extended the earth, the mother.

original: indrāsomāvahimapaḥ pariṣṭhāṃ hatho vṛtramanu vāṃ dyauramanyata
analyzed: indrāsomau ahim apaḥ pariṣṭhām hathaḥ vṛtram anu vām dyauḥ amanyata
translated: O Indra and Soma, you have destroyed the waters of the flood: Dyaus has looked to you for help in slaying Vrtra.

original: prārṇāṃsyairayataṃ nadīnāmā samudrāṇipaprathuḥ purūṇi
analyzed: pra arṇāṃsi airayatam nadī nāmā samudrāṇipaprathuḥ purūṇi
translated: You have moved the waters of the ocean, the rivers: you have extended your great powers.

original: indrāsomā pakvamāmāsvantarni gavāmid dadhathurvakṣaṇāsu
analyzed: indrāsomā pakvam āmāsu antarni gavām id dadhathuḥ vakṣaṇāsu
translated: O Indra and Soma, you have placed the ripe within the unripe, as it were, in the flanks of the cows.

original: jagṛbhathuranapinaddhamāsu ruśaccitrāsu jagatīṣvantaḥ🔽indrāsomā yuvamaṅga tarutramapatyasācaṃ śrutyaṃ rarāthe
analyzed: jagṛbhathuḥ an apinaddham āsu ruśat citrāsu jagatīṣu antar 🔽indrāsomāḥ yuvam aṅga tarutram apatyasācam śrutyam rarāthe
translated: You have seized it in the variegated, moving ones, in the swift ones, in the spotted ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in the swift ones, in

original: yuvaṃ śuṣmaṃ naryaṃ carṣaṇibhyaḥ saṃ vivyathuḥ pṛtanāṣāhamugrā
analyzed: yuvam śuṣmam naryam carṣaṇibhyaḥ sam vivyathuḥ pṛtanāṣāham ugrā
translated: You have distributed strength and manly power to men, you are mighty conquerors in battle

original: yo adribhit prathamajā ṛtāvā bṛhaspatirāṅgiraso haviṣmān
analyzed: yaḥ adri bhid prathama jāḥ ṛtāvā bṛhaspatiḥ āṅgirasaḥ haviṣmān
translated: He who cleft the rock, firstborn, righteous, Brihaspati, son of Angiras, rich in oblations

original: dvibarhajmā prāgharmasat pitā na ā rodasī vṛṣabho roravīti
analyzed: dvibarhajmā prāgharmasad pitā naḥ ā rodasī vṛṣabhaḥ roravīti
translated: The bull who dwells in the two worlds, the father, roars to the two world-halves

original: janāya cid ya īvata u lokaṃ bṛhaspatirdevahūtau cakāra
analyzed: janāya cit yaḥ īvate u lokam bṛhaspatiḥ deva hūtau cakāra
translated: For the people, even for him who is powerful, Brihaspati has made a place in the invocation of the gods

original: ghnan vṛtrāṇi vi puro dardarīti jayañchatrūnramitrān pṛtsu sāhan🔽bṛhaspatiḥ samajayad vasūni maho vrajān gomato deva eṣaḥ
analyzed: ghnan vṛtrāṇi vi puraḥ dardarīti jayan śatrūn ramitrān pṛtsu sāhan  bṛhaspatiḥ samajayat vasūni mahaḥ vrajān gomataḥ devaḥ eṣaḥ
translated: Slaying the Vr̥itras, he cleaves the forts asunder, conquering the foes, the enemies, in battles🔽Brihaspati has won great treasures, the god who possesses the great stalls of cattle

original: apaḥ siṣāsan svarapratīto bṛhaspatirhantyamitramarkaiḥ
analyzed: apaḥ siṣāsan svara pratītaḥ bṛhaspatiḥ hanti amitram arkaiḥ
translated: Desiring the waters, he who is invoked in the Svara, Brihaspati slays the foe with his rays

original: somārudrā dhārayethāmasuryaṃ pra vāmiṣṭayo 'ramaśnuvantu
analyzed: somārudrā dhārayethām asuryam pra vām iṣṭayaḥ ramaśnuvantu
translated: O Soma and Rudra, support the sun's realm; may your worshippers find delight in you

original: damedame sapta ratnā dadhānā śaṃ no bhūtaṃ dvipadeśaṃ catuṣpade
analyzed: damedame sapta ratnā dadhānā śam naḥ bhūtam dvipadā īśam catuṣpade
translated: Placing in every house seven treasures, be ye for our good to bipeds and to quadrupeds

original: somārudrā vi vṛhataṃ viṣūcīmamīvā yā no gayamāviveśa
analyzed: somārudrā vi vṛhatam viṣūcīm amīvā yā naḥ gayam āviveśa
translated: O Soma and Rudra, drive away the evil disease that has entered our dwelling

original: āre bādhethāṃ nirṛtiṃ parācairasme bhadrā sauśravasāni santu
analyzed: āre bādhethām nirṛtim parācais asme bhadrā sauśravasāni santu
translated: Keep Nirr̥iti far away from us; to us be good and glorious things

original: somārudrā yuvametānyasme viśvā tanūṣu bheṣajāni dhattam
analyzed: somārudrā yuvam etāni asme viśvā tanūṣu bheṣajāni dhattam
translated: O Soma and Rudra, you two bestow upon us all these healing remedies in our bodies.

original: ava syataṃ muñcataṃ yan no asti tanūṣu baddhaṃ kṛtameno asmat
analyzed: ava syatam muñcatam yat naḥ asti tanūṣu baddham kṛta menaḥ asmat
translated: Loosen and release whatever is bound in our bodies, the sin we have committed.

original: tigmāyudhau tigmahetī suśevau somārudrāviha su mṛḷataṃ naḥ
analyzed: tigma āyudhau tigma hetī su śevau somārudrau iha su mṛḍatam naḥ
translated: O Soma and Rudra, sharp-weaponed, sharp-darting, very gracious, be kind to us here.

original: pra no muñcataṃ varuṇasya pāśād gopāyataṃ naḥ sumanasyamānā
analyzed: pra naḥ muñcatam varuṇasya pāśāt gopāyatam naḥ sumanasyamānā
translated: Release us from the noose of Varuna. Protect us, being favorably inclined.

original: jīmūtasyeva bhavati pratīkaṃ yad varmī yāti samadāmupasthe
analyzed: jīmūtasya iva bhavati pratīkam yat varmī yāti samadām upasthe
translated: The appearance of the cloud is like that of him who, clad in armor, goes to the assembly.

original: anāviddhayā tanvā jaya tvaṃ sa tvā varmaṇo mahimā pipartu🔽dhanvanā gā dhanvanājiṃ jayema dhanvanā tīvrāḥ samado jayema
analyzed: an āviddhayā tanvā jaya tvam sa tvā varmaṇaḥ mahimā pipartu  dhanvanā gāḥ dhanvanā ājim jayema dhanvanā tīvrāḥ samadaḥ jayema
translated: Conquer with an unpierced body. May the greatness of your armor protect you.🔽With the bow we will win cattle, with the bow we will win the race, with the bow we will win the fierce contests.

original: dhanuḥ śatrorapakāmaṃ kṛṇoti dhanvanā sarvāḥ pradiśo jayema
analyzed: dhanuḥ śatroḥ apakāmam kṛṇoti dhanvanā sarvāḥ pradiśaḥ jayema
translated: The bow makes the enemy's desire fail. With the bow we will win in all directions.

original: vakṣyantīvedā ganīganti karṇaṃ priyaṃ sakhāyaṃ pariṣasvajānā
analyzed: vakṣyantī vedā ganīganti karṇam priyam sakhāyam pariṣasvajānā
translated: The bowstring seems to speak, it goes to the ear, embracing the dear friend.

original: yoṣeva śiṅkte vitatādhi dhanvañ jyā iyaṃ samane pārayantī
analyzed: yoṣā iva śiṅkte vitatā adhi dhanvam jyā iyam samane pārayantī
translated: It rattles like a woman, stretched over the bow, this bowstring leading in battle.

original: te ācarantī samaneva yoṣā māteva putraṃ bibhṛtāmupasthe
analyzed: te ācarantī samanā iva yoṣā mātā iva putram bibhṛtām upasthe
translated: They move around like two women in a dance, they carry him like a mother her son in her lap.

original: apa śatrūn vidhyatāṃ saṃvidāne ārtnī ime viṣphurantīamitrān
analyzed: apa śatrūn vidhyatām saṃvidāne ārtnī ime viṣphurantīamitrān
translated: Let these two quivers, in accord, pierce the enemies. Let them burst forth against the foes.

original: bahvīnāṃ pitā bahurasya putraściścā kṛṇoti samanāvagatya
analyzed: bahvīnām pitā bahurasya putraḥ ciścā kṛṇoti samanā avagatya
translated: The father of many, the son of many, he makes them one by coming together.
