original: iṣudhiḥ saṅkāḥ pṛtanāśca sarvāḥ pṛṣṭhe ninaddho jayati prasūtaḥ
analyzed: iṣudhiḥ saṅkāḥ pṛtanāḥ ca sarvāḥ pṛṣṭhe ninaddhaḥ jayati prasūtaḥ
translated: The quiver, fastened on the back, victorious, set free, conquers all the battles and hosts.

original: rathe tiṣṭhan nayati vājinaḥ puro yatrayatra kāmayate suṣārathiḥ
analyzed: rathe tiṣṭhan nayati vājinaḥ puras yatra yatra kāmayate suṣārathiḥ
translated: Standing in the chariot, the skillful charioteer leads the strong horses wherever he desires.

original: abhīśūnāṃ mahimānaṃ panāyata manaḥ paścādanu yachanti raśmayaḥ
analyzed: abhīśūnām mahimānam panāyata manaḥ paścāt anu yacchanti raśmayaḥ
translated: They proclaim the greatness of the reins; the reins follow behind the mind.

original: tīvrān ghoṣān kṛṇvate vṛṣapāṇayo 'śvā rathebhiḥ sahavājayantaḥ
analyzed: tīvrān ghoṣān kṛṇvate vṛṣa pāṇayaḥ śvā rathebhiḥ sahavājayantaḥ
translated: The bulls make loud sounds; the horses, in company with the chariots, rejoice together.

original: avakrāmantaḥ prapadairamitrān kṣiṇanti śatrūnranapavyayantaḥ
analyzed: avakrāmantaḥ prapadaiḥ amitrān kṣiṇanti śatrūn rana pavyayantaḥ
translated: Approaching the enemies with their feet, they destroy the foes, not to be deceived.

original: rathavāhanaṃ havirasya nāma yatrāyudhaṃ nihitamasya varma
analyzed: rathavāhanam haviḥ asya nāma yatra āyudham nihitam asya varma
translated: The chariot-borne offering is his name, where his weapon and armor are laid.

original: tatrā rathamupa śagmaṃ sadema viśvāhā vayaṃ sumanasyamānāḥ🔽svāduṣaṃsadaḥ pitaro vayodhāḥ kṛchreśritaḥ śaktīvanto gabhīrāḥ
analyzed: tatra ratham upa śagmam sadema viśvāhā vayam sumanasyamānāḥ  svāduṣaṃsadaḥ pitaraḥ vayaḥ dhāḥ kṛchreśritaḥ śaktīvantaḥ gabhīrāḥ
translated: There, on the auspicious chariot, may we sit down all our lives, with friendly minds.🔽The Pitrs, whose seat is sweet, who bestow life, who are difficult to approach, who are powerful, profound,

original: citrasenā iṣubalā amṛdhrāḥ satovīrā uravo vrātasāhāḥ
analyzed: citra senāḥ iṣu balāḥ amṛdhrāḥ satovīrāḥ uravaḥ vrāta sāhāḥ
translated: with variegated armies, with arrows, unbaffled, with good heroes, with clans that conquer.

original: brāhmaṇāsaḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ śive no dyāvāpṛthivī anehasā
analyzed: brāhmaṇāsaḥ pitaraḥ somyāsaḥ śive naḥ dyāvāpṛthivī anehasā
translated: The Brahmans, the Fathers, the friends of Soma, may Heaven and Earth, auspicious, free from sickness,

original: pūṣā naḥ pātu duritād ṛtāvṛdho rakṣā mākirno aghaśaṃsa īśata
analyzed: pūṣā naḥ pātu duritāt ṛtāvṛdhaḥ rakṣā mākir naḥ agha śaṃsaḥ īśata
translated: May Pusan, increaser of truth, protect us from evil. May no evil-wisher rule over us.

original: suparṇaṃ vaste mṛgo asyā danto gobhiḥ saṃnaddhā patati prasūtā
analyzed: suparṇam vaste mṛgaḥ asyāḥ dantaḥ gobhiḥ saṃnaddhā patati prasūtā
translated: She wears the bird, her tooth is the deer. Bound with cows, she flies forth,

original: yatrā naraḥ saṃ ca vi ca dravanti tatrāsmabhyamiṣavaḥ śarma yaṃsan
analyzed: yatrā naraḥ sam ca vi ca dravanti tatra asmabhyam iṣavaḥ śarma yaṃsan
translated: Where men run together and run apart, there let the arrows give us protection.

original: ṛjīte pari vṛṃdhi no 'śmā bhavatu nastanūḥ
analyzed: ṛjīte pari vṛṃdhi naḥ śmā bhavatu naḥ tanūḥ
translated: O sharp one, surround us. Let our body be a stone.

original: somo adhi bravītu no 'ditiḥ śarma yachatu🔽ā jaṅghanti sānveṣāṃ jaghanānupa jighnate🔽aśvājani pracetaso 'śvān samatsu codaya
analyzed: somaḥ adhi bravītu naḥ ditiḥ śarma yacchatu  ā jaṅghanti sa anveṣām jaghanān upa jighnate  aśvājani pracetasaḥ śvān samatsu codaya
translated: May Soma speak to us. May Aditi grant us protection.🔽They strike the tops of these, he strikes the buttocks.🔽O horse-womb, O wise one, urge the horses in the battles.

original: ahiriva bhogaiḥ paryeti bāhuṃ jyāyā hetiṃ paribādhamānaḥ
analyzed: ahiḥ iva bhogaiḥ paryeti bāhum jyāyāḥ hetim paribādhamānaḥ
translated: Like a snake with its coils, he goes around the arm, warding off the weapon of the bowstring.

original: hastaghno viśvā vayunāni vidvān pumān pumāṃsaṃ pari pātu viśvataḥ
analyzed: hastaghnaḥ viśvā vayunāni vidvān pumān pumāṃsam pari pātu viśvatas
translated: The hand-striker, knowing all the ways, may the male protect the male on every side.

original: ālāktā yā ruruśīrṣṇyatho yasyā ayo mukham
analyzed: ālāktā yā ruru śīrṣṇī atho yasyāḥ ayaḥ mukham
translated: She who is smeared with oil on the head of the Ruru deer, and whose mouth is of iron,

original: idaṃ parjanyaretasa iṣvai devyai bṛhan namaḥ
analyzed: idam parjanya retase iṣvai devyai bṛhat namaḥ
translated: This great homage to the rain-born, to the swift, to the goddess.

original: avasṛṣṭā parā pata śaravye brahmasaṃśite
analyzed: avasṛṣṭā parā pata śaravye brahma saṃśite
translated: Released, fly away, O arrow, sharpened by Brahman.

original: gachāmitrānpra padyasva mānūṣāṃ kaṃ canocchiṣaḥ
analyzed: gaccha amitrān pra padyasva mā anūṣām kam cana ucchiṣaḥ
translated: Go to our enemies, fall upon them, spare not a single man.

original: yatra bāṇāḥ sampatanti kumārā viśikhā iva
analyzed: yatra bāṇāḥ sampatanti kumārāḥ viśikhāḥ iva
translated: Where the arrows fly together like young maidens' glances,

original: tatrā no brahmaṇas patiraditiḥ śarma yachatu viśvāhā śarma yachatu
analyzed: tatra naḥ brahmaṇaḥ patiḥ aditiḥ śarma yacchatu viśvāhā śarma yacchatu
translated: There may the Lord of prayer and Aditi grant us protection, may he grant us protection for all time.

original: marmāṇi te varmaṇā chādayāmi somastvā rājāmṛtenānu vastām
analyzed: marmāṇi te varmaṇā chādayāmi somaḥ tvā rājā amṛtena anu vastām
translated: I cover thy vital parts with armour. Let king Soma with his nectar anoint thee.

original: urorvarīyo varuṇaste kṛṇotu jayantaṃ tvānu devāmadantu
analyzed: uroḥ varīyaḥ varuṇaḥ te kṛṇotu jayantam tvā anu devāḥ adantu
translated: May Varuna make thy breast broad. May the gods rejoice in thee as thou art conquering.

original: yo naḥ svo araṇo yaśca niṣṭyo jighāṃsati
analyzed: yaḥ naḥ svaḥ araṇaḥ yaḥ ca niṣṭyaḥ jighāṃsati
translated: The one who hates us from our own people and the one who hates us from our neighbours,

original: devāstaṃsarve dhūrvantu brahma varma mamāntaram
analyzed: devāḥ tam sarve dhūrvantu brahma varma mama antaram
translated: May all the gods crush him. May the prayer be my armour within.
